title: Forensic Psychologist - Remote – full-time position
description:
**RESPONSIBILITIES:**

Conduct semi-structured interviews and psychological testing for immigration, criminal, and civil courts.

Provide expert testimony, participate in depositions, and consult with attorneys and other experts.

Assist in the preparation of psychological reports.

Assist in the supervision and training of other professionals.

**In addition to the full-time position described above, qualified applicants will be given the opportunity to earn additional income as independent contractors. Qualified applicants will be given the opportunity to conduct additional evaluations on their own time and at a rate to be determined on a case-by-case basis.**

**QUALIFICATIONS AND EXPERIENCE**

Ph.D. or Psy.D. in clinical psychology from APA accredited program.

Must be Florida Licensed.

Must be Psych Pact eligible.

Must be bilingual (English Spanish).

Experienced in forensic psychological interviewing and testing.

Experienced providing expert testimony.

**SALARY AND BENEFITS**

Competitive salary commensurate with experience.

Contributions to Simple IRA.

Malpractice insurance for work conducted for this employer.

Health Care stipend.

Telephone Stipend.

Paid time off.

Job Type: Full-time

Pay: From $80,000.00 per year

Benefits:

* Flexible schedule
* Health insurance
* Paid time off
* Retirement plan

Schedule:

* Monday to Friday

Work setting:

* Private practice

Application Question(s):

* Did you graduate from a doctoral program that is APA accredited?
* Are you eligible to apply for Psy Pact?

Education:

* license to practice as Licensed Psychologist (Required)

title: Remote School Psychologist
description:
Hello School Psychologists,

Are you looking to have the flexibility to work remotely while working in the schools? Come work with a local, women, and therapist run company doing what you love! We are looking for a School Psychologist (remote) for the remainder of the 2023-2024 school year for a Washington school district. This is a part time position with the possibility of being full time.

Job Details:

* Position starting ASAP
* 0.4 FTE
* Washington State school district
* Student evaluations
* IEP Reports, IEP Meetings
* Staff Meetings
* Documentation
* Collaboration with various Special Education team members

Requirements:

* Master’s degree in School Psychologist or equivalent endorsement
* **Washington ESA Cert Required before starting**
* NCSP a plus

Benefits & Perks:

* Paid Sick Leave
* Healthcare Benefits\\*\\*
* 401k matching\\*\\*
* Reimbursements for licensing, continuing education and other professional costs
* Mileage reimbursement at IRS rate
* W2 employee
* General and professional liability insurance coverage
* Referral bonuses
* No non-compete clauses
* Paid time off for volunteer work and donation matching for charities

\\*\\*for 0.8 FTE and higher

***Why Work With Us***

Ampersand Therapy empowers you to serve your students! We're a small company, local to Western WA and are proud to be women, minority and therapist owned and run. We began our career working in the districts and also as contractors. We sought to create an alternative to working with big staffing companies. The result is a small team of like-minded specialists who are striving to create a company that we would want to work for. Because we are therapists ourselves, we are deeply appreciative of and understand the work that you do. We're also in a unique position to be able to support and mentor those who are new to this practice area.

We're so passionate about students that we're often working in the schools ourselves. You might find us doing treatments alongside you!

***Our Values***

* **Focus on equity** - We are listening and learning so that we can create a climate of equity. Diversity is multi-faceted, spanning race, ethnicity, gender, sexual orientation, age, abilities, socioeconomic status, and religion, among many other identities. We believe our team must create a culture of equity and opportunity for all people. We are collecting and offering resources for your use in addressing racism and discrimination in school. In addition, we support and donate to charities including The Conscious Kid.
* **Focus on community** - You can find us supporting local and national organizations which serve the community. In our spare time, we volunteer with and support organizations including Special Olympics, Project Canine and the Moth. We empower you to support causes that are meaningful to you.
* **Focus on the earth** - We support sustainable work in all aspects of our company including reducing paper use by going digital; finding lower-waste treatment options and pledging to have a negative carbon footprint

Job Type: Part-time

Pay: $63.00 - $76.00 per hour

Benefits:

* 401(k)
* 401(k) matching
* Flexible schedule
* Health insurance
* Paid time off
* Professional development assistance
* Relocation assistance
* Retirement plan

Schedule:

* Day shift
* Monday to Friday
* No nights
* No weekends

Education:

* Master's (Required)

License/Certification:

* Degree in SCHOOL Psychology (Required)

Work Location: Remote

title: Child Psychologist
description:
**Thriving Center of Psychology (https://thrivingcenterofpsych.com/)** is an out-of-network group practice with psychologists, psychiatrists, and mental health professionals. You have full autonomy over your work and schedule while having the support a group practice setting offers!

Thriving Center of Psychology is dedicated to delivering evidence-based treatments and we have the highest standard for clinical care. In addition to providing exceptional clinical care, we also believe in prioritizing healthy and happy therapists. All of our therapists value community and culture in the group practice setting, as well as integrated care for clients. Find out why we are one of the fastest-growing private practices in the country!

We are seeking **Licensed Child Psychologists** to join our team in **Seattle, WA!** Our therapists provide virtual therapy, with availability to go in-office at least once a week. We are looking for Licensed Child Psychologists with availability to carry a full-time caseload of at least 20 sessions a week. We warmly welcome **early-career** Psychologists!

**Among the benefits of working with Thriving Center of Psychology:**

* Fully flexible schedule set entirely by you!
* Diverse client/patient base based on your preferred populations & areas of expertise!
* Full Administrative + Clinical Support (clinical help is available 24/7)!
* Weekly case consultation groups to provide support!
* Monthly ClassPass/Gym Reimbursement!
* Weekly Live Yoga Classes (yoga & breath work)!
* Free Continuing Education Credit Courses & yearly CEU stipend!
* We support young & upcoming professionals!
* **Full-Time, 1099 Option Available!**
* **W2 Option Available- Salary, Insurance Benefits & 401K!**

**What we’re looking for:**

* Active, Clear license in **Washington**
* Psy.D or Ph.D. in a Clinical Psychology discipline preferred
* Must have experience and willingness to see children and/or adolescents
* Must be proficient in evidence-based treatment modalities

* Vision insurance

* Choose your own hours
* Monday to Friday

Work setting:

* Remote
* Telehealth

* Licensed Psychologist Credentials (Required)

Location:

title: Licensed Child Behavioral Therapist or Psychologist (Remote NC)
description:
**About Fort Health:**


**Fort Health** is a child and adolescent mental health company that is on a mission to "Opening more paths to better care for more families". Today, 50% of children in the US with a mental health issue do not receive care, and 60% of US counties do not have even a single practicing psychiatrist. This is a massive area of need, impacting 17M children in the United States with a market size greater than $50B.



Our vision is to create an integrated set of support resources to understand, assess, diagnose and treat mental health challenges through digital tools and access to virtual clinicians. We are partnered with the industry leading child psychotherapy non-profit institution in the US, the **Child Mind Institute**, who is helping us build clinical protocols, train our providers, and create proprietary content. Our motto is: 'We Are Stronger Together' and our model is to partner with pediatricians, insurance plans, and parents/caregivers to open more paths to better mental health care for more children and adolescents.



Come work for a company with an inspiring mission and a hard-working, supportive team making a difference!


**About the Role:**



We know that clinicians are the backbone of our company. Everything we do incorporates a clinicians' mindset so that we can provide them with the best job experience, so that they can provide our patients with the best treatment.



As part of our clinical team, you will be responsible for delivering high-quality, evidenced-based virtual mental health care for children and their families. You will provide 1:1 therapy sessions with patients, families and caregivers. Our therapists work with the broader clinical team to provide personalized, holistic treatment plans for each family. Every therapist goes through a training program created and led by one of the leading organizations in child mental health. Leveraging their gold-standard evidence-based clinical experience, the Child Mind Institute has developed a proprietary clinical training program for use by Fort Health. Our clinicians work 1:1 with a supervisor to help them progress in their career goals and learnings. Lastly, we are looking for someone who wants to be a part of a growing healthcare startup that is focused on broadening access to affordable, high-quality mental health care for children and their families!


**Types of roles:** Full-time, part-time (20 or 25 hrs per week),1099


**Salary:** $75k to $90k annually


**Schedule:** Monday to Friday with option for Saturday and Sunday hours; Availability after 3pm ET is required


**In this role, you will:**


* Provide high-quality, evidence-based 1:1 therapy for children and their families.
* Collaborate with the clinical team to provide personalized treatment plans for every child and their family.
* Engage with other groups in the child's life - primary care physicians, educators, therapists, etc. - to ensure they're getting the holistic treatment they need.
* Constantly communicating and working with the family to drive the treatment plan forward.
* Meet routinely with the leadership team to give feedback and thoughts on how to improve our clinical offering and our policies.
* Receive both individual and group supervision on a weekly basis to ensure you have the support you need to be successful
* Have access to consultation and materials from our non-profit partner to bring to bear the most cutting edge treatment protocols and methods for our clients.
* Expand and strengthen your clinical skills through CMI's training program, and take advantage of additional ongoing training and educational opportunities, conferences, and more.


**What we are looking for:**


* Psychologist (PhD/PsyD), Licensed Clinical Social Worker (LCSW), Licensed Marriage and Family Therapist (LMFT), Licensed Professional Counselor (LPC) or Licensed Mental Health Counselor (LMHC)
* Licensed independently to practice in the state of **North Carolina** (required)
* Received degree from an accredited training program
* 2-3 years of direct clinical experience post licensure working with children (ages 4-19) and their families
* Experience and training in delivering evidence-based treatments (e.g., CBT, ACT, DBT)
* Strong experience with diagnostic evaluations and symptom assessment with children and adolescents.
* Strong skills in engaging parents and children, developing appropriate treatment planning, and delivering time-limited outpatient psychotherapy treatment
* Excellent verbal and written communication skills
* Experience providing teletherapy
* Must have reliable, high-speed internet access with minimum speeds of 50 Mbps download and 10 Mbps upload
* Desire to work with and learn from some of the top child mental health experts in the field


**Time Expectations:**



Your time will be divided between:


* Clinic Time: 75% of your Clinic Time is devoted to scheduled sessions with patients.
* Administrative Time: 20% of your Clinic Time is scheduled to respond to between-session messages or hold unanticipated sessions.
* Team meetings: 1-2 hours per week. Team Meeting, Group Supervision, Case Conference, All Hands
* Individual supervision: 0.5 -1hr/week.
* There is no call requirement; major and minor holidays are off without patient obligations.


**Why join us?**


* Competitive compensation and benefits package if eligible
* Generous paid time off including paid company holidays, mental health days (varies based on role type)
* 1 Paid week of company-wide shutdown between Christmas and New Year's Day
* 4 weeks of structured virtual training with the Child Mind Institute; developed exclusively for Fort Health clinicians
* Full malpractice coverage while you are providing care at Fort Health
* Yearly professional development stipend
* No required call
* Remote work environment with meaningful virtual touchpoints with the team
* Periodic team offsites to foster team bonding and strong company culture
* Ability to be part of a startup and help build a new treatment model
* Collaborative and supportive mission-oriented work environment


*Fort Health is a proud Equal Opportunity Employer – we recruit, train, compensate and promote our team members based on qualifications. We know how important it is not only to include, but to actively seek out a diversity of opinions and voices.*


*We want to hear from you regardless of your race, religion, national origin, sex, gender identity, sexual orientation, disability, age, veteran status, or any other applicable legally protected characteristics*

title: 1099 Licensed Child Behavioral Therapist or Psychologist (Remote PA)
description:
**About Fort Health:**


**Fort Health** is a mental health company that is on a mission to "Opening more paths to better care for more families". We're all about making a real difference in the lives of children and adolescents. With a whopping 50% of kids in the US missing out on mental health care, we're determined to change that statistic. And with a market size of over $50 billion, we're not just dreaming big - we're making it happen!



Our vision? Picture this: a world where every child has access to the support they need to thrive mentally and emotionally. With the help of our amazing partners, like the **Child Mind Institute**, we're creating a one-of-a-kind support system that combines digital tools with virtual clinicians. Because at Fort Health, we believe "we're stronger together".


**About the Role:**



Clinicians are the heart of our company. Everything we do incorporates a clinicians' mindset so that we can provide them with the best job experience, so that they can deliver top-notch care to our patients.



If you are someone who wants to be a part of a growing healthcare startup that is focused on broadening access to affordable, high-quality mental health care for children and their families, we would love to hear from you!


**Schedule:**1099 (Min 5 hrs per week), Availability after 3pm ET is required Monday to Friday with option for Saturday and Sunday hours.


**Salary:** This role offers **$85 per 55-minute session**. No-shows and late cancellations are paid.



Benefit from **paid weekly supervision** during the initial 4-6 weeks of patient care/employment, coupled with ongoing access to consultations with our clinical leadership. Additionally, you have the option to participate in weekly group supervision, case consultations, team meetings, and various professional development opportunities.


**In this role, your responsibilities will include:**


* Delivering high-quality, evidence-based 1:1 therapy tailored to the unique needs of children, teenagers, and their families.
* Collaborating closely with the clinical team to develop personalized treatment plans for each client and their family.
* Actively involving parents/caregivers in treatment sessions to foster collaboration and drive the treatment plan forward.
* Accessing consultation and resources from our non-profit partner to integrate cutting-edge treatment protocols and methods into your practice, ensuring the highest standard of care for our clients.
* Completing and signing your notes within 24 hours


**What we are looking for:**


* Psychologist (PhD, PsyD), Licensed Clinical Social Worker (LCSW), Licensed Marriage and Family Therapist (LMFT), Licensed Professional Counselor (LPC) or Licensed Mental Health Counselor (LMHC).
* Licensed independently to practice in the state of **Pennsylvania.** Multiple state licenses preferred.
* Minimum 3-years of direct clinical experience post licensure working with children (ages 4-24) and their families.
* Self guided determination to complete your notes within 24 hours.
* Experience and training in delivering evidence-based treatments (e.g., CBT, ACT, DBT).
* Strong experience with diagnostic evaluations and symptom assessment with children and adolescents.
* Strong skills in engaging parents and children, developing appropriate treatment planning, and delivering time-limited outpatient psychotherapy treatment.
* Excellent verbal and written communication skills.
* Must have reliable, high-speed internet access with minimum speeds of 50 Mbps download and 10 Mbps upload.
* Desire to work with and learn from some of the top child mental health experts in the field.


**What would sweeten the deal:**


* Existing credentialing with any of the following: Aetna, BCBS, United Healthcare, CIGNA in each licensed state.
* CAQH credentialing already set up.
* NPI number active
* Multiple state licensure.
* Experience providing teletherapy.


**Why join us?**


* Access to clinical support and consultation from clinical leaders, peer connection, and professional development.
* Full malpractice coverage while you are providing care at Fort Health.
* Flexible scheduling within afterschool and weekend hours.
* No on call responsibilities!
* Focus on delivering clinical care without the burden of administrative tasks, referral generation, and insurance/payment collection.
* 100% remote work environment with available meaningful touchpoints with the team - work from anywhere in the US!
* Ability to be part of a startup and help build a new treatment model.


**Resources:**


* To apply for NPI, please visit https://nppes.cms.hhs.gov/#/. It takes ~2 to 4-weeks.
* To apply for CAQH, please visit https://www.caqh.org/providers. It takes ~3 to 4-days.

  


*Fort Health is a proud Equal Opportunity Employer – we recruit, train, compensate and promote our team members based on qualifications. We know how important it is not only to include, but to actively seek out a diversity of opinions and voices.*


*We want to hear from you regardless of your race, religion, national origin, sex, gender identity, sexual orientation, disability, age, veteran status, or any other applicable legally protected characteristics.*

title: Licensed Psychologist
company: New U Therapy Center & Family Services, Inc.
description:
Are you a passionate mental health provider? Is work-life balance important to you? Do you want to be part of a strong team of experienced professionals? New U Therapy Center & Family Services, Inc. is the perfect place for you!


We are seeking **Part-time and Full-time Licensed Psychologists** to join our innovative and dynamic teams.


At our California and Florida offices, we have comprehensive programs and multidisciplinary teams of medical providers and therapists dedicated to helping clients live healthy, confident, and fulfilling lives. We provide outpatient services in-clinic and virtually, including: individual, couples, and family therapy; IOP for Mental Health and Co-occurring Disorders; as well as medication evaluation and management. We embrace cutting-edge, evidence-based, and psychedelic treatments. We are a one-stop shop, providing all services under one roof for easy collaboration between professionals.


We have an amazing network of experienced multilingual and multicultural clinicians and clinical supervisors who specialize in various treatments including EMDR, DBT, Eating Disorders, LGBTQIA+, substance use, trauma-informed treatments, and more! Our fast-paced and collaborative environment provides opportunities for expansion as well as personal and professional growth.


New U Therapy Center & Family Services offers therapists the flexibility to work in a hybrid or virtual, private-practice-like environment. Clinicians have the opportunity to design their own work schedules.


Please read more about New U here: .

**Job Types:**

* Part-time Licensed Psychologist (20 clinical hrs)
* Full-time Licensed Psychologist (30 clinical hrs)

**Rates:**

* $60-$85.00 per clinical hour. Rates may vary based on education and experience.

**Full-time and part-time benefits:**

* $1000 sign-on bonus
* Competitive Compensation
* Performance-based Bonuses
* Collaborative and Friendly Work Culture
* 401K with up to 3% matching
* Credentialing to insurance panels provided
* Training in private practice
* Supplemental AFLAC insurance
* Sick Time Off
* Monthly company lunches
* Team-building and culture-building activities
* Annual corporate in-person events.
* Professional development and trainings
* Annual CEU reimbursement stipend
* Access to innovative trainings such as ketamine-assisted therapy and others
* Full administrative team support

**Additional Full-time benefits:**

* 75% Health, Dental, and Vision Insurance Coverage
* 100% Life Insurance Coverage
* Six paid holidays
* Two weeks paid vacation time

**Requirements**

* Active CA license
* Strong demonstrated commitment to professional skills including legal and ethical standards
* Must be available to work during core business hours Monday through Friday but scheduling is flexible.

**Job Types:** Full-time, Part-time

**Salary:** $60.00 - $85.00 per hour

**Schedule:**

* Day shift
* Evening shift
* Monday to Friday

**Work setting:**

* Outpatient
* Private practice
* Remote
* Telehealth

**License/Certification:**

* Psychologist license in CA (Preferred)

**Work Location:** CA Remote

title: Licensed Mental Health Therapist - Remote
description:
**Student success starts with mental health.**



Daybreak Health partners with districts and schools to provide personalized mental health support to help students reach their full potential. Our teletherapy programs are designed to give each student access to high-quality, affordable, and culturally competent care that meets their unique needs.



We take pride in our partnership with over 60 school districts, impacting over a million students across the U.S., all in pursuit of ensuring every young individual has the foundation for both personal wellbeing and educational success.



**Join us to help solve the most defining problem of an entire generation.**



We're hiring dedicated therapists to provide remote psychotherapy to students. We offer both 1:1 therapy and family therapy, depending on the age and circumstances of the student. With the flexibility to select your working hours, manage your caseload, and choose the demographic you're most passionate about, we provide the perfect platform for you to design your ideal practice.

**Benefits of Joining Daybreak:**


* Competitive hourly rate with ***guaranteed pay for late cancellations and no-shows!***
* Earn an exceptional income while setting your own schedule
* Focus 100% on providing care
* We handle all the billing, credentialing, and admin tasks
* Tailored EHR system optimized for telehealth
* Enjoy work-life balance with our flexible telehealth model
* Collaborate with our highly skilled clinician community
* Supervision included for all Daybreak therapists


**Requirements:**


* Active, independent clinical license (LCSW, LMHC, LMFT, Licensed Psychologist)


**Are you ready to make a lasting impact on young lives?** Join our team of providers who trust Daybreak and experience the power of mission-driven work.

title: Mental Health Therapist
description:
**Mental Health Therapist - "REMOTE"**

**Nucleus Healthcare** is searching for a **Mental Health Therapist** to work with one of our prestigious clients, the #1 telehealth provider for the treatment of obsessive-compulsive disorder (OCD). OCD is one of the most severe, prevalent, and misunderstood mental health conditions. Our client creates access to online therapy for people with OCD through a telehealth platform. In the app, members can quickly access and schedule live, face-to-face video therapy sessions with the national network of licensed therapists that specialize in Exposure and Response Prevention Therapy (ERP) - considered the "gold standard" in OCD treatment.

Our client takes pride in helping people reclaim their lives with clinically proven OCD treatment, by removing barriers to OCD care, and reducing the stigma associated with OCD. Our client is changing the world and needs other like-minded individuals to accelerate and expand its efforts.

**About the Role**

Our client is looking for a Licensed Therapist (LP, LMHC, LMFT, LICSW)\\_ **based in the U.S.**\\_to join its team.

Our client wants providers to focus on what's most important - treating and caring for their members. There are teams dedicated to handling marketing, billing, credentialing, and scheduling. Therapists will use valuable previous clinical experience, good judgment, and clinical guidelines to discern when to refer members to external resources. Providers will collaborate with a network of psychiatrists and therapists to help develop and reinforce treatment decisions.

You'll enjoy growth and support through ongoing consultation with other team members; specialized clinical training with experienced OCD providers; information on the latest research advancements in the field; technical support and clinical protocols; 1:1 mentorship to discuss complex cases; and an open, receptive environment to provide feedback.

**What You'll Do**

* Help people with OCD get better and stay better by providing top-notch care through diagnoses, assessments, and evidence-based psychotherapy via video platform
* Manage your caseload and schedule
* Maintain complete and timely clinical documentation
* Participate in clinical consultation, training, and advance your knowledge and practice of evidence-supported treatments for OCD
* Collaborate with a network of providers to help develop and reinforce treatment decisions

**Requirements vary between full-time and contractor roles, at a high level:**

* Full Time Providers:
* 40-hour work week
* Complete 28 hours of direct clinical work per week
* Attend 2 hours of weekly group clinical consultation
* Have 6 hours of weeknight availability for Member Sessions or 4 hours of weekend availability for Member Sessions per week
* Will participate in and complete cross-license application process during Onboarding
* Open and willing to treat children and adolescents after attending exclusive Child and Adolescent training

**Who You Are**

* Full and unrestricted license in good standing to practice in your state.
* Master's Degree Required
* Licensed Psychologist, Licensed Mental Health Counselor, Licensed Marriage & Family Therapist, Licensed Independent Clinical Social Worker

title: Telehealth Therapist REMOTE (LCSW/LMHC/LMFT)
description:
Nassau Psychology PC is a vibrant, established, well-run, group psychotherapy practice in Nassau County. We're looking for a licensed Clinical Psychologist, Licensed Mental Health Counselor (LMHC), Licensed Clinical Social Worker (LCSW), or Licensed Marriage Family Therapist (LMFT) to join our team!

We offer healing, hope and possibilities for adults, adolescents, children and couples through psychotherapy and psychoeducation that recognize the value, strengths, and resources of all we serve. We are seeking experienced mental health providers who demonstrate the heart and skills needed to help our valued clients and who want to be a part of a flourishing team. Nassau Psychology helps therapists focus on therapy by taking care of the business side of a clinical practice.

We provide supervision, referrals, marketing, full billing and scheduling services, administrative support, beautifully furnished office suites and a fun and cohesive team of therapists. The Position is fee for service with reimbursement for any late cancellations and no shows. *This opportunity is ideal for the highly skilled therapist who would like to work in a thriving group practice setting while enjoying a full-spectrum compensation package including competitive pay, medical, dental & vision benefits , 401k matching, paid sick leave, professional development funds - - without the work, headaches, or financial investment of running a business.*

As a group, we strive to provide psychotherapy that deepens our clients understanding of themselves and their relationships. To that end, we use psychodynamic, gestalt, and family systems theories to deepen our work. At the same time, we strive to provide quick symptom relief, integrating the use of CBT, mindfulness and other practices in our work as well. We regularly consult with each other on cases and benefit from different perspectives. There are opportunities for peer-consultation, case conference and didactics as well.

**We are currently seeking full-time and part-time licensed therapists for our Wantagh, Cedarhurst, and Rockville Center locations.**

Full-time is considered to be 38 client hours per week including 3 evenings, or 2 evenings and Sunday for those who wish to work on Sunday.

Part-time work is considered to be a minimum of 20 hours per week including 2 evenings.

We are looking for therapists who can see diverse client populations and presenting issues. Experience working with couples is a plus, as well as experience working with children, but not a requirement. Ideal candidates possess the ability to conceptualize a case, understand underlying motivation and use a treatment model to drive treatment.

**Benefits for Licensed Therapists:**

* Medical, dental, and vision benefits for full-time staff
* Reimbursement funds for professional development training / CEU
* Paid Family Leave
* All employment taxes processed by Nassau Psychology
* Workers Comp & State Unemployment insurance provided
* Bimonthly automatic bank deposits based on all sessions provided during the previous 2 weeks - (no need to wait for protracted insurance reimbursement)
* All credentialing with insurance companies is done by the practice
* All new patients are on boarded by our New Patient Coordinators (all paperwork, forms etc. are completed by our staff) so you can focus on doing therapy
* We have a very steady referral stream of clients to easily fill your caseload
* All billing of insurance is handled on your behalf
* Feel at ease in well-appointed therapy rooms
* Weekly consultation group
* Opportunities to offer supervision
* Dedicated clinical support and group consultations
* Thriving and connected professional team with year-round social events, sharing each other's successes and milestones and professional growth opportunities

**Minimum Requirements for Licensed Therapists:**

* Master's degree and independent professional license in New York State (including Licensed Mental Health Counselor, Licensed Clinical Social Worker and Licensed Clinical Psychologist).
* Availability for afternoon / evening work is helpful. Weekend availability is a plus. Part-time or full-time work available.
* Currently, we are not considering applicants who are an Associate or Provisional level of license.
* Enrollment on insurance panels is welcomed, but not required.

**For more information about our practice, you can visit our website:**

www.nassaupsychology.org

To apply, please forward a cover letter of interest and resume to the email linked to this posting. You will then be emailed a list of questions - and your responses will help us determine the next steps in our process.

Nassau Psychology is committed to creating a diverse environment and is proud to be an equal opportunity employer. All qualified applicants will receive consideration for employment without regard to race, color, religion, gender, gender identity or expression, sexual orientation, national origin, genetics, disability, age, or veteran status.

Pay: $42.50 - $52.50 per hour

Benefits:

* 401(k)
* Dental insurance
* Flexible schedule
* Health insurance
* Paid time off
* Parental leave
* Professional development assistance
* Vision insurance

Schedule:

* Monday to Friday

Work setting:

* Remote

* Which current NY license do you have? LCSW/LMHC

title: Licensed Clinical Psychologist
description:
**Remote Licensed Clinical Psychologist**  

  

**BACKGROUND:**
Lapé Psychology Services invites you to apply and join our private practice. We are hiring Full-Time Psychologists who are empathetic, warm, and willing to work and learn as a team. We provide psychotherapy in a culturally sensitive manner and treatment is tailored to fit each individual.  

**JOB DESCRIPTION/RESPONSIBILITIES:*** Provide evidence-based psychotherapy (individuals, couples, and families).
* Diagnose psychological disorders based on DSM-5 criteria.
* Conduct diagnostic interviews.
* Provide therapy sessions using evidence-based and brief therapeutic models.
* Documents initial and ongoing psychological interventions.
* Develop treatment plans, monitor progress, and work within a team environment.
* Maintain complete, accurate, and current records of all clinical services rendered, includes initial evaluations, progress notes, summary notes and all other necessary documentation.

 **QUALIFICATIONS:*** Ph.D./PsyD in Clinical/Counseling Psychology.
* New York License.
* 1-2 years of experience required.

  

**BENEFITS:*** Health insurance (medical, dental, vision)
* Highly competitive pay: fee-for-service.
* Consistent referrals with steady scheduling.
* Modern technology - Electronic EHR and Telehealth platform.
* Full administrative support.
* Continuing education allowance.

**Job Types:** Full-time.  

  

**Pay Potential is fee-for-service:** $120,000.00 - $140,000.00 per year.  

  

**Schedule:*** Monday through Friday.
* Weekend hours are available

title: Experienced Industrial Psychologist
description:
We are looking for a highly skilled and experienced industrial psychologist to join our team. As an industrial psychologist, you will apply psychological principles to the workplace environment, focusing on improving employee productivity, satisfaction, and organizational effectiveness. You will work closely with management and HR departments to develop and implement strategies that enhance employee well-being, optimize job performance, and foster a positive work culture.

The selected candidate will take up the below mentioned responsibilities.

Conduct job analyses to identify job requirements, tasks, and competencies.

Design and implement employee selection and assessment procedures, including interviews, psychometric tests, and simulations.

Develop and deliver training programs aimed at enhancing employee skills, performance, and job satisfaction.

Provide individual and group counseling plans for employees experiencing work-related issues or stress.

Conduct research to identify trends and best practices in organizational psychology and apply findings to improve workplace processes and procedures.

Collaborate with management to design and implement organizational change initiatives, such as restructuring, mergers, and acquisitions.

Conduct surveys and analyze data to assess employee attitudes, job satisfaction, and organizational climate.

Advise management on strategies for improving employee engagement, motivation, and retention.

Stay current on relevant laws and regulations governing employment practices and ensure organizational compliance.

Collaborate with cross-functional teams to address organizational challenges and promote a positive and inclusive work environment.

**Please note we need an experienced candidate who has a proven experience of working as a Industrial Psychologist for a minimum of 2 years.**

**Candidates having a background in Organizational Psychology will be preferred.**

title: Psychologist for Children with Autism
description:
**Licensed Psychologist**
**Impact Lives. Build Relationships. Help Children and Families. Exceed Expectations.**  


Action Behavior Centers is seeking a Licensed Psychologist to lead our evaluation services for children suspected of having autism in the Phoenix area. This is an ideal role for a candidate with an interest in assessment and diagnosis of autism and other developmental disorders.  

**What you will be doing as a Licensed Psychologist at ABC:**  

* Conduct standardized assessments for autism evaluations including but not limited to: ADOS-2, CARS-2, ASRS, BASC-3, Vineland-3, DAS-II, DP-4 (training will be provided as needed)
* Write diagnostic evaluation reports based on interpretation of test results
* Provide diagnostic findings, recommendations, and feedback for families based on assessment results, and in collaboration with regional psychologist
* Some travel within the region is required

**What you will bring:**  

* Applicants must have completed their Doctorate degree in clinical, counseling or school psychology and be licensed in AZ
* Experience with psychological assessment of children, preferably with autism and other developmental differences
* Previous education in developmental disorders and related differential diagnosis
* Excellent written communication skills and attention to detail
* Natural ability to connect with children and parents.

**ABC Story**


**Our story began in 2017 in Austin, TX. We started with humble roots but big aspirations.**


**From 1 center in North Austin, our movement has inspired thousands of clinicians and operators. Today, the ABC community is 3000+ strong serving thousands of children with ASD.**


**Growth with intentionality: We have a maniac focus on our core values. Each center is purpose-built, each community of teammates is nurtured.**



**What we offer:**


* **Industry Leading Professional Development:** Learning is one of our core values! It's instilled in our culture through our initial training cohort, Learning in Action series, and annual leadership summit.
* **Benefits that Nurture the Mind, Body & Soul**: Student Loan Repayment, Maternity/Paternity Award of up to $3,000, FSA for childcare, Short Term Disability options, Restore Program, OM sabbatical, Headspace/NURX/DoorDash subscriptions, Team Happy Hours, FREE FOOD FRIDAYS!
* **Student Loan Repayment Employer Contributions**.
* **Heath insurance** coverage + Health Savings Accounts for **tax free benefits** on child care + medical expenses.
* **401K Retirement Plans** with company matching.
* Up to **25 paid days** off per year
* **Tuition discounts** at our university partnerships.


**See what others have said when they made the decision to grow with us!**

title: Mental Health Therapist - Massachusetts
description:
***About Us***

*NOCD is the #1 telehealth provider for the treatment of obsessive-compulsive disorder (OCD). OCD is one of the most severe, prevalent, and misunderstood mental health conditions. NOCD creates access to online therapy for people with OCD through our telehealth platform. In the NOCD app, members can quickly access and schedule live, face-to-face video therapy sessions with our national network of licensed therapists that specialize in Exposure and Response Prevention Therapy (ERP) - considered the "gold standard" in OCD treatment.*

*At NOCD, we help people reclaim their lives with clinically proven OCD treatment, by removing barriers to OCD care, and reducing the stigma associated with OCD. We're changing the world and need other like-minded individuals to accelerate and expand our efforts.*

**About the Role**

NOCD is looking for a Licensed Mental Health Therapist (LP, LMHC, LMFT, LICSW) based in Massachusetts to join our team.

As a provider with NOCD, we want you to focus on what's most important - treating and caring for our members. We have dedicated teams to handle marketing, billing, credentialing, and scheduling. Mental Health Therapists will use valuable previous clinical experience, good judgment, and our clinical guidelines to discern when to refer members to external resources. Providers will collaborate with our network of psychiatrists and therapists to help develop and reinforce treatment decisions.

You'll enjoy growth and support through: ongoing consultation with other team members; specialized clinical training with experienced OCD providers; information on the latest research advancements in the field; technical support and clinical protocols; 1:1 mentorship to discuss complex cases; and an open, receptive environment to provide feedback.

**What You'll Do**

* Help people with OCD get better and stay better by providing top-notch care through diagnoses, assessments, and evidence-based psychotherapy via the NOCD video platform
* Manage your caseload and schedule
* Maintain complete and timely clinical documentation using the NOCD EHR system
* Participate in NOCD clinical consultation, training, and advance your knowledge and practice of evidence-supported treatments for OCD
* Collaborate with our network of providers to help develop and reinforce treatment decisions

**Requirements:**

* Full Time Providers:
* 40 hour work week
* Complete 28 hours of direct clinical work per week
* Attend 2 hours of weekly group clinical consultation
* Have 10 hours of weeknight/weekend availability after 5pm local time for Member Sessions
* Will participate in and complete cross-license application process during Onboarding
* Open and willing to treat children and adolescents after attending NOCD Child and Adolescent training

**Who You Are**

* Full and unrestricted license in good standing to practice independently in your state.
* Masters Degree Required
* Massachusetts: (Licensed Psychologist, Licensed Mental Health Counselor, Licensed Marriage & Family Therapist, Licensed Independent Clinical Social Worker)
* At least 6 months of relevant experience with evidence-based therapies (e.g., ERP, CBT, ACT)
* Knowledge and experience with treating OCD with ERP is preferable but not required
* Organized, quick and enthusiastic learner, excellent communicator, good with time management
* Have a confidential, private location to work remotely from with reliable internet access
* Comfortable and efficient with using technology to communicate
* Ambitious and ready to keep up with a goal-driven, start-up environment

**What We Offer**

* Competitive compensation
* Comprehensive benefits package, including medical, dental, vision coverage, and 401(k) match
* PTO based on an accrual system
* Engaging community of mission driven providers focused on Member care
* Specialized ERP training with experienced OCD providers
* Work remotely from the comfort of your own home or office
* Centralized scheduling
* Access to NOCD Professional Development Trainings and ongoing consultation with other team members
* One-on-one mentorship to discuss complex cases
* NOCD provides 12 weeks of fully paid parental leave for the primary caregiver, and 6 weeks of fully paid leave for the secondary caregiver, for qualifying full-time employees.

*NOCD is proud to be an equal opportunity employer. We do not discriminate in hiring or any employment decision based on race, color, religion, national origin, age, sex (including pregnancy, childbirth, or related medical conditions), marital status, ancestry, physical or mental disability, genetic information, veteran status, gender identity or expression, sexual orientation, or other applicable legally protected characteristic. NOCD is also committed to providing reasonable accommodations for qualified individuals with disabilities and disabled veterans in our job application procedures.*

*Applicants have rights under Federal Employment Laws. Family and Medical Leave Act (FMLA); Equal Employment Opportunity (EEO); Employee Polygraph Protection Act (EPPA).*

*https://www.treatmyocd.com/employee-privacy-notice*

title: EAP Clinical Counselor
description:
Bring your heart to CVS Health. Every one of us at CVS Health shares a single, clear purpose: Bringing our heart to every moment of your health. This purpose guides our commitment to deliver enhanced human-centric health care for a rapidly changing world. Anchored in our brand — with heart at its center — our purpose sends a personal message that how we deliver our services is just as important as what we deliver.  

  

Our Heart At Work Behaviors™ support this purpose. We want everyone who works at CVS Health to feel empowered by the role they play in transforming our culture and accelerating our ability to innovate and deliver solutions to make health care more personal, convenient and affordable.

**Position Summary**  

Fully remote in the USA.


Shift: Monday – Friday | 12pm - 8:30pm EST


Responsible for provision of telephone-based assessment, triage, consultation, counseling and informational services, delivered in a call center environment using a variety of advanced clinical assessments, motivational Interviewing and solution focused/short-term problem resolution. Provides risk, substance abuse and mental health assessments to develop immediate action/safety plans based on level of urgency. Has an understanding of various levels of care (mental health and substance use) to aid in appropriate recommendation of care based on the assessment of need. Has an excellent ability to join with and collaborate with a member to understand their needs and be in alignment with the member’s theory of change.


Provides information to members regarding mental health, substance abuse, community treatment, and related mental health programs to assist members with linkage to resources to aid in the alleviation of stressors. Collaborates with team of professionals in a way that supports a positive clinical outcome and continuity of care for all members. Requires use of multitasking skills to type/document while also using other tools to assist with call handing while speaking with members. Position protects the confidentiality of member information and adheres to enterprise, EAP policies regarding confidentiality.


Position maintains accurate and complete documentation of required information that meets risk management and regulatory requirements. Position maintains current independent behavioral health license in good standing in the state where they reside, seeking professional development and meeting all state licensure requirements.


Holiday work is expected.

* Schedules may be adjusted based on business need.

 **Required Qualifications**  

* 1+ year of crisis intervention skills required
* Valid unrestricted independent professional behavioral health clinical license to practice per state regulations in the state they reside in/ one or more or equivalent is required: LPC, LMFT, LCSW, LMHC, LCMHC, LICSW, LISW, Clinical Psychologist.

 **Preferred Qualifications**  

* 1+ years of EAP, Behavioral Health or Social Services experience

- Experience working with diverse populations - Familiarity with brief therapy models and Motivational Interviewing

* Call Center work experience preferred
* Ability to establish and maintain rapport quickly to develop a high level of customer trust
* Experience in facilitating patient/client positive behavior change
* Strong computer and literacy skills
* 24x7x365 call center coverage needed, holiday coverage may be required
* Experience in handling mental health, psychiatric care, family situations and relationship concerns preferred

 **Education**


Master’s Degree in behavioral health counseling profession.

**Pay Range**


The typical pay range for this role is:


$60,522.80 - $129,600.00
This pay range represents the base hourly rate or base annual full-time salary for all positions in the job grade within which this position falls. The actual base salary offer will depend on a variety of factors including experience, education, geography and other relevant factors. This position is eligible for a CVS Health bonus, commission or short-term incentive program in addition to the base pay range listed above.  

  

In addition to your compensation, enjoy the rewards of an organization that puts our heart into caring for our colleagues and our communities. The Company offers a full range of medical, dental, and vision benefits. Eligible employees may enroll in the Company’s 401(k) retirement savings plan, and an Employee Stock Purchase Plan is also available for eligible employees. The Company provides a fully-paid term life insurance plan to eligible employees, and short-term and long term disability benefits. CVS Health also offers numerous well-being programs, education assistance, free development courses, a CVS store discount, and discount programs with participating partners. As for time off, Company employees enjoy Paid Time Off (“PTO”) or vacation pay, as well as paid holidays throughout the calendar year. Number of paid holidays, sick time and other time off are provided consistent with relevant state law and Company policies.  

  

For more detailed information on available benefits, please visit jobs.CVSHealth.com/benefits


We anticipate the application window for this opening will close on: 03/25/2024
CVS Health requires certain colleagues to be fully vaccinated against COVID-19 (including any booster shots if required), where allowable under the law, unless they are approved for a reasonable accommodation based on disability, medical condition, religious belief, or other legally recognized reasons that prevents them from being vaccinated.


You are required to have received at least one COVID-19 shot prior to your first day of employment and to provide proof of your vaccination status or apply for a reasonable accommodation within the first 10 days of your employment. Please note that in some states and roles, you may be required to provide proof of full vaccination or an approved reasonable accommodation before you can begin to actively work.


CVS Health is committed to recruiting, hiring, developing, advancing, and retaining individuals with disabilities. As such, we strive to provide equal access to the benefits and privileges of employment, including the provision of a reasonable accommodation to perform essential job functions. CVS Health can provide a request for a reasonable accommodation, including a qualified interpreter, written information in other formats, translation or other services through ColleagueRelations@CVSHealth.com If you have a speech or hearing disability, please call 7-1-1 to utilize Telecommunications Relay Services (TRS). We will make every effort to respond to your request within 48 business hours and do everything we can to work towards a solution.

title: Psychologist – Army Wellness Program, Part time
description:
*Hyperion Biotechnology, Inc. has been providing services to federal government customers for over 20 years. Our customers receive comprehensive services to meet the specified requirements of their projects. With strong leadership and corporate infrastructure, Hyperion offers support and solutions to ensure the successful execution of our customers' programs.*

 **Title:** Psychologist - Army Wellness Program, Part Time

**Location: Remote within the Continental United States**

**Job Summary**


Hyperion Biotechnology is seeking candidates for a part time Psychologist to support the US Army's Wellness Program for the Army Criminal Investigation Division. The Psychologist will be responsible for conducting psychological evaluations for psychological fitness for duty evaluations.

**Responsibilities/Tasks**

* Conducting virtual psychological evaluations, consisting of psychological testing and clinical interview, of Civilian Special Agent applicants and civilian Special Agents who require psychological fitness for duty evaluations. The process for which these are conducted are guided by DACID policy.

**Minimum Requirements**

* Must be a Licensed Clinical Psychologist (PhD or PsyD) with a Doctoral degree from an accredited graduate program.
* Must have a valid unrestricted license from a State, the District of Columbia, a U.S. Commonwealth, or a U.S. Territory that grants authority to provide counseling services as an independent practitioner.
* Must be able to practice at the independent level without requiring state mandated clinical supervision and demonstrate a working knowledge of professional standards and ethics.
* Must have provided documented proof of professional liability insurance of at least $1,000,000 per occurrence; $3,000,000 aggregate.
* Must have a minimum of six years of full-time professional experience post-licensure.
* Must understand law enforcement, as well as the military lifestyle and culture. Basic knowledge of the military population (e.g., prior work with the VA, having clients who were/are military) are acceptable forms of experience.

Must be able to effectively communicate with individuals and groups of diverse backgrounds, including enlisted personnel, officers, and senior military and civilian leadership.  
* 

  

**Hyperion is an equal opportunity employer and does not discriminate in hiring or employment on the basis of race, color, religion, sex, national origin, age, disability, or any other basis prohibited by federal, state, or local law. You may self-identify on a voluntary basis.**

*No question on this application is intended to secure information to be used for such discrimination. The company is required by federal regulations to report information as requested on the form. Your contribution of this information is completely voluntary and in no way affects the decision regarding your employment opportunity. The information you provide is strictly confidential.*

title: Full and Part Time Therapists and Psychologists/Testing Specialist
description:

title: Youth Counselor
description:
**Job T****itle:** Youth Counselor **Job Summary:**  

* CASES’ Nathaniel Clinic specializes in serving criminal legal system-involved youth ages 13 and above and adults. This clinical position will work in the Connection to Care: Building Resilience in Youth program with our partner the Police Athletic League. Through C2C: BRY, Police Athletic League will partner with CASES to provide adolescents and young adults, ages 13-21, engaged in PAL’s community youth programs with increased access to mental health treatment by building the knowledge and capacity of PAL’s front-line staff and embedding a CASES licensed social worker - this position - at a PAL community site to conduct screenings, assessment, brief interventions as needed, psychoeducation and training, and referrals to the Nathaniel Clinic or another appropriate NYC mental health treatment service. The Nathaniel Clinic seeks a licensed social worker to work four days at the offices of our partner PAL (80% Youth Coach) and one day at our Harlem office (20% Juvenille Counseler). Clinical hours are provided.

 **Salary:** The salary for this role is $70,000 per year. **What you will be doing (****Responsibilities****):*** Conduct screening and assessment in accordance with the use of validated screening tools to screen and assess for mental illness, trauma, substance use, and risk and needs.
* Develop family-centered treatment plans and review in collaboration with client, collaterals, and consented stakeholders such as parents and guardians, significant others, criminal justice personnel, primary care health provider, care coordinator, and schools.
* Provide compassionate, developmentally-appropriate clinical treatment in accordance with the scope of practice and regulations governing Article 31 and Certified Community Behavioral Health Clinics.
* Conduct individual, family, group therapy as clinically indicated.
* Coordinate cases with CASES psychiatrists, nurse practitioners, nursing staff, peers, care managers, and administrative staff.
* Use evidence-based risk management protocols and clinical processes to appropriately manage and intervene to effectively serve clients at elevated risk including for violence.
* Provide crisis intervention services as deemed appropriate.
* Document all treatment services - assessment and progress notes - using collaborative/concurrent documentation.
* Maintain designated caseload and required weekly levels of service productivity.
* Use evidence-based approaches to treatment consistent with youth development principles; CASES’ organizational culture; health/mental health integration, rehabilitation, and recovery; a compassionate understanding of the effects of previous system involvement and challenges this brings to engagement; and responding to serious mental illness.
* Use cognitive behavioral approaches to treatment that will support behavioral changes to reduce risks associated with system involvement, including involvement in the criminal legal system.
* Deliver effective treatment responses to individuals with co-occurring mental illness and substance use disorders and complete the Focus on Integrated online training modules and receive the Integrated Mental Health/Addictions Treatment Training Certificate.
* Co-facilitate group psychotherapy services to youth and families.
* Provide culturally competent services that are individualized to client needs and reflect the integration of race, ethnicity, culture, primary language, immigration status, developmental status, criminal legal system status, sexuality, age, and gender.
* Ensure timely and accurate documentation using the Electronic Medical Record; document all services in accordance with CASES policies, NYS Office of Mental Health regulations and all relevant federal laws.
* Participate in Quality Improvement Measures and utilize dashboard data reports from the EHR to track client progress with symptom reduction, increased functioning, and use objective data to determine treatment needs and to support discharge planning.
* Attend and actively participate in supervision and weekly staff meetings.

**Connections to Care**

* Serve PAL participants onsite 2-3 days per week at PAL community site
* Respond to participant screening results to identify PAL participants for assessment, engagement, and outreach to address mental health treatment needs refer and support access to needed mental health treatment
* Participate in Connections to Care Building Resilience in Youth planning, implementation, and evaluation activities
* Any other duties as required by the senior clinician and PAL senior staff

 **What we are looking for (Job Requirements/Qualifications):*** New York State LCSW/LMSW/LMHC individuals with CASAC preferred
* 1-3 years of experience in a clinic setting or at least two years of work experience at a licensed mental health or substance use program
* Demonstrated expertise in recovery-oriented, trauma-informed, evidence-based practice
* Demonstrated experience with diverse young people receiving mental health treatment, including delivery of treatment to individuals with serious mental illness, functional impairments and psychosocial needs including involvement in the criminal justice system
* Therapist will be expected within six months of employment to receive the Integrated Mental Health/Addictions Treatment Training Certificate

 **Additional, skills we are looking for preferred but are not essential skills:*** Experience working with youth and adolescents in a social service or behavioral health setting preferred
* Bilingual Spanish preferred

**CASES Mission:*** The mission of the Center for Alternative Sentencing and Employment Services (CASES) is to increase public safety through innovative services that reduce crime and incarceration, improve behavioral health, promote recovery and rehabilitation, and create opportunities for success in the community.

 **Employee Benefits:**  

CASES cares about employee wellbeing, and we offer a comprehensive benefits package to support you and your family, including:* Medical
* Dental
* Vision
* Vacation and Paid Time Off – starting at 25 days-off annually, plus an additional summer self-care day.
* 12 Paid Holidays per year
* Flexible Work Arrangements whenever possible. May be Fully onsite, Hybrid, Flexible, or Fully Remote see individual job descriptions work schedule details
* Retirement 403(b) Competitive matching up to 6%
* Employee Referral Program
* Visit www.cases.org/careers/ to learn more about benefits offered by the CASES


CASES introduces the Student Loan Repayment Program to help job seekers like you tackle their student loans while working in their preferred career field. Compensation provided is up to 30k in loan repayment over a three-year period. Funds are available on first come, first served basis for selected licensed positions located in the Clinic, ACT and FACT departments, a benefit from OMH that is available to full time clinical staff working in the capacity as a LMSW/LCSW/LMHC/LMFT/LCAT/licensed psychoanalyst/licensed psychologist within eligible OMH licensed community mental health programs in New York State.


Follow the attached to link to learn more about eligibility and resources related to the OMH CMHLRP:


https://omh.ny.gov/omhweb/rfp/2023/cmhlrp/round-three/index.html

 **Although we would love to learn about the skills of every candidate, only selected candidates that are selected will receive a response. We encourage you to apply for any position(s) you feel you are qualified for.** **CASES is proud to be an Equal Opportunity Employer. Employment with CASES is based solely on qualifications and competence for a particular position without regard to race, color, ethnic or national origin, age, religion, creed, gender, sexual orientation, disability, or marital, military, or citizenship status. We also actively recruit individuals with prior involvement in the criminal legal system.**

title: Contract Evaluation Psychologist
description:
Contract Psychologist Job Posting

  



Psychological Dimensions (PD), a nationwide police and public safety and risk management consulting firm with physical offices in Atlanta, Denver, and Chicago, invites applications for a licensed psychologist, preferably with previous assessment or forensic training and experience. Our agency provides state-of-the-art forensic risk management psychological evaluations to law enforcement and other safety-sensitive organizations. The psychologist may also have unique opportunities to participate in risk assessment and consultation with television networks and the media.

  



Applications will be accepted from licensed psychologists who have limited assessment experience, preference is given to applicants with experience in risk and threat assessment, psychological pre-employment screening services, critical incident debriefing, and/or police/public safety and corporate fitness for duty evaluations. **Psypact** **APIT** **will be** **required** **before starting**).

  



This contractor opportunity is ideal for psychologists looking for extra income and who are seeking interesting and rewarding work as a consultant with our firm. While prior experience in police and public safety psychology is preferred, we understand that it is difficult to obtain experience in this unique area, and this is not a requirement. Applicants selected will be provided with comprehensive training and supervision from our staff that includes use and interpretation of related testing, as well as interviewing and report writing skills needed to conduct these highly specialized evaluations.

  


**REQUIREMENTS:** Successful applicants must have completed a doctoral degree in clinical or counseling psychology from an APA-accredited program, as well as an APA-accredited pre-doctoral clinical internship. Applicants must be licensed in a PsyPact Member State (https://psypact.org/mpage/psypactmap) AND have or be willing to obtain an active Psypact credential. Efficiency, detail-orientation, and excellent writing skills and grammar are essential requirements. Our schedule is based on the needs of our clients, and while work demand may vary, we do offer flexibility in working with your existing schedule. The contract psychologist should have availability for a minimum commitment of 8 hours/week for evaluations on a set schedule each week.

  


**TO APPLY:** Please submit ***curriculum vitae with*** ***a cover letter*** that addresses your interest.



Job Types: Full-time, Part-time, Contract

  



Salary: $100.00 - $425.00 per hour for contract work

  



Work setting: Remote

  



License/Certification:


* Unrestricted license to practice psychology independently in a PsyPact participating State (https://psypact.org/mpage/psypactmap)
* PsyPact-eligible (PsyPact APIT required before starting)


Diversity, Equity, Inclusion & Equal Employment Opportunity at Psychological Dimensions (PD): PD is an equal opportunity employer. All aspects of employment including the decision to hire, promote, discipline, or discharge, will be based on merit, competence, performance, and business needs. We do not discriminate on the basis of race, color, religion, marital status, age, national origin, ancestry, physical or mental disability, medical condition, pregnancy, genetic information, gender, sexual orientation, gender identity or expression, veteran status, or any other status protected under federal, state, or local law. PD believes that diversity and inclusion among our teammates is critical to our success as a multi-national company, and we seek to recruit, develop and retain the most talented people from a diverse candidate pool.

title: WA Psychologists Needed to Perform Psych Evaluations - Start Immediately!
description:
**Psychologists Needed to Perform Psych Evaluation Clearances - Start Immediately!**

Across the healthcare landscape, psychologists are becoming integral before and after medical procedures to ensure the holistic care of patients, addressing both mental and physical health needs. Help Therapy seeks innovative psychologists in Washington with telehealth experience who are driven by the vision of treating the entire individual. By joining us, you can significantly reduce instances of preventable patient harm and enhance comprehensive care outcomes.

Our current focus is on psychologists who can perform Psychological Evaluation Clearances for Spinal Cord Stimulation (SCS) and Bariatric procedures through telehealth. Each pre-surgical evaluation offers a reimbursement rate ranging from $300 to $500.

**Not credentialed? No problem**! We will facilitate the credentialing process for you. If you are already Medicare credentialed, check out the additional benefits listed below.

**What is Help Therapy?**

Founded in 1993, Help Therapy has consistently worked towards broadening access to top-tier mental health services. We are the bridge that links everyone to therapy while streamlining the business aspects of therapy for professionals. At Help Therapy, we alleviate administrative tasks such as referrals, billing, marketing, credentialing, and compliance, allowing you to function akin to a private practice. We aim to transform your envisioned practice into reality.

**About Spinal Cord Stimulator Evaluations**

SCS represents a novel approach to managing chronic pain and is increasingly emerging as a preferred alternative to medications or back surgery. Yet, the procedure is not devoid of risks. The implanted SCS device connects directly to the patient's nervous system. Research underscores that psychological variables such as anxiety, depression, or inadequate coping mechanisms can adversely impact post-SCS care outcomes. This is where your expertise becomes invaluable in ensuring the patient's safety.

Patients contemplating SCS must first undergo psychological evaluations to ascertain the procedure's appropriateness for them. These evaluations amplify the chances of favorable care outcomes. Conducting a psychological evaluation for SCS entails a clinical interview and a mental status examination, all executed virtually and typically completed within an hour.

**How Help Therapy Works**

Become a part of our team in under a week and instantly start attending to patients for Psychological Evaluation Clearances. Our care team will manage your referrals for patients necessitating SCS pre-surgical psychological evaluations via telehealth. Billing for every psychological evaluation will be seamlessly handled by Help Therapy.

Unfamiliar with Psychological Assessments? Worry not. Our administrative support extends to resources and materials guiding you through the Psych Assessment process.

**Benefits**:

- A continuous flow of patients requiring SCS & Bariatric Psych Evaluations.

- We handle billing, ensuring timely payments without the associated hassles.

- Optimal flexibility - You decide your patient base and consultation timings.

- Assistance with credentialing.

- Transparent finances - Providers are informed beforehand about the reimbursement rate, typically fluctuating between $300-$500 for each SCS evaluation.

**For Those Already Medicare Credentialed:**

- Free video training on conducting SCS Psychological Evaluations.

- Complimentary assessment material kit.

- Expedited onboarding – Begin within 5 business days.

**Requirements**:

- Licensed Psychologist in Washington

- Individual NPI number

- Individual professional malpractice liability insurance policy

**Employment Status**: Please note that psychologists working with Help Therapy operate as independent providers and are not employees of Help Therapy. This agreement is non-exclusive, permitting you to engage with and offer services to other organizations alongside Help Therapy.

To embark on this journey with us, register your details at helptherapy.com/Apply-Today or via Indeed. Our team will initiate contact within 24 hours. We eagerly await our collaboration.

Schedule:

Work setting:

* Clinic

* Telehealth

Work Location: Remote

title: Mental Health Therapist - Remote
description:
**About WellQor:**  

  

  

WellQor is a patient centered, full-service psychological practice accessible online. We put our long-term personal relationships with clients at the heart of everything we do, so each person feels the esteem and confidence that comes from feeling consistently loved, supported, and valued. We’re not a tech giant, directory service, or gig-work platform. Were a collaborative mental health practice that marries the best of traditional and innovative approaches to pursue the best possible outcomes for our clinicians and our clients.  

  

  

Unlike other online providers, our clinical therapists are one member of a team, collaborating with peers and a Clinical Director who is responsible for developing and guiding their team. Our clinicians enjoy the full support of a treatment team and the security of W-2 employment, while our patients benefit from the full attention of a robust clinical organization.  

  

  

Our practice is rapidly growing, and we owe our success to a team-oriented culture that puts people first. As a new provider, expect to feel loved, appreciated, and supported in a way that’s truly unique to WellQor.  

  

  

  

**How You’ll Make an Impact:**  

  

  

At WellQor, you’ll help your clients overcome mental health challenges, forge better relationships, and be the best versions of themselves. You’ll make a real, tangible difference and feel good about the way you bring joy to the lives of others.  

  

  

And you won’t have to do it alone. We follow a care-team treatment model, which means clinicians are assigned to teams which they can connect with and consult for advice, institutional knowledge, and continued feedback to help advance you in your career.  

  

  

  

**In this role you’ll get to:**
  

* Develop meaningful relationships with patients via tele-therapy.
* Define your own availability, make your own schedules, and work according to your lifestyle. Some WellQor therapists work part time, and others carry full caseloads. Whatever your lifestyle demands, we’re here to meet you where you’re at.
* Consult with your clinical director and your regional team on a regular basis for support and feedback.
* Connect with therapists across the country using our Clinician Connect platform.
* Allow WellQor to handle credentialing, billing, client intake, marketing, customer service, and other administrative services on your behalf.
* Participate in company events and receive opportunities for CEU sponsorship.

**What we’re looking for:**
  

* Friendly, professional, and compassionate people.
* LPCC, LMFT, LMHC, LICSW, LCSW, LCP or equivalent licensed to practice independently.
* Experience using electronic health record (EHR) systems to document sessions.
* Comfort using technology in everyday work.
* A willingness to learn.

**What we offer:**
  

* Medical, dental, and 401k benefits.
* Competitive compensation paid by the billable hour.
* PTO and paid holidays.
* Connection to responsive, professional, and empathetic coworkers and leadership.
* Schedule flexibility.
* Full administrative support.
An EHR system customized to be easy to use.  
* 

  

**Compensation details:**  

  

  

WellQor Therapists are paid by the billable hour and have the flexibility to take on the caseload that they’re interested in carrying at any given time. Hourly compensation is competitive and varies based on license level, relevant experience, and caseload requirements.  

  

  

Join the WellQor team and connect with your best self today! www.wellqor.com
  

Masters or PhD

title: Licensed Online Clinician/Therapist/Counselor/Social Worker/Psychologist
description:
**Job Title**: Licensed Online Clinician/Therapist/Counselor/Social Worker/Psychologist  

  

**Job Type:** Contract  

  

**Hours:** Flexible; Requesting 25 patient contacts/week  

  

**Location:** Fully Remote  

  

**Position Summary:** Provide virtual outpatient psychiatric evaluation and medication management services at Wellness Beyond the Chair (WBTC).

**Company Overview:**


Wellness Beyond the Chair is a mental health private practice that integrates western psychotherapy and indigenous wellness practices to help career driven experts and executives center their well-being and create a massive impact in the world as innovative leaders. Indigenous practices such as Reiki and sound healing are centered to help accelerate the relaxation of the body’s nervous system.


We provide services to adolescents, adults, and families with the mission to increase accessibility to mental health treatment and indigenous wellness practices that center authenticity, freedom and joy. Wellness Beyond the Chair professionals provide services that intentionally focus on helping clients improve their mental health symptoms, engage in healthy interpersonal relationships.


We specialize in curating a safe space for clients experiencing psychological concerns as a result of trauma (PTSD), mood disorders (depression, anxiety, bipolar), and chronic pain/illness while also curating a safe space for clients navigating LGBTQIA concerns.  

  

As we continue to grow and expand our mission at Wellness Beyond the Chair to provide comprehensive and empathetic mental health care, we are actively seeking passionate and dedicated Psychiatric Mental Health Nurse Practitioners (PMHNP) to join our innovative team. This is a unique opportunity to make a profound impact in the lives of those we serve, leveraging your expertise in a supportive and dynamic virtual care environment.

**Responsibilities:**

*Client Assessment and Counseling:*

* Conduct initial assessments and evaluations of clients to determine their strengths, current stressors, needs and areas for growth
* Develop personalized and collaborative treatment plans
* Provide individual, family and/or group counseling sessions

*Therapeutic Services:*

* Administer evidence-based therapeutic interventions to address client concerns and mental health issues.
* Maintain accurate and up-to-date client records, including progress notes and treatment plans.

*Client Engagement:*

* Foster a positive therapeutic relationship with clients to promote trust and effective communication
* Serve as an advocate and accountability for clients
* Monitor client progress and make necessary adjustments to treatment plans

**Collaboration:**

* Consult and collaborate with other team members, including physicians, case managers, therapists, and support staff.
* Communicate effectively with clients' families and external healthcare providers when necessary.

**Ethical and Legal Compliance:**

* Adhere to ethical and legal standards in the field of mental health.
* Ensure compliance with all relevant laws and regulations, including client confidentiality.

**Professional Development:**

* Strive to center your well-being and personal care so that you can show up and serve clients from a centered and grounded place
* Stay current with the latest research and best practices in the field
* Pursue ongoing training and education to maintain licensure and improve clinical skills

**Qualifications:**

* Have 1 year of experience and training in treating trauma (PTSD), mood disorders (depression, anxiety, bipolar)
* Be willing to nurture a safe space for clients navigating LGBTQIA concerns
* Required to hold a valid and current Missouri (MO) state license as a (LPC, LMFT and LCSW, ect)
* Has a strong knowledge of evidence-based therapeutic interventions and assessment tools.
* Have excellent communication, interpersonal, and conflict resolution skills
* Be committed to client-centered care and maintaining high ethical standards
* Have the ability to work independently and as part of a collaborative team

**Benefits:**

* Flexible work schedule
* Fully remote position (must be licensed in the state in which you serve clients)
* Competitive hourly rate or reimbursement percentage for skilled candidates
* Room for upward mobility in leadership as our company grows
* Engaging positive work culture that centers the well-being of humanity


\\*\\*\\*At this time, we are not hiring mental health clinicians who own and/or operate their own private practice. \\*\\*\\*
