title: EAP Clinician
description:
**\\* Position is not fully remote and requires travel and in-office time. USPS location is in Tallahassee, FL. Must be licensed in and live in Florida. Will consider applicants with LCSW, LMHC, or LMFT license. \\***


Who *We Are*


At Lucet, we are industry leaders in behavioral health, dedicated to helping people live healthy, balanced lives. Our mission - and our passion - *is to improve the lives of the members we serve* and be the ideal partner for our providers.


Lucet's unique combination of people and technology has proven to optimize access to behavioral health care providers and increase a health plan's ability to connect members to quality care. With the industry's largest network of care navigators and technology powered by more than six million assessments and more than 20 years of data, Lucet is the only solution proven to successfully identify and connect people across the entire acuity spectrum with the right care in less than five days on average, and often as little as one day.


Our members, providers and partners fully entrust us to deliver outstanding quality care through coordinated behavioral health services, employee assistance programs, organizational consulting, student well-being programs and more.


When you join Lucet, you become a valued member of our team, serving more than 15 million people across the U.S. Our employees have a passion for helping others - and it shows. From entry-level employees to senior leaders, we are inspired by our members, putting them first in everything we do. From day one, you'll see firsthand the impact you have on our members, knowing you can make a true difference in their lives.  



  

Job *Summary*


This position will be dedicated to the USPS EAP Program. The EAP Clinician will provide EAP services including short-term counseling/problem solving, educational and training activities, referral, monitoring, behavioral health consultation, critical incident response and follow-up. The EAP Clinician is responsible for providing services in-person, telephonically or via video.


Essential *Functions*

* Provides counseling and coaching through one-on-one interactions, either in-person or telephonically.
* Provides telephonic consultation, triage and referrals to callers through the virtual call center/Service Center.
* Provides consultation, training of, and assistance to USPS and union leadership.
* Actively promotes the EAP program and services.
* Provides critical incident response and psychological first aid for events that impact the workforce.
* Adheres to Lucet Mission Statement, Core Values, Code of Business Conduct and Compliance Program
* Complies with all Federal and applicable State laws and Lucet policies regarding privacy, confidentiality and security of health information and other designated information


Job *Qualifications*


Required

* A master's and/or doctorate degree from an accredited college or university recognized by the corresponding professional association(s) in a clinical mental health field
* A current state license or state certification to practice as a mental health practitioner (e.g., social worker, clinical psychologist, marriage and family counselor and professional counselor) in the state(s) where practice takes place. If such licensure/certification is not available in that state, the individual will hold appropriate certification from a recognized national certification organization or board.
* A minimum of 5 Years of clinical experience after receiving a graduate degree.
* Authority to practice at the independent level without requiring state-mandated clinical supervision.
* Demonstrated capability to complete accurate bio-psychosocial assessments, including substance abuse assessments.
* Specialized experience and/or training in phone and video counseling
* Counselors will be knowledgeable about federal and state laws governing privacy, confidentiality, duty to warn and child and elder abuse reporting requirements
* The EAP clinician will be bound by the laws of confidentiality and will discuss no specific clinical information with the referring supervisor unless the client has signed an authorization to use and disclose form authorizing the disclosure of specific information
* This position requires driving. Employee must have an active driver's license and must be insurable. Lucet will request a motor vehicle record from the appropriate authority


Preferred

* Preferred Certified Employee Assistance Professionals (CEAP) and or knowledge and experience in EAP Practice

Key Competencies

* Self-motivated and ability to lead team to achieve Lucet goals
* Ability to engage a wide variety of individuals, and excellent organizational skills
* Passion for improving lives through behavioral change and wellness
* Proven interest in professional development through specialization, certification, and/or advance degree
* Maintains curiosity and an eagerness to explore new knowledge and try new ideas and approached to case management
* Demonstrates consistency in professional demeanor in response to all situations regardless of the nature or circumstances of the situation
* Ability to manage multiple tasks in a fast-paced, changing environment
* Ability to assume a lead role in ensuring that all objectives are met
* Ability to work within a collaborative, team-oriented environment


Working *Conditions*

* Physical
	+ Constant:
		- must be able to remain in a stationary position
		- must be able to move about inside the office
		- must be able to communicate and exchange information with others
		- must be able to inspect information
		- must be able to perform repetitive motion with arms and fingers
	+ Mental
		- Constant
			* must be able to interpret data
			* must be able to problem solve
			* must be able to make decisions
			* must be able to organize and plan
		- Work is performed indoors in a typical office environment- not substantially exposed to adverse environmental conditions
		- Frequent exposure to VDT screen
		- Frequent use of office machines to include telephone, copier, computer and fax machine

  

Salary and Other Compensation:


The starting salary that Lucet reasonably expects to pay for this position ranges from $58,000 - $85,000 annually, depending on circumstances including an applicant's skills, education/degrees, certifications, prior experience, market data, and other relevant factors.


This position is eligible for a bonus in accordance with the terms of Lucet's incentive plan based on both company performance and individual performance.


Benefits: The Company offers the following benefits for this position, subject to applicable eligibility requirements: Medical, Dental, Vision, 401(k) with competitive employer match, company paid life and disability insurance, company paid gym access, tuition reimbursement, parental leave, PTO (vacation, sick and volunteering), Remote Work.

 *This position is a federally contracted position with the United States Postal Service. which has specific requirements for all candidates which include:*

* *The ability to pass a 10-panel drug screen prior to their date of hire.*
* *The ability to undergo a Public Trust background investigation and receive a favorable adjudication.*
* *US Citizenship for at least 5 years.*

 *This position will accept and review new applications and resumes no less than 7 days after the original posting date and may remain open an extended period of time with no set end date based on the level of interest.*

title: Psychologist
description:
**Job Description**

Are you interested in developing your knowledge of psychological assessments in the area of clinical and forensic psychology? Psychwest, Clinical & Forensic Psychology, Inc. is a leading California business providing numerous clinical and forensic evaluations. Psychwest, Clinical & Forensic Psychology, Inc. is home to the Mental Competency Assessment and Training (MCAT) Community-Based Program, Juvenile and Adult Training for Competency to Stand Trial, a fundamental program providing comprehensive mental competency services, including assessments and training, for juveniles and adults.

We are seeking a part-time committed professional to fulfill the Psychologist position to complete forensic assessments for juveniles and adults. Assessments are completed remotely with the option to complete some assessments within the community. This is a great opportunity to merge your passion for psychology into a more varied and dynamic career. You will join an equally enthusiastic and experienced clinical and forensic team who shares your desire to utilize assessments in the field of psychology. We provide comprehensive training, support, and guidance in assisting you with your professional development. If you want to be a part of an innovative organization with rewarding new challenges as a compassionate and professional clinical and forensic Psychologist, apply today and don’t let this career opportunity pass you by!

**Job Responsibilities**

As a **Psychologist** you should be committed, compassionate, and detail oriented. You will be working with a variety of clients completing mental competency assessments for juveniles and adults.

· Complete comprehensive mental competency evaluations including test administration and report writing with interpretations, recommendations, and diagnoses

· Serve juveniles and adults

· Advancement opportunities are possible, if desired, with increased duties including additional clinical and forensic assessments and providing professional presentations and courses.

· Develop rapport with clients and maintain a respectful environment

· Maintain case management duties including report writing

· Communicate consistently with other applicable team members regarding job responsibilities

· Complete assessments electronically from home with the additional option of completing some assessments within correctional facilities and community locations.

· Use of computer applications (Microsoft Word, Excel, PowerPoint)

**Job Requirements**

As a Psychologist, you must be enthusiastic and efficient with the ability to adjust to various assessment requirements. Excellent organizational skills and the ability to communicate clearly and effectively, both verbally and in writing, are essential.

Additional requirements of our Psychologist include:

· California state professional licensed psychologist

· Quickly adapt to change and demonstrate flexibility to adjust to company needs

· Effectively demonstrate organizational skills, an efficient work style, attention to detail, time management skills and prioritization of tasks

· Ability to serve as an effective and positive force within the company

· Maintain communication and a consistent cooperative attitude in working with applicable program team members

· Willingness to travel -10% (Optional)

· Valid California driver's license (optional)

**Benefits**

As a Psychologist with Psychwest, Clinical & Forensic Psychology, Inc. you will enjoy a professional, yet relaxed working environment, as well as receive superior internal training opportunities along with support and knowledge from our experienced forensic team. Our primary office is located in Yuba City with additional branches throughout California.

**Qualified Employees receive:**

* Mileage Reimbursement
* Use of work laptop
* Use of all testing materials and forms

\\*

If interested, please send:  
1) Resume  
2) Completed application (found at www.psychwest.com/Jobs/)

title: Licensed Psychologist
description:
**Licensed Doctoral Psychologist**

Seeking a full-time doctoral level Clinical Psychologist or Neuropsychologist to join a busy, established psychological testing practice located in an oceanside community in the southern Outer Banks of North Carolina. We specialize in providing psychological and neuropsychological testing for children, adults, and seniors (ages 6 and up).This independent contractor position offers the ability for highly flexible hours along with administrative support including scheduling, electronic medical record, billing, credentialing/paneling with insurance companies, office space, and marketing. Clinical consultation and supervision hours are available as needed.

Our practice enjoys excellent referral relationships with local and regional medical practices and behavioral health providers. We are the largest local provider of assessments for neurocognitive disorders including degenerative dementias, stroke, and brain injury. We offer an opportunity for an excellent professional quality of life with the ability to see a diverse range of cases including neurodevelopmental disorders and other psychiatric disorders in addition to neurocognitive disorders.

The practice is located in Morehead City, NC, minutes from Crystal Coast beaches, boating, restaurants, and entertainment. Carteret County also offers highly ranked schools and a family friendly quality of life. Excellent income potential.

Applicants must be licensed or license-eligible in North Carolina. Remote applicants will be considered, although preference will be given to candidates who are local or willing to relocate. Recent doctoral graduates who are interested in post-doctoral hours and who wish to continue employment in our private practice are also encouraged to apply. Please submit a current CV to Jessica at mbpsychservices@gmail.com. For additional information, please see our website at mbpsychservices.com.

title: Behavioral Health Clinician - Canby or South Portland, Oregon - Remote
description:
**AbleTo,** part of the Optum family of businesses, is creating something new in health care. We are uniting industry-leading solutions to build an integrated care model that holistically addresses an individual’s physical, mental, and social needs, while removing barriers to quality care. Come build the health care system of tomorrow, making it more responsive, affordable, and equitable.



Here, we’ll invest in your personal and professional growth while giving you a unique opportunity to make a difference in an environment that will challenge you and give you clear direction on what it takes to succeed in your role as well as provide development for other roles you may be interested in, while doing **your life’s best work. (sm)**

  


**This is a Monday-Friday role, with no evenings, weekends, holidays.**


**Position Summary**



The **Behavioral Health Clinician (BHC)** is responsible for providing direct clinical services to patients in the Collaborative Care Model (CoCM) in a primary care clinic. The BHC will operate in conjunction with Optum Behavioral Care (OBC) to serve as the core member of the hybrid in-person/virtual collaborative care team for OBC clients.



In this cutting-edge team the BHC will interface between patients, PCPs, and psychiatrists to support the mental health and physical health care of patients on an assigned patient caseload from OBC clients. The BHC will have the support of OBC’s clinical and operational teams. This is an ideal role for you if you want to be at the center of an innovative model that can successfully improve the wellbeing for patients, you are interested in being part of a fast-growing company, and you thrive in a team environment.



If you have the ability to sporadic visits to local clinic, you will have the flexibility to work remotely\\* as you take on some tough challenges.

  


**Primary Responsibilities:**


* Use virtual and in-person modalities to coordinate care with the patient’s medical provider and, when appropriate, other mental health providers
* Screen and assess patients for common mental health and substance abuse disorders
* Systematically track treatment response and monitor patients for changes in clinical symptoms and treatment side effects or complications
* Support psychotropic medication management as prescribed by medical providers, focusing on treatment adherence monitoring, side effects, and effectiveness of treatment
* Provide brief behavioral interventions using evidence-based techniques such as behavioral activation, problem-solving treatment, motivational interviewing, or other treatments as appropriate
* Participate in regularly scheduled caseload consultation with the psychiatric consultant and communicate resulting treatment recommendations to the patient’s medical provider
* Develop and complete relapse prevention self-management plan with patients who have achieved their treatment goals and are soon to be discharged from the caseload

  


**Required Qualifications:**


* Meet one of the following license requirements for the state of Oregon:
+ Licensed Clinical Social Worker or Licensed Mental Health Counselor
+ Counselor/Professional Counselor
+ Licensed Marriage and Family Therapist
+ Licensed Psychologist

* Licensed in Oregon
* 3+ years treating patients with behavioral health conditions
* 1+ years working in primary care or other medical behavioral integrated setting (i.e., with other provider types)
* Experience with assessment and using evidence-based psychosocial treatments and brief behavioral interventions for common mental health disorders (e.g., cognitive behavioral therapy, motivational interviewing, problem-solving treatment, behavioral activation

  


**Preferred Qualifications:**


* Experience in the Collaborative Care Model (CoCM)
* Demonstrated experience being detail-oriented, organized, and have exceptional follow-up capabilities
* Proven ability to maintain effective and professional relationships with patient and other members of the care team
* Proven ability to work with patients in person as well as by telephone and video
* Proven solid grasp of technology solutions and tools and ability to adapt


**About OptumCare:**



At OptumCare, we’ve found that putting clinicians at the center of care is the best way to improve lives. Our physician-led organization is one of the most dynamic and progressive health care organizations in the world, serving over 17 million people through more than 45,000 aligned physicians and 9,000 advanced practice clinicians. You will find our team working in local clinics, surgery centers and urgent care centers, within care models focused on managing risk, higher quality outcomes and driving change through collaboration and innovation. Learn more at www.workatoptum.com.



Would you thrive with OptumCare?


* Do you practice evidence-based medicine?
* Are you seeking a practice focused on patient-centered quality care, not volume?
* Are you a team player - comfortable delegating and empowering teams?
* Are you constantly seeking better ways to do things?  

Do you want to be part of something better?


* All employees working remotely will be required to adhere to UnitedHealth Group’s Telecommuter Policy

  


*At UnitedHealth Group, our mission is to help people live healthier lives and make the health system work better for everyone. We believe everyone–of every race, gender, sexuality, age, location and income–deserves the opportunity to live their healthiest life. Today, however, there are still far too many barriers to good health which are disproportionately experienced by people of color, historically marginalized groups and those with lower incomes. We are committed to mitigating our impact on the environment and enabling and delivering equitable care that addresses health disparities and improves health outcomes — an enterprise priority reflected in our mission.*

  


*Diversity creates a healthier atmosphere: OptumCare is an Equal Employment Opportunity/Affirmative Action employer and all qualified applicants will receive consideration for employment without regard to race, color, religion, sex, age, national origin, protected veteran status, disability status, sexual orientation, gender identity or expression, marital status, genetic information, or any other characteristic protected by law.*

  


*OptumCare is a drug - free workplace. Candidates are required to pass a drug test before beginning employment.*

title: Psychologist
description:
We want you to join our team!

Therapy Solutions Collective (TSCO) is an innovative staffing company that is changing the employer-employee relationship. We work for you. Our goal is to support you across the arc of your career, regardless of setting or location.

We have a phenomenal School Psychologist opportunity at one of our partner school districts in the state of Washington. This is a full-time, in-personopportunity!

We are looking for school psychs who:

* are proactiveabout their own needs and the needs of their caseload
* see the value of collaboration
* know that life-work balance is important
* possess a variety of clinical competencies and the drive to continually learn and improve

In this role, you will play a vital part in enhancing the well-being and success of our students through comprehensive psychological assessment, counseling, and collaboration with educators and families.

Compensation

This position pays between $58 and $66 an hour DOE. TSCO pays hourly or by weekly salary, depending on what works best for you.

We are a clinician-run company offering a competitive salary and benefits package, PTO, 401(k) plan, continuing education stipend, Supported Transition Program (helping clinicians build clinical skills in other settings), Clinical Teaming (connecting clinicians within settings/experience levels/backgrounds/etc.), and many more benefits.

TSCO Philosophy:

When we have driven, talented, like-minded people working together toward common goals and supported by trusted and thoughtful leadership, we do our best work.

Responsibilities:

Psychological Assessment: Conduct thorough psychological assessments to identify students' cognitive, emotional, and behavioral strengths and challenges. Utilize a variety of assessment tools to inform educational planning and intervention strategies.

Individualized Support Plans: Collaborate with teachers, parents, and other professionals to develop and implement individualized education and behavior intervention plans for students with diverse needs, such as learning disabilities, ADHD, and emotional disturbances.

Counseling Services: Provide one-on-one and group counseling to students facing emotional and behavioral difficulties. Offer guidance and teach coping strategies to help students manage stress, anxiety, and interpersonal relationships.

Crisis Intervention: Respond to critical incidents within the school community by providing immediate support to students and staff during emotional crises. Facilitate crisis management plans and referrals for higher-level care as necessary.

Consultation and Collaboration: Work closely with teachers, special education teams, and administrators to address academic and behavioral challenges in the classroom. Offer strategies for creating a positive and inclusive learning environment.

Parent Education: Offer workshops and resources to parents and guardians on topics related to child development, behavior management, and mental health. Foster open communication between school and home.

Data Analysis: Collect and analyze data to assess the effectiveness of interventions and programs. Use data-driven insights to adjust support strategies and improve outcomes for students.

Qualifications:

* Master's or doctoral degree in School Psychology or a related field.
* Appropriate state/country licensure or certification as a School Psychologist.
* Strong understanding of psychological assessment tools and techniques.
* Knowledge of special education laws and regulations.
* Excellent communication and interpersonal skills for effective collaboration with students, parents, and staff.
* Empathy, patience, and a commitment to creating a supportive and inclusive school environment.

We are a clinician-run company offering a competitive salary and benefits package, PTO, 401(k) plan, continuing education stipend, Supported Transition Program (helping clinicians build clinical skills in other settings), Clinical Teaming (connecting clinicians within settings/experience levels/backgrounds/etc.), and many more benefits.

Commitment to Equity: Therapy Solutions is an equal opportunity employer, adhering to federal, state, and local laws governing nondiscrimination in employment. We embrace diversity and foster an inclusive workplace where all qualified individuals are treated with respect and provided equal opportunities for growth and development.

title: Telehealth Virtual Clinical Psychologist or Psychotherapist
description:
***Clinical Psychologist or Psychotherapist or Psychiatric Nurse Practitioner***

**About the position**

We have a full-time (or 2 part-time) staff positions available for a licensed mental health clinician / psychotherapist to work in one or more of hour outpatient clinics in New Jersey or remotely from their home office performing intakes, psychiatric diagnostic exams and outpatient psychotherapy services. Part-time options (minimum 16 hours per week) are also available. Clinicians who work with all age groups are preferred but pediatric or adult specialists are also needed. As described below, we have 5 clinical centers at NCBI serving patients across the life-span. The successful candidates will evaluate and treat patients and their families across one or more of these centers based on their area of expertise.

Primary duties include administering:

* Biopsychosocial histories
* Structured psychiatric exams
* Training in specialized psychological diagnostic measures is also offered across a variety of disorders such as Autism, Schizophrenic and bipolar spectrum disorder, personality disorders, OCD, PTSD as well as specialized diagnostic interviews for parents/children presenting with mood disorder.
* Individual and/or group psychotherapy with children, adolescents or adults based on each clinicians experience with various age groups
* Behavioral training for caregivers and patients
* Social skills therapy
* Psychopharmacological consultation for prescribing clinicians

You will be part of a clinical team providing the above outlined mental health services. Upon completion of a patient's neurodiagnostic evaluation, many of our patients require psychotherapy, behavioral therapy, behavioral therapy training for parents/caregivers and other mental health related treatments. The active phase of their treatments is typically 8-12 weeks. Generally patients are treated 2 x weekly during the first half of their treatment. Some patients do require maintenance treatments. Common disorders treated at NCBI include: ADHD, Autism, neuropsychiatric syndromes secondary to acquired and traumatic brain injuries mood disorders, somatoform disorders, OCD and Tourette's syndrome, as well as psychotic and personality disorders.

You will also participate in diagnostic intake and exam as well as psychotherapy rounds with other mental health clinicians at NCBI. You will participate as a rater in one or more of our clinical research trials.

**Qualifications**

You must be NJ licensed or licensed in another state with the capability of becoming licensed in NJ within the next 3-4 months of your hire and have or be eligible for CMS credentialing. Applicants can apply if they have an LPC, LCSW, APN, Ph.D. or Psy.D. in clinical psychology, or APN in psychiatry with training in psychotherapy. Candidates should have at least 3 years of clinical experience as a licensed mental health clinician providing psychiatric diagnostic and psychotherapy services.

Salary and Benefits

Competitive base salary with quarterly cash bonuses and other incentives and benefits as described within for full-time employees with some benefits also available for part-time employees. Salary is based on education/degree, years of clinical experience and interpersonal skills. A signing bonus is also being offered which is paid out at the end of the employees 3-month probationary / acclimation period.

**About the NeuroCognitive & Behavioral Institute (NCBI)**  
The NeuroCognitive & Behavioral Institute specializes in diagnosing and treating cognitive, neuropsychiatric and neurobehavioral disorders in pediatrics, adolescents, adults and geriatrics. We have 5 clinical programs/centers that are represented in each of our 4 outpatient clinics in New Jersey and we operate in 10 other states across the US:

1) The Neurodevelopmental Diagnostics and Treatment Center; 2) The Center for Acquired and Traumatic Brain Injury; 3) The Mind-Body Neuropsychiatric and Mental Health Disorders Center: 4) The Center for the Prevention and Treatment of Neurodegenerative diseases and; 5) The Sleep Study and Treatment Center. NCBI clinics are located in Morris, Somerset and Essex County NJ. We also have a very active clinical research division where we conduct early-late drug development, functional brain mapping and neuromodulation research.

visit www.neuroci.com for additional information about NCBI

title: Fee for Service Therapist
description:
**Fee-for-Service Clinician at Perennial Wellness PLLC**

Perennial Wellness PLLC (PW) invites applications for a 24-month, full time (24+ patient hours/week) licensed psychologist or LCSW to work with patients exclusively via telehealth. LMSWs who are an excellent fit are encouraged to apply, as well.

*The candidate must either be licensed in NY or CT, or open to obtaining licensure in both states.*

**Practice Overview:**

PW is a thriving, full-fee group practice based in Westport, CT, serving patients via telehealth across New York and Connecticut. Website: www.perennialwellnessllc.com.

At PW, we are a collaborative team of psychologists and social workers, and we believe that women deserve a holistic, evidence-based approach to mental health care. We understand the unique experience of womanhood. From navigating early adulthood, to the perinatal and postpartum period, to motherhood, perimenopause and beyond, we integrate evidence-based approaches to mental health care with a deep understanding of interpersonal neurobiology, child development, and attachment philosophies.

Our team values close collaboration with one another, in the form of supervision, case consultation, didactic trainings, and team building experiences. We offer our patients:

1. Individual Therapy: Our approach combines a holistic approach to treatment with a feminist application of cognitive behavioral therapy. Treatment subspecialties include: Peripartum Mood and Anxiety Disorders (PMADs); Anxiety; OCD; Perfectionism; Relationship Concerns; Grief and Loss; Career Counseling; and Parenting a Child with Special Needs.

2. Parenting Support: Our work with parents is grounded in interpersonal neurobiology, respectful parenting principles and the DIR Floortime model.

3. Executive Functioning Skills Coaching: We integrate a nuanced awareness of a woman’s neurobiology with actionable, skill-building interventions to help each woman strengthen her productivity, organization, time management skills, and more.

All individual therapy patients are served via telehealth and while the position is fully remote, there are opportunities for in-person group work, workshops, etc. to be facilitated at the applicant’s discretion, if the applicant is local to Westport, CT.

At PW, teletherapy allows women who are seeking specialized, evidence-based treatment to receive high-quality, individualized care, regardless of their physical location. Teletherapy allows for accessibility and convenience when it’s hard for women to get into the office, which is often the case for women in the peripartum period.

**Clinician’s Responsibilities:**

* Conduct psychiatric intakes with diagnosis, treatment planning and coordination of care with outside providers.
* Conduct individual psychotherapy for a caseload of 24+ patients through an integrative, evidence-based approach.
* Conduct dyadic parent sessions as needed focused on providing supportive interventions to navigate complex parenting-related challenges and dynamics.
* Attend and participate in weekly individual supervision with Dr. Levine, as well as twice monthly group supervision with the full PW team.
* Opportunities to develop a smaller caseload focused on Executive Functioning Skills Coaching for women with ADHD, under additional specialized supervision from clinical neuropsychologist Dr. Danielle Auslander, PsyD.

The candidate will have input into the specific days/times that she holds “office hours,” as this is a benefit of telehealth as a treatment modality. The candidate must be willing to see patients during evening hours one day per week (4p – 8p).

This position is ideal for an applicant (1) with a strong interest in women’s mental health and (2) who is seeking to learn more about how to cultivate a thriving telehealth practice within a private practice setting. The candidate will receive training and support in all clinical aspects of her work, as well as in the business-related aspects of maintaining an ethical, legal, and successful telehealth private practice.

**PW is seeking to hire an applicant who is:** 

1. Passionate about women’s mental health.

2. Eager for mentorship and training in modern private practice development.

3. Motivated to develop competencies in building and sustaining an effective, legal and ethical telehealth practice.

4. Highly autonomous and organized.

5. Honest, collaborative, and eager to grow as a part of a team.

Emma Levine, PhD is the Director of PW. She is a psychologist and clinical supervisor. She was formerly the Assistant Director at Cognitive Therapy for Women in New York City, where she helped to develop and implement their Postdoctoral Fellowship supervision training program. She completed her APA-accredited pre-doctoral internship training at Andrus Children’s Center in Yonkers, NY.

Dr. Levine has served as an Adjunct Professor in the Graduate School of Education at Fordham University. She has advanced training in the assessment, diagnosis, and treatment of Perinatal Mood and Anxiety Disorders (PMADs) from the Selini Institute in New York City. She regularly presents to parents and school communities on topics related to maternal mental health and parenting.

**Compensation & Benefits:**

* Competitive W2, fee-for-service position.
* Opportunities to remain and grow as a part of the PW team available upon successful completion of contract.
* Weekly, individual supervision is provided.
* Twice monthly team case consultation and didactics.
* A 401K plan immediately upon hire.
* Stipends for trainings and conferences.
* This position does not include health or malpractice insurance.

PW is an equal opportunity employer, and we encourage candidates from diverse backgrounds to apply. We value hiring candidates who emulate diversity of life experiences, perspective and thought. We care deeply about cultivating a community among our team that feels safe and inclusive, and that encourages important dialogues about issues of diversity among our team and our patients.

**Applicant Instructions:**  Please send a cover letter indicating your interest in this position, a C.V., and two letters of recommendation to Dr. Emma Levine by email at drlevine@perennialwellnessllc.com. Interviews will be conducted on a rolling basis, and an offer will be made when the right applicant is found. No phone calls please.

title: Licensed Clinical Psychologist
description:
**Service description**

**SUMMARY**

**In collaboration with the neuroTree (NT) clinical team, the Pain Psychologist's role is to administer pain evaluations, score, interpret assessments, write reports, and provide ongoing psychotherapy or as the treatment plan calls for. The** **primary population will be focused on patients experiencing chronic pain, TMD, neuropathic pain, orofacial pain, trauma-related challenges, and intellectual developmental disability community.** 

**ESSENTIAL JOB FUNCTIONS**

* Clinical interview
* Psychological testing, pain assessments, and integrative reports
* Trained in trauma-informed treatment modalities.
* Must accept the assignment within 24 hours of being offered the position
* Work flexible hours, and maintain agility
* Give clear, concise, and constructive feedback where appropriate.
* Guide through the cases, rules, guidelines, ethical policies, billing, and payments, etc.
* Be communicative with billing department by submitting claims on timely manner, and keeping the referring doctor up to date with progress reports.
* Psychometric testing (including but not limited to the CPCI, MHP, and SOPA, etc.) and integrative reports - diagnostic assessments, long-term disability assessments for civilians and veterans, serious/catastrophic Impairment assessments, and workplace injury assessments.
* Provide individual psychotherapy at a sliding scale when appropriate.
* Collaborate with staff and the Executive Team to support neuroTree’s expectations for job performance, productivity, quality, goal accomplishment, and mission implementation.
* Meet regularly with the Development Team if appropriate
* Work effectively with all diverse c within neuroTree and externally, including board members, staff, and volunteers
* Represent the agency in a professional manner at meetings and community events

**PHYSICAL REQUIREMENTS**

* Ability to have access to a computer reliable internet, and phone.
* Required to be available to the clients via telehealth.

**MINIMUM QUALIFICATIONS**

* Have a current license to practice Clinical and Pain Psychology in the state of California.
* Have appropriate training in Pain Psychological testing and integrative reports.
* Doctorate from an accredited or state-approved program with a minimum of 5 years of job-related experience.
* Familiar with the biopsychosocial model; including whole person assessment tools.
* Ability to coordinate, plan, manage, and oversee many aspects of a company for optimum productivity.
* Ability to work with multi-ethnic populations and populations with mental illness.
* Ability to work in a flexible work environment;
* Well organized, self-directed, and with good interpersonal skills.
* Access to transportation.
* Access to SimplePractice, but not limited to this software programs for testing.
* Must be on the panel for Medicare
* Must be registered in PsyPact network.

description:
Provides evidence based care in the diagnosis and treatment of mental illness and substance use disorders within an interdisciplinary team. Also provides individual, conjoint, group and family psychotherapy; in addition to crisis intervention services, as needed. Ensures that the quality of care is safe, effective, patient-centered, timely, efficient, and equitable.



**LMSW is the minimum required license.**

**must have individual psychotherapy experience.**



EDUCATION/EXPERIENCE REQUIRED: Master's (or Doctoral) degree in clinical or counseling psychology with one year supervised post masters experience; OR Master's degree in Social Work with two years post Master's experience in mental health/chemical dependency setting. CERTIFICATIONS/LICENSURES REQUIRED: Licensed Psychologist; OR Limited Licensed Psychologist; OR Licensed Master's in Social Work.


#### **Additional Details**



This posting represents the major duties, responsibilities, and authorities of this job, and is not intended to be a complete list of all tasks and functions. It should be understood, therefore, that incumbents may be asked to perform job-related duties beyond those explicitly described above.



#### **Overview**



 Under the leadership of President and CEO Robert G. Riney, Henry Ford Health is a



 $6 billion integrated health system comprised of six hospitals, a health plan, and 250+ sites



 including medical centers, walk-in and urgent care clinics, pharmacy, eye care facilities and



 other healthcare retail. Established in 1915 by auto industry pioneer Henry Ford, the health system



 now has 32,000 employees and remains home to the 1,900-member Henry Ford Medical Group, one



 of the nation’s oldest physician groups. An additional 2,200 physicians are also affiliated with the



 health system through the Henry Ford Physician Network. Henry Ford is also one of the region’s



 major academic medical centers, receiving between $90-$100 million in annual research funding and



 remaining Michigan’s fourth largest NIH-funded institution. Also an active participant in medical



 education and training, the health system has trained nearly 40% of physicians currently practicing



 in the state and also provides education and training for other health professionals including nurses,



 pharmacists, radiology and respiratory technicians. visit HenryFord.com.



#### **Benefits**



 Whether it's offering a new medical option, helping you make healthier lifestyle choices or



 making the employee enrollment selection experience easier, it's all about choice. Henry



 Ford Health has a new approach for its employee benefits program - My Choice



 Rewards. My Choice Rewards is a program as diverse as the people it serves. There are



 dozens of options for all of our employees including compensation, benefits, work/life balance



 and learning - options that enhance your career and add value to your personal life. As an



 employee you are provided access to Retirement Programs, an Employee Assistance Program



 (Henry Ford Enhanced), Tuition Reimbursement, Paid Time Off, Employee Health and Wellness, and a whole host of other benefits and services. Employee's classified as contingent status are not eligible for benefits.



#### **Equal Employment Opportunity/Affirmative Action Employer**



 Equal Employment Opportunity / Affirmative Action Employer Henry Ford Health is



 committed to the hiring, advancement and fair treatment of all individuals without regard to



 race, color, creed, religion, age, sex, national origin, disability, veteran status, size, height,



 weight, marital status, family status, gender identity, sexual orientation, and genetic information,



 or any other protected status in accordance with applicable federal and state laws.

title: Evening / Weekend Therapist
description:
Equilibria Psychological and Consultation Services is a well-established practice with offices in Philadelphia (Society Hill and Fishtown), Willow Grove, Media, and soon-to-open Lafayette Hill and Broomall. We are also hiring for future offices in the Langhorne and Doylestown areas, as well as hybrid positions for clinicians who want flexibility to work from home.

We are currently looking for PA licensed psychologists, LPCs, LMFTs, and LCSWs.

We want to empower and support clinicians in doing the work that they love, in their area of expertise, and with the clients that they most enjoy working with!

Our team of highly trained clinicians meet regularly for various peer consultation groups, support one another through informal consultations, enjoy spending time together socially (in-person or virtually), and have access to clinical guidance from the leadership team, when needed, as well!

We would love to hear about your specialization and how you would envision being part of our team.

Requirements

* Three (3) years experience providing therapy (or formal psychological assessments)
* PA License (Psychologist, LPC, LMFT, or LCSW) before starting (interview process can be initiated beforehand)
* Ability to schedule at least 12 appts/wk, including at least 8 appts/wk in the evenings or weekends.

Ideal candidates will have:

* Experience in outpatient settings
* A strong background with children, adolescents, families and/or adults
* Flexibility to work some evenings and/or weekends
* The ability to work independently and as part of a team
* Current credentialing with major insurers in the area (a plus but not a necessity)

Benefits:

title: REMOTE Licensed Clinical Psychologist
company: Meridian Counseling: Individual and Family Therapy, Inc.
description:
Meridian Counseling is looking for a licensed mental health therapist to join our growing team! We are a clinician-founded, hybrid practice offering both telehealth and in-person therapy in California and Utah. We are rapidly growing and are dedicated to helping our clients integrate mental health into their everyday health and wellness routine.
  
  

**Our Mission:** Bring mental wellness to the masses!
  
  

**Our Values:** Quality care, community, and accessibility.
  
  

**Check Us Out:** https://meridian-counseling.com/
  
  

About The Role
  
  

* We value our clinicians and their own professional goals. Working for us gives you the flexibility to create the "perfect position" based on your personal and career goals.
* We guarantee that we will provide you with both private pay and insurance-based client referrals (as many as you would like based on your financial goals).
* Licensed therapists with 2-years of clinical experience can opt to provide supervision to our unlicensed therapists.
* Psychologists have opportunities to do clinical assessments with our clients.
* Clinicians have the opportunity for bonus pay, through our incentive program.
* Our clinicians set their own hours/caseload and have the option for hourly or salaried positions and benefits.
* Clinicians also can opt for in-person sessions at our beautiful offices, or work from the comfort of their own homes. (Whatever works best for you)!
* Meridian offers the opportunity to participate in monthly consultations with our clinical team. (Our clinicians are awesome and always willing to support each other in professional growth).
* Meridian has strong values in building community and genuine connection - we want to assure our values are always intertwined within our team culture! We are excited to offer our monthly team events (training, workshops, volleyball, hikes, game nights, etc)!
* We will handle your billing, credentialing, and marketing and provide you with clients and office space. Your job is to show up, see your clients, and take notes!
* This is the perfect position for someone who wants the autonomy of private practice, while still feeling connected to a community and receiving consultation, as needed.
* If you love doing clinical work and do not want to deal with all the administrative and business headaches that come with running a practice - this is the position for you!


Minimum Qualifications
  
  

* Doctorate's degree in Psychology, or similar.
* Must be licensed as a Psychologist or PsyD.
* Must be able to obtain credentialing to work with insurance panels.


Preferred Qualifications
  
  

* Experience with trauma, mood disorders, addiction, families, and couples
* Comfortable with electronic medical records.
* CBT, DBT, ACT or EMDR Training preferred


Compensation
  
  

* Additional compensation is available for writing blog posts, hosting workshops, etc.


**Job Types:** Full-time, Part-time, Flextime
  
  

**Pay:** $80,000.00 - $140,000.00 per year + bonuses

title: Remote School Psychologist (NY)
description:
### **About This Role**



Are you ready to make a difference? Come work with Parallel!



We are looking for remote school psychologists with experience providing direct and indirect psychological services in schools and conducting comprehensive psycho-educational evaluations to join our talented team of clinicians. Our ideal candidate has a passion for supporting families and children with learning differences by ensuring they receive the best care and tools for success!


### **Why Join Us?**



Parallel makes it easy to administer quality care! By taking care of the daily hassles of running a business, we empower you to focus on providing services. We provide:


* **Easy Scheduling** through our in-house scheduling system
* **Templates & Databases** so you can spend less time on administrative tasks
* **Smart Matching** to pair you with school districts/schools
* **Student History & Eligibility** information so you have the information you need
* **Testing Materials** so you have the tools to succeed!


We also offer:


* **Flexibility**: Ability to set your own schedule and work on your own time
* **Testing & Licensure Programs**: Cross-licensing programs & necessary test materials are covered by Parallel
* **Innovation:** Your feedback will help shape the program for providers and clients in the future!
* **Community Events**: Collaborate with top clinicians and educators to solve acute problems
* **Growth**: Access leadership and growth opportunities as we rapidly scale
* **A Great Mission**: Directly contribute to bettering the lives of students across the country

### **What You'll Do**


* Provide direct and indirect psychological services to support students with IEPs
* Conduct comprehensive psycho-educational evaluations of students' academic, cognitive, social\\emotional, and/or behavioral functioning
* Write social\\emotional\\behavioral IEP goals and monitor students' goal progress
* Serve as a critical member of students' multi-disciplinary teams

### **What You'll Need**



To succeed in this role, you'll need:


* An EdS degree (or equivalent) in school psychology from a NASP-approved program
* A valid state license or certificate as a school psychologist
* NCSP preferred but not required
* At least 2 years of experience practicing full time as an on-site school psychologist (excluding practicum and internship years)
* Experience practicing as a remote school psychologist is preferred but not required
* Expertise across all NASP domains of practice
* Experience providing direct psychological services (e.g., intervention, counseling) within an MTSS framework of service delivery
* Experience consulting with educators and families
* Experience completing comprehensive psycho-educational evaluations of students' academic, cognitive, social, emotional, and behavioral functioning
* Excellent communication skills, specifically the ability to communicate with children of different ages and from different cultural and socioeconomic backgrounds
* Tech-savvy and experience with conducting tele-health services on virtual meeting platforms
* A private workspace with a reliable computer, webcam, and secure internet connection


Parallel is an equal opportunity employer that does not discriminate against applicants or employees and ensures equal employment opportunity for all persons regardless of their race, creed, color, religion, sex, sexual orientation, gender identity, pregnancy, national origin, age, marital status, disability, citizenship, military or veterans' status, or any other classifications protected by applicable federal, state or local laws. Parallel's equal opportunity policy applies to all terms and conditions of employment, including but not limited to recruiting, hiring, training, promotion, job benefits and pay.


*The range added below are for New York based hires only and will be commensurate with candidate experience. Pay ranges for candidates in other locations other than NY may differ. Pay range: $45.00-$60.00 per hour. Increased rates for bilingual in Spanish/English providers.*

  

### **About Us**



Parallel is the first tech-forward provider of care for learning and thinking differences across the United States. We believe learning differences are parallel ways of thinking that should be celebrated! Our mission is to provide students with the resources and encouragement to succeed in the classroom and beyond. To us, this means helping them build confidence in their unique strengths and create strategies to work around their challenges.



Parallel simplifies the process of getting support for learning differences by consolidating providers and resources on a single platform. We connect students with qualified professionals while significantly reducing waiting times, costs, and confusion. We provide a variety of services, including:


* Psychological Assessment & Therapy
* Counseling
* Speech-Language Therapy
* Special Education
* And more!


Want to know what it's like working here? Check out our Glassdoor reviews!


***Our commitment to diversity, equity, and inclusion***


*At Parallel, we believe in celebrating differences. This belief extends from schools into our workplace and through the ways we work together toward our mission. We are committed to fostering a diverse, accessible environment that represents many different cultures, backgrounds, viewpoints, and abilities by championing diversity, equity and inclusion.*


*This is why we are committed to having and fostering a diverse workforce, including those from historically marginalized groups, and are committed to a work environment where employees' strengths are championed, differences are celebrated, and no one is discriminated against based on age, race, ancestry, religion, sex, gender identity and expression, sexual orientation, pregnancy, marital status, physical or mental disability, military or veteran status, national origin, or any other characteristic.*


*We are a proud equal opportunity employer, and we are committed to building a diverse, equitable, and inclusive organization in order to build the foundation for different learners and thinkers to thrive.*

title: Remote Therapist (Bilingual/Spanish)
description:
Nassau Psychology PC is a vibrant, established, well-run, group psychotherapy practice in Nassau County. We're looking for a Bilingual licensed Clinical Psychologist, Licensed Mental Health Counselor (LMHC), Licensed Clinical Social Worker (LCSW), Licensed Master Social Worker (LMSW), or Licensed Marriage Family Therapist (LMFT), Mental Health Counselor (MHC-LP) to join our team!

We offer healing, hope and possibilities for adults, adolescents, children and couples through psychotherapy and psychoeducation that recognize the value, strengths, and resources of all we serve. We are seeking experienced mental health providers who demonstrate the heart and skills needed to help our valued clients and who want to be a part of a flourishing team. Nassau Psychology helps therapists focus on therapy by taking care of the business side of a clinical practice.

We provide supervision, referrals, marketing, full billing and scheduling services, administrative support, beautifully furnished office suites and a fun and cohesive team of therapists. The Position is fee for service with reimbursement for any late cancellations and no shows. *This opportunity is ideal for the highly skilled therapist who would like to work in a thriving group practice setting while enjoying a full-spectrum compensation package including competitive pay, medical, dental & vision benefits , 401k matching, paid sick leave, professional development funds - - without the work, headaches, or financial investment of running a business.*

As a group, we strive to provide psychotherapy that deepens our clients understanding of themselves and their relationships. To that end, we use psychodynamic, gestalt, and family systems theories to deepen our work. At the same time, we strive to provide quick symptom relief, integrating the use of CBT, mindfulness and other practices in our work as well. We regularly consult with each other on cases and benefit from different perspectives. There are opportunities for peer-consultation, case conference and didactics as well.

**We are currently seeking full-time and part-time licensed therapists for our Wantagh, Cedarhurst, and Rockville Center locations.**

Full-time is considered to be 38 client hours per week including 3 evenings, or 2 evenings and Sunday for those who wish to work on Sunday.

Part-time work is considered to be a minimum of 20 hours per week including 2 evenings.

We are looking for therapists who can see diverse client populations and presenting issues. Experience working with couples is a plus, as well as experience working with children, but not a requirement. Ideal candidates possess the ability to conceptualize a case, understand underlying motivation and use a treatment model to drive treatment.

**Benefits for Licensed Therapists:**

* Medical, dental, and vision benefits for full-time staff
* Reimbursement funds for professional development training / CEU
* Paid Family Leave
* All employment taxes processed by Nassau Psychology
* Workers Comp & State Unemployment insurance provided
* Bi-monthly automatic bank deposits based on all sessions provided during the previous 2 weeks - (no need to wait for protracted insurance reimbursement)
* All credentialing with insurance companies is done by the practice
* All new patients are on boarded by our New Patient Coordinators (all paperwork, forms etc. are completed by our staff) so you can focus on doing therapy
* We have a very steady referral stream of clients to easily fill your caseload
* All billing of insurance is handled on your behalf
* Feel at ease in well-appointed therapy rooms
* Weekly consultation group
* Opportunities to offer supervision
* Dedicated clinical support and group consultations
* Thriving and connected professional team with year-round social events, sharing each other's successes and milestones and professional growth opportunities

**Minimum Requirements for Licensed Therapists:**

* Master's degree and independent professional license in New York State (including Licensed Mental Health Counselor, Licensed Clinical Social Worker and Licensed Clinical Psychologist).
* Availability for afternoon / evening work is helpful. Weekend availability is a plus. Part-time or full-time work available.
* Currently, we are not considering applicants who are an Associate or Provisional level of license.
* Enrollment on insurance panels is welcomed, but not required.

**For more information about our practice, you can visit our website:**

www.nassaupsychology.org

To apply, please forward a cover letter of interest and resume to the email linked to this posting. You will then be emailed a list of questions - and your responses will help us determine the next steps in our process.

Nassau Psychology is committed to creating a diverse environment and is proud to be an equal opportunity employer. All qualified applicants will receive consideration for employment without regard to race, color, religion, gender, gender identity or expression, sexual orientation, national origin, genetics, disability, age, or veteran status.

title: Clinical Psychologist
description:
### **Why You'll Love This Job**



(Salary ranges from $95,000-$140,000 per year)


Take your psychology career to the next level as you work remotely from the comfort of your own home office, helping underserved patients in rural areas receive the healthcare assistance they deserve via tele-video, in MediTelecare's Clinical Psychologist remote telehealth position. We provide in-person, telehealth and also hybrid services, so there are multiple options within our company.  

  

Working remotely as a Clinical Psychologist - Telehealth provider with MediTelecare, you have the unique opportunity to breathe new life into your career, serving as a lifeline to grateful patients who otherwise would go without the mental health treatment they need to lead their best lives. This role will allow you to hone your skills as an expert consultant in behavioral health and, with no administrative or billing duties to tie you down, you are free to fully focus on your patients. Your efforts will be far-reaching, also bringing much-needed and appreciated assistance to under-resourced facility care teams who will welcome your experience and guidance. You personally will benefit from having an established caseload, a generous compensation package with strong earning potential based on productivity, an enviable comprehensive benefits package and a stellar support staff invested in you and your team's success.  

  

Join a dynamic, autonomous environment where your ideas and valued input will help shape the way we work as well as positively impact the future of the telehealth industry! Apply for MediTelecare's Clinical Psychologist - remote Telehealth job opening today.
### **Clinical Psychologist - Telehealth Responsibilities**


* Conduct psychotherapy and behavioral management sessions remotely using tele-video technology
* Perform neurocognitive testing using tele-video technology; provide virtual in-service education
* Collaborate with facility staff; consult with interdisciplinary team members
* Complete patient notes in our Electronic Health Records (EHR) system

  

  

### **Clinical Psychologist - Telehealth Qualifications**


* Ph.D., PsyD, or equivalent doctoral degree in clinical or counseling psychology from an accredited university
* Significant experience in treating adult and/or elderly patient population
* Ability to work on a company provided secure computer using Internet-based electronic applications
* Must have a quiet private location at home or office space in which to consult with patients via tele-video
* Experience working with patients with severe persistent mental illness preferred

title: Outpatient Mental Health Therapist
description:
**NEED TO HAVE LICENSE IN MA.**  

  

**Have you been burnt out by non-profit agency structures? Have you worked in a toxic environment where your worth was correlated with your productivity? Has balancing a commute, a case load and your life become too much?**
  

  

**Are you ready to do something about it?**  

  

**We are looking for Clinicians who want to thrive providing Remote Telehealth Services and are excited to log onto work every day! An environment of acceptance, creativity, humor and appreciation with Clinicians who want to connect with one another, from the comfort of your home.**  

**We understand your role being on the frontlines of an ongoing global pandemic and the toll it takes. We want to care for the caregiver because we understand you’re busy caring for everyone else!**  

**It’s time to walk-the-talk and make a change by joining Ellie Mental Health – Metrowest and give the gift of a healthy work-life balance to yourself that you, and those around you, deserve!**  

**Ellie Mental Health was founded in 2015 by Erin Pash, LMFT and Kyle Keller, LICSW when they opened the first Ellie clinic in Minneapolis. Since then, the Ellie Fam has continued to grow with multiple clinics in Minnesota and a growing number of locally owned and operated franchises across the country.**
  

  

**Why Ellie MH – MW?**  

  

· Strong rates of reimbursement to maximize your income. No need to wait for insurance reimbursements to come in... clinicians are paid ahead of collections!· Ellie Match System to help you build your caseload!· Freedom to manage your own schedule!· Credentialing- we will take care of everything!· Minimum billing of 25 hours / week or make as much as you want!· Health Insurance Benefits - Strong health coverage with a variety of offerings· Dental and Vision Benefits· Professional Development / CEUs- Earn free CEU’s on a variety of mental health topics through Ellie’s extensive library  

  

**Responsibilities include:**  

  

* Establishes positive, trusting rapport with client
* Responsible for creative treatment planning & interventions to assist clients in achieving & exceeding treatment goals

  

  

* Regularly meets with clients for ongoing therapy treatment

  

  

* Complies with National Standards of Care set forth by Massachusetts State Licensing Board or any state where therapist is licensed

  

  

· Complies with federal, state & HIPAA regulations, as it relates to medical records and confidentiality· Maintains Electronic Medical Record & completes all required documentation according to legal standards  

  

· Submits all documentation within 24 hours including documentation of any / all collateral contact· Benefit Eligible Clinicians will maintain a caseload of a minimum 25 billable client sessions / collateral contact hours per week  

  

· Participate in Integrated Care Model by coordinating services with collateral contact providers. Including but not limited to; family members, prescribers, school personnel, Intensive Care Coordinators, Therapeutic Mentors, Case Managers, etc. whenever appropriate· Providing referrals for additional care or services when required  

  

· Attend & actively participate in monthly 1:1 meetings with Clinical Director · Attend & actively participate in monthly group supervisions & staff meetings  

  

· Respond to communications and requests from Clinical Director in a reasonable & professional time frame· Completing all requirements to maintain Licensure  

  

* Review & follow practice & company’s policies & procedures as detailed in provider manual documents

  

  

* Any additional responsibilities as assigned by Clinic Director

  

**Required Qualifications and Skills:**  

  

* Candidates should have clinical licensure (LMHC, LMFT, LPCC, LICSW, LP etc.)

  

  

* Required experience with completing DAs, treatment plans and clinical case notes

  

  

* Effective written and verbal communication skills

  

  

* Ability to demonstrate and model stable, appropriate boundaries with clients

  

  

* Ability to complete and submit documentation of services and other documents in a timely manner

  

  

* Comfort and familiarity working with a diverse client base

  

  

* Proficient in the use of Office 365 and Electronic Health Record systems (Valant experience a plus!)

  

  

* Equal opportunity employer.

  

  

Ellie Mental Health – Metrowest is committed to creating an employment environment that reflects a diverse community.  

  

This is a remote position.

title: Medicare Behavioral Health Outpatient Utilization Management Clinician (Remote)
description:
Bring your heart to CVS Health. Every one of us at CVS Health shares a single, clear purpose: Bringing our heart to every moment of your health. This purpose guides our commitment to deliver enhanced human-centric health care for a rapidly changing world. Anchored in our brand — with heart at its center — our purpose sends a personal message that how we deliver our services is just as important as what we deliver.  

  

Our Heart At Work Behaviors™ support this purpose. We want everyone who works at CVS Health to feel empowered by the role they play in transforming our culture and accelerating our ability to innovate and deliver solutions to make health care more personal, convenient and affordable.


This is a full-time remote position.


The schedule for this position is Monday-Friday 8-5 EST.

**Position Summary**  

The Medicare Behavioral Health Outpatient clinician will be part of the Medicare precertification team. Members of this team will utilize their clinical experience to assess appropriateness of treatment plans for member accessing outpatient services. This team will gather clinical information and apply appropriate clinical judgment to render coverage determination/recommendation that are in line with evidence-based standards and practice guidelines. The UM clinician will work in conjunction with the Clinical Supervisor and Medical Directors to facilitate optimal care/treatment.  

  

**Required Qualifications**

* 1+ year(s) experience working in community based mental health service like Targeted Care Management, Psychosocial Rehabilitation, or related utilization management experience with these services
* Must have active and unrestricted Master's level Behavioral Health clinical license in the state of residence (LMSW, LCSW, LISW, LPC, or comparable) OR active and unrestricted Registered Nurse licensure with psychiatric specialty/certification in state of residence
* Must be willing and able to work 8-5p EST

 **Preferred Qualifications**

* Bilingual English/Spanish
* Knowledge of Milliman Care Guidelines (MCG)

 **Education**

* Minimum of a Master's degree Behavioral /mental health services OR RN degree or diploma with behavioral health experience

**Pay Range**


The typical pay range for this role is:


$0.00 - $0.00
This pay range represents the base hourly rate or base annual full-time salary for all positions in the job grade within which this position falls. The actual base salary offer will depend on a variety of factors including experience, education, geography and other relevant factors. This position is eligible for a CVS Health bonus, commission or short-term incentive program in addition to the base pay range listed above.  

  

In addition to your compensation, enjoy the rewards of an organization that puts our heart into caring for our colleagues and our communities. The Company offers a full range of medical, dental, and vision benefits. Eligible employees may enroll in the Company’s 401(k) retirement savings plan, and an Employee Stock Purchase Plan is also available for eligible employees. The Company provides a fully-paid term life insurance plan to eligible employees, and short-term and long term disability benefits. CVS Health also offers numerous well-being programs, education assistance, free development courses, a CVS store discount, and discount programs with participating partners. As for time off, Company employees enjoy Paid Time Off (“PTO”) or vacation pay, as well as paid holidays throughout the calendar year. Number of paid holidays, sick time and other time off are provided consistent with relevant state law and Company policies.  

  

For more detailed information on available benefits, please visit jobs.CVSHealth.com/benefits


CVS Health requires certain colleagues to be fully vaccinated against COVID-19 (including any booster shots if required), where allowable under the law, unless they are approved for a reasonable accommodation based on disability, medical condition, religious belief, or other legally recognized reasons that prevents them from being vaccinated.


You are required to have received at least one COVID-19 shot prior to your first day of employment and to provide proof of your vaccination status or apply for a reasonable accommodation within the first 10 days of your employment. Please note that in some states and roles, you may be required to provide proof of full vaccination or an approved reasonable accommodation before you can begin to actively work.


CVS Health is committed to recruiting, hiring, developing, advancing, and retaining individuals with disabilities. As such, we strive to provide equal access to the benefits and privileges of employment, including the provision of a reasonable accommodation to perform essential job functions. CVS Health can provide a request for a reasonable accommodation, including a qualified interpreter, written information in other formats, translation or other services through ColleagueRelations@CVSHealth.com If you have a speech or hearing disability, please call 7-1-1 to utilize Telecommunications Relay Services (TRS). We will make every effort to respond to your request within 48 business hours and do everything we can to work towards a solution.

title: Remote Multi-State Licensed Therapist / Telehealth / Work From Home
description:
Virtual Psychiatric Care is a growing national telehealth company providing quality psychiatric services. We are looking to add experienced multi-licensed therapists to join our remote team of psychiatric providers. Work from the comfort of your home with an opportunity to grow your private. Join our team and start practicing independently with free patient referrals.

**Requirements:**

* Masters' Degree in Science, Mental Health, Social Work, Arts or related field -

**REQUIRED**

* Multi-state licensed Independent, licensed Psychologist, Therapist, Counselor or Social Worker who does not require supervision (No Interns)- -**REQUIRED**
* Licensed Psychologist, LCSW (licensed clinical social worker), LMFT (licensed marriage and family therapist), LMHC (licensed mental health counselor), or LPC (licensed professional counselor) – **REQUIRED**
* Licensed to provide counseling in at least 4 **states at minimum**-**Includes Florida**-**Or eligible to obtain Florida Telehealth registration-REQUIRED**
* Minimum of 1 year experience-no supervisory requirements- **REQUIRED**
* Work as Independent Contractor- **REQUIRED**
* **Have own malpractice coverage**

**Expectations/Responsibilities:**

* Experience working with diverse populations in need of psychotherapy and/or counseling services
* Work remotely from home
* Knowledge of mental health and/or substance abuse diagnosis
* Maintain clinical documentation
* Have minimal computer skills and Navigate Basic EMR system
* Own quality computer with video-webcam capabilities and maintain good internet connection.
* Comfortable with telehealth technology and software video communication
* Responding to patient secure messages online or via app within 24 hours
* Awareness of and compliance with HIPAA and 42 CFR Part 2 privacy regulations
* Allow company to advertise and market your services on your behalf as needed
* Allow credentialing with insurance plans under group

**Pay/Schedule:**

* Insured Clients-$45 per 40 min session, $60 per 55 min session. Self-Pay Clients- $75 (45min). Work as 1099 Independent Contractor.
* Part-Time- -1 day a week minimum to start, Any day-Mon-Sat, 4-5 hour slot shift. Grow with us!
* **Guaranteed pay for "No Show" visits-$25**
* Group covers your advertising/marketing costs and telehealth platform usage fees.
* Flexible scheduling

COVID-19 Precaution(s):

* Remote interview process
* Virtual meetings

title: PAID psychotherapy preceptor -LMHC, PsyD, Psychologist (Onsite or virtual)
description:
**Urgent need for Psychiatric Mental Health Nurse Practitioner preceptors** 

**Please read before applying:** 

**We are looking for LICENSED psychologist, licensed clinical social worker, licensed professional counselor, licensed marriage and family therapist or other designated state licensed psychotherapists. Earn additional income doing what you already do by allowing a Nurse Practitioner student to observe therapy sessions and ask questions!** 

1. You must already have an employer that will allow you to precept a student. This can be on site or virtually. Please note, we do not supply the clinical site.

2. You must have an existing caseload of at least 1 patient/client per hour for therapy.

3. You must be Master's prepared or higher, with an active license in good standing.

4. If you work on a virtual platform, you must be able to add a student to your patient/client visits.

5. If you work onsite, you must be able to allow students to sit in on your patient/client visits.

-------

WE NEED YOUR HELP!! There is a NATIONWIDE preceptor shortage. Preceptors serve as a key component of success for Nurse Practitioner students while they learn skills that require hands-on teaching and focused learning. **Preceptors must have an advanced level of clinical acumen, enjoy teaching and work at a clinical site that will allow for NP students.** 

Why precept with MatchNP? Earn compensation for every student you precept. Preceptor paperwork is simplified. Clinical objectives communicated prior to student start date.

The experience of precepting is rewarding. Preceptors maintain clinical knowledge and skills necessary to be an effective preceptor. May be eligible for CME or state tax credits (state dependent). Most importantly, though, you are HELPING a student reach the finish line.

Nurse Practitioner students will come from the Psychiatric Mental Health Nurse Practitioner clinical track.

**Requirements:**

**-Must have clearance from clinical site to precept students prior to applying.** 

-Hold active certification as an PsyD, PhD, LCSW, LPC, LMFT, LMHC provider for at least 1 year.

-Currently working as a therapist or social worker for at least 1 year

-Work in a clinical setting that can offer a rotation in Psych/mental health (on-site or virtually).

**Preferred qualification:**

-Previous experience as a preceptor

**Additional benefits:**

**\\*Earn extra income doing what you already do.**

\\*We pre-screen the students to ensure they meet criteria. We want the preceptors to have a positive experience as well.

\\*New to precepting? We can mentor and share educational materials to help.

\\*We provide 24/7 support during your student's rotation.

\\*We simplify the student's clinical paperwork for your convenience.
