title: Psychologist - Licensed or License Eligible
company: Blue Square Counseling and Wellness Center
description:
**Job Description:** Clinical Team Member (CTM) - BlueSquare

**About the Company:** If you often think: ***I wish I were more supported in my work and felt valued as a critical component in the care of my clients.*** Then let’s talk!

Clinicians are the primary focus at Blue Square. Our practice celebrates and supports our clinicians both personally and professionally so they can focus on providing the best quality care possible to the clients they see.

Some of the ways Blue Square does things differently:

* Extended onboarding support that includes mentoring and a transition period into the private practice environment
* Monthly collaboration and case consultations
* Regular training that hones skills and expertise
* Flexible scheduling to encourage work / life harmony while still maintaining adequate client load and practice needs
* Education stipends to build expertise
* Supportive leadership that provides learning and growth opportunities
* Weekly paid time for self-care

**Position Overview:** We are seeking a dedicated and experienced Clinical Team Member to join our dynamic mental health clinic. The Clinical Team Member will ensure the delivery of high-quality care to our clients. The successful candidate will possess clinical expertise and a passion for promoting mental health.

**Our preference is for hybrid or on-site therapists but we are open to exploring remote only providers if you're a good fit!**

**US BASED APPLICANTS ONLY!**

**We Are Looking For You If You:**

* Love doing psychotherapy. Your clients and the work you do together energizes you.
* Don’t want to worry about where your next client is coming from. We’ve got you covered with a steady stream of referrals.
* Want to work with clients who are a good fit for your practice niche. We will support you in finding your niche and then tailor your client assignments so we are hitting your sweet spot.
* Have a passion for learning and growing as a person and a professional. Being the best takes work, we know that and support you with educational stipends and in-house trainings.
* Know that we need to support one another to be successful. We don’t do negativity or drama.
* Value being part of a team. We invest a lot into our team members and are looking for individuals who want to work for a practice that cares.
* Are committed to inspiring your coworkers, clients and our local communities. We don’t just say we do good work, we engage in the behaviors that support good work.
* Want to be the best therapist you can be. You didn’t get into this field to be ho hum, which means you feel comfortable asking for help and support. We can’t know everything and that’s why we have a team of incredible admins and clinicians to lean on.
* Are available to work two evenings until 7 pm or one evening and one weekend day. We focus on meeting the needs of all our community members and after school and work are the most requested times for therapy.
* Want a work-life balance. We know you need time for you and we want you to have that. Our full-time work week is 30 hours.
* Want more than the status quo mental health practice.
* Are licensed or license eligible in the State of Massachusetts. We have weekly consultation meetings to support our clinical team members and offer supervision toward licensure at no cost for our license eligible team members.

**Qualifications:**

* Master's or Doctoral degree in Psychology or a related field. Licensure as an independent clinician in Massachusetts is good, but we are happy to work with pre-licensed individuals!
* Knowledge of evidence-based therapeutic approaches and interventions for various mental health conditions.
* Excellent communication skills, both written and verbal, with the ability to collaborate effectively with diverse clients and team members.
* Strong understanding of ethical and legal considerations in mental health practice.
* Proficiency in electronic health records (EHR) and other relevant software applications.
* Commitment to ongoing professional development and staying current with best practices in the field.
* Empathy, cultural competence, and a genuine passion for promoting mental health and well-being.

**The Fine Print:**

* Reimbursement: We are not the highest paying practice in the area. We aren’t the lowest either. We believe in paying a fair and competitive wage and in exchange we offer our employees a ton of support and flexibility.
* We will support, encourage and help pay for you to develop your approved area of specialization.
* We encourage you to grow your clinical skills and be more than a sit and chat therapist
* We market you so you become known as an authority and resource in our local communities in your field of specialization.
* We can fill your caseload as long as you know how to retain a client.
* We do things for our team members because we care, not because we have to.
* We do all the un-fun stuff that makes the business run (billing, client screening, insurance verification, answering the phone, marketing, buying supplies so it's always in the office waiting for you like coffee, tissues and toilet paper!)
* Time Off: All of our team members receive paid time off and paid sick time.
* Birthday Holiday: All team members are given a floating holiday as a birthday present!
* Health Benefits: Medical, dental, and vision benefits available for our full time team members.
* Retirement: 401K plan available to all of our team members
* Life Insurance: Life insurance available to all of our team members

Ready to apply?

***Send us your resume and a cover letter along with the following requested personality profiles to assist us in placing you inside our team of providers to hello @ bluesquarecounseling.com.***

**https://www.123test.com/disc-personality-test/** - super easy and straightforward test, just send a screenshot of the pie chart at the end

**https://personalitymax.com/personality-test/** - a little longer test, you can send us the PDF or URL provided to you at the end. This test is FREE. If you are asked to pay at any point make sure you are on the correct URL. **People have clicked on the ads in the past instead of the test and it takes them somewhere else.**

title: Licensed Mental Health Professional (Emotional Support Animal Evaluator)
description:
**Wellness Wag's Unique Origin:**

Wellness Wag was established by dedicated pet enthusiasts who share your deep love for our furry companions. We recognize that our pets hold a special place in our hearts as beloved family members, and we place a paramount emphasis on the reassuring feeling that comes from keeping them by our side, no matter where life takes us.

**Our Unwavering Belief:**

Within Wellness Wag, we hold a steadfast conviction in the significance of maintaining a profound connection with your pets. This connection serves as a cornerstone for their overall well-being as well as your own peace of mind.

**Position Description**

We are actively seeking a Licensed Mental Health Professional to join the Wellness Wag team and help us turn our vision into reality. We are in search of an ethical, competent, and compassionate mental health professional who can connect with clients and assess their suitability for an emotional support animal. You should thrive in a fast-paced and ambitious environment while upholding our core values of mutual respect and collaboration, which are the cornerstones of our team's success. Above all, you should share our unwavering passion for mental wellness, pets, and our mission to enhance their health and happiness on a grand scale.

**What You’ll Do**

* Conduct Mental Health Assessments: Leverage your expertise to evaluate clients' mental health and determine if they would benefit from an emotional support animal. If appropriate, prescribe an emotional support animal.
* **Ensure Timely Appointments:** Take on the responsibility of proactively calling patients at the scheduled time of their appointment, ensuring a seamless and punctual consultation experience.

**Qualifications We're Looking For**

* **Expertise in Issuing ESA Letters:** Demonstrated experience in prescribing emotional support animal (ESA) letters, along with a solid understanding of the relevant regulations and guidelines.
* **Proficient in Remote Consultations:** Adept at conducting effective phone and/or virtual consultations, ensuring clients receive top-notch care and guidance.
* **Exceptional Communication Skills:** Strong verbal and written communication skills to connect with clients compassionately and convey information clearly and empathetically.
* **Tech-Savvy Enthusiasm:** A positive and tech-savvy mindset, with the ability to troubleshoot computer or connectivity issues, contributing to smooth and uninterrupted consultations.

**What You'll Bring**

One of the following licenses is required:

* Licensed Marriage and Family Therapist (LMFT)
* Licensed Professional Clinical Counselor (LPCC)
* Licensed Clinical Psychologist (Ph.D. or PsyD)
* Licensed Clinical Social Worker (LCSW)
* Doctor of Medicine (MD)
* Doctor of Osteopathic Medicine (DO)
* Nurse Practitioner (NP)

**Location**

At Wellness Wag, we believe in the power of talent from anywhere, and we operate as a remote-first organization. This role can be performed from anywhere in the US.

**About Wellness Wag**

At Wellness Wag, we understand that pets are cherished family members, and we prioritize the peace of mind that comes from being able to have them with us wherever we go.

Wellness Wag connects individuals with qualified mental health professionals in their state who are authorized to prescribe ESA Letters for housing and travel.

Our service is fully compliant with federal and state laws, providing you with the assurance that we have taken all necessary steps to offer this valuable service. Join us in making a positive impact on the well-being of pets and their owners.

title: Virtual Behavioral Health Therapist (PsyD, PhD, EdD)
description:
**About Us**



One Medical is a primary care solution challenging the industry status quo by making quality care more affordable, accessible and enjoyable. But this isn't your average doctor's office. We're on a mission to transform healthcare, which means improving the experience for everyone involved - from patients and providers to employers and health networks. Our seamless in-office and 24/7 virtual care services, on-site labs, and programs for preventive care, chronic care management, common illnesses and mental health concerns have been delighting people for the past fifteen years.



In February 2023 we marked a milestone when One Medical joined Amazon. Together, we look to deliver exceptional health care to more consumers, employers, care team members, and health networks to achieve better health outcomes. As we continue to grow and seek to impact more lives, we're building a diverse, driven and empathetic team, while working hard to cultivate an environment where everyone can thrive.


**The Opportunity:**



We are currently seeking a full time Licensed Clinical Psychologist, who is interested in joining a virtual behavioral health collaborative care program and is committed to changing the care delivery experience for both patients and providers.


**What you'll likely work on:**


* Manage the assessment and treatment of psychiatric concerns, psychosocial issues, and health behavior change through brief psychotherapeutic interventions delivered virtually
* Participate in rounds with psychiatric consultant and care managers
* Provide education and consultation to behavioral health care managers and primary care providers
* Overseeing referrals to specialty mental health services and supporting a smooth transition from specialty mental health services to primary care and back
* Collaborate with other Behavioral Health Providers across our national network to improve behavioral health skills company wide
* Work closely with Virtual Medical Directors, Clinical Operations Team and National Director of Virtual Behavioral Health Services


**What you'll need:**


* Must be either a licensed Clinical Psychologist PhD, PsyD or EdD in Psychology
* Licensed to independently practice with no current supervision requirements
* Must have an active license in **California**
* For PhD/PsyD/EdD Candidates: 1 year post licensure with specific experience in adult outpatient diagnostic evaluation and psychotherapy
* Experience providing a range of brief, goal directed and focused clinical services
* Has exceptional capacity to multitask, is flexible, and is comfortable with ambiguity
* Has strong communication and teaching skills
* Willingness to work 40 hours per week, including 80% direct patient care and 20% administrative time
* Eligible to be credentialed with our Health System Partner
* Fluency in English
* Strong preference for fluency in Mandarin
* Reside within the USA or US Territories
* Virtual psychotherapy experience (preferred)


**Physical Space Requirements:**


* HIPAA compliant area within home that is secure, quiet and isolated from others to protect PHI


**One Medical Providers also demonstrate:**


* The ability to successfully communicate with and provide care to individuals of all backgrounds
* The ability to effectively use technology to deliver high quality care
* The desire to be an integral part of a team dedicated to changing healthcare delivery
* Clinical proficiency in a range of brief, goal directed and focused clinical services using cognitive-behavioral therapies (ACT, BT, CBT, DBT), brief interpersonal therapy and/or other evidenced short term models
* Familiarity with measurement based care, ability to administer and interpret standardized patient reported outcome tools in monitoring treatment effectiveness and adjusting treatment as indicated
* The ability to confidently navigate uncertain situations with both patients and colleagues and the ability to practice effectively within the dynamic organizational and financial structures of a primary care delivery system
* An openness to feedback and reflection to gain productive insight into strengths and weaknesses
* Readiness to adapt personal and interpersonal behavior to meet the needs of our patients
* Has exceptional capacity to multitask, is flexible, and is comfortable with ambiguity


**Benefits designed to aid your health and wellness:**



Taking care of you today


* Paid sabbatical after 5,10 and 15 years of employment
* Employee Assistance Program - Free confidential advice for team members who need help with stress, anxiety, financial planning, and legal issues
* Competitive Medical, Dental and Vision plans that start day one of employment
* Free One Medical memberships for yourself, your friends and family
* Pre-Tax commuter benefits
* PTO cash outs - Option to cash out up to 40 accrued hours per year


Protecting your future for you and your family


* 401K match
* Credit towards emergency childcare
* Extra contributions toward maternity and paternity leave
* Paid Life Insurance - One Medical pays 100% of the cost of Basic Life Insurance
* Disability insurance - One Medical pays 100% of the cost of Short Term and Long Term Disability Insurance


 Supporting your medical career


* Malpractice Insurance - Malpractice fees to insure your practice at One Medical is covered 100%
* Psych Hub and UpToDate Subscriptions - evidence-based clinical research tools
* Continuing Medical Education (CME/CEU) - Receive an annual stipend for continuing medical education
* Rounds - Providers end patient care one hour early each week to participate in this shared learning experience


This is a full-time, virtual role that requires an active CA state license.



One Medicalis committed to fair and equitable compensation practices.



The base salary range for this role is $120,000 to $137,000 per year. Final determination of starting pay may vary based on factors such as practice experience and patient care schedule. Additional pay may be determined for those candidates that exceed these specified qualifications and requirements. For more information, visit https://www.onemedical.com/careers/



INDCLN1


One Medical is an equal opportunity employer, and we encourage qualified applicants of every background, ability, and life experience to contact us about appropriate employment opportunities.  

  

One Medical participates in E-Verify and will provide the federal government with your Form I-9 information to confirm that you are authorized to work in the U.S. Please refer to the E-Verification Poster (English/Spanish) and Right to Work Poster (English/Spanish) for additional information.

Searching for a group private practice where you can focus on your case load while feeling supported by the people around you? We would love to talk. Matone Counseling provides top notch administrative support in a team environment that allows the clinician to focus on client care while we manage the billing, scheduling, insurance, and paperwork. This is an independent contractor role meaning the clinician has tremendous schedule flexibility while enjoying all the benefits of a well established group practice with strong operational support and a team environment.

title: Remote Clinical Counselor
description:
**\\*\\*This position requires the selected candidates to be within 100 miles of a Naval Installation in the region they are supporting. To meet that requirement for this opening, you must be within 100 miles of a Naval Installation in one of the following locations: \\*\\***


* **Kitsap, WA**
* **Bremerton, WA**
* **Everett, WA**
* **Whidbey Island, WA**
* **Point Loma, CA**
* **Lemoore, CA**
* **Monterey, CA**
* **Coronado, CA**
* **Ventura, CA**
* **San Diego, CA**
* **Ventura County, CA**


**Job Title:** Remote Clinical Counselor


**Essential Duties and Responsibilities**


* Scope of practice is limited to counseling services for Other Conditions That May Be a Focus of Clinical Attention and Adjustment Disorders.
* Ensure referral for appropriate behavioral health follow-up of any psychological disorders or symptoms requiring longer-term and/or medical/psychiatric intervention. Conduct intake, screening, assessment, and referral of clients as appropriate. Work with the client to establish an individual treatment plan. Provide individual and couples, and group counseling. Provide information about existing Navy programs such as NMC Counseling Services at the sites. Provide immediate intervention and risk assessment IAW best practices in the mental health community and educate and ensure adequate referral and follow-up of any case presenting suicidal or homicidal risk.
* Perform accurate assessment of the client’s presenting problem and plan effective treatment for that problem.
* Provide an initial clinical assessment and ongoing risk assessments using the Columbia Suicide Severity Risk Scale (C-SSRS). Provide ongoing safety planning using the Veterans Affairs Safety Plan.
* Report suspected child abuse and domestic abuse/violence to the local civilian authorities and the Family Advocacy Representative IAW Navy and state requirements.
* Coordinate and manage specialized assessment and intervention services for children and families not associated with met criteria incidents of child abuse/neglect or domestic abuse.
* Provide a warm handoff to the Family Advocacy Representative or FAP Victim Advocate for clients wanting to make a restricted domestic abuse report.
* Provide a warm handoff to the Sexual Assault Response Coordinator or SAPR Victim Advocate for clients wanting to make a restricted sexual assault report.
* Intervene in crisis situations, using sound professional judgment, ethical practice, and common sense.
* Remote Clinical Counselors may be authorized to provide temporary surge support (telephonically and through Navy authorized virtual platforms) across additional Navy Regions when there is an increased number of cases within a region. All efforts should be made to provide appointments in the time zone of the Sailor’s location.
* Participate in regional quarterly quality assurance procedures to ensure that all clinical services provided are safe and of good quality.
* Maintain counseling case documentation in the FFSMIS Clinical Counseling Record System for all non-medical counseling assessment and counseling services IAW all applicable policies, laws, and instructions.
* Ensure all non-medical counseling services are accounted for in the FFSMIS scheduling module.


**Required Education and/or Experience Qualifications**


* Must be physically located within 100 miles of a Navy installation in the assigned area of responsibility.
* Minimum educational qualifications include one of the following; a master’s degree in counseling accredited by the Council for Accreditation of Counseling and Related Educational Programs; a master’s degree in social work accredited by the Council on Social Work Education, a master’s degree in marriage and family therapy accredited by the Commission on Accreditation of Marriage and Family Therapy Education, or a doctoral degree in clinical or counseling psychology and a one-year clinical internship accredited by the American Psychological Association.
* Current, valid and unrestricted clinical license or certification from a state or U.S. territory authorizing independent clinical practice in the fields of professional counseling, clinical social work, marriage and family therapy or clinical/counseling psychology- LCSW (Licensed Clinical Social Worker), LMFT (Licensed Marriage and Family Therapist), LCP (Licensed Clinical Psychologist/ Licensed PhD in Psychology), LPC (Licensed Professional Counselor), LCPC (Licensed Certified Professional Counselor), LMHC (Licensed Mental Health Counselor)
* Each Remote Clinical Counselor must maintain current clinical credentials and privileges throughout their FFSP assignment.
* A minimum of two years- of full-time, post-master’s supervised clinical experience.
* Remote Clinical Counselors must meet or exceed the requirements for Tier II clinical practitioners.
* Remote Clinical Counselors must meet the standards of professional and ethical conduct prescribed by their particular discipline or licensing board and demonstrate current clinical competence through at least periodic, direct service clinical experience during the 2 years preceding hire.


**Preferred Qualifications**


* Knowledge of the difficulties of adjusting to general life stresses as well as those resulting from the requirements of military life, and experience providing short-term counseling for those issues
* Knowledge of standard documentation requirements for clinical services
* Knowledge of available military and community referral resources
* Ability to work effectively with diverse racial, ethnic, and socioeconomic backgrounds
* Proficiency in oral and written communication skills
* Knowledge of Microsoft Office Suite software and skilled in the use of office software Experience working in a virtual environment and competency in telehealth clinical service delivery


**Other Skills and Abilities**


**Requirements:** All positions that require access to U.S. Government facilities and systems require U.S. Citizenship, and reliable transportation to travel to assigned locations and nearby facilities.


**Competencies**



To perform the job successfully, an individual should demonstrate the following competencies:


* **Ability to work both independently and as part of a team.**
* **Customer Service -** Manages difficult or emotional customer situations; Responds promptly to customer needs; Solicits customer feedback to improve service; Responds to requests for service and assistance; Meets commitments.
* **Interpersonal Skills -** Focuses on solving conflict, not blaming; Maintains confidentiality; Listens to others without interrupting; Keeps emotions under control; Remains open to others' ideas and tries new things.
* **Oral Communication -** Speaks clearly and persuasively in positive or negative situations; Listens and gets clarification; Responds well to questions; Demonstrates group presentation skills; Participates in meetings.
* **Written Communication -** Writes clearly and informatively; Edits work for spelling and grammar; Varies writing style to meet needs; Presents numerical data effectively; Able to read and interpret written information.
* **Change Management -** Develops workable implementation plans; Communicates changes effectively; Builds commitment and overcomes resistance; Prepares and supports those affected by change; Monitors transition and evaluates results.
* **Judgment -** Displays willingness to make decisions; Exhibits sound and accurate judgment; Supports and explains reasoning for decisions; Includes appropriate people in decision-making process; Makes timely decisions.
* **Professionalism -** Approaches others in a tactful manner; Reacts well under pressure; Treats others with respect and consideration regardless of their status or position; Accepts responsibility for own actions; Follows through on commitments.


**Physical Requirements:** Uses personal computer, telephones, copiers, printers and other office equipment. Sits, stands, bends, lifts, and moves intermittently during working hours. The employee must occasionally lift and/or move up to 10 pounds.


**Work Environment:**

Reasonable accommodations may be made to enable individuals with disabilities to perform the essential functions.



Must have a dedicated professional workspace that that provides a secure, private environment suitable for telehealth clinical services and staff supervision and is free of distractions or personal commitments during the workday.


***Zeiders Enterprises, Inc. is an Equal Opportunity Employer***



Pay Rate: $68,000 - $103,000



PLEASE NOTE: The Zeiders pay range for this job level is a general guideline only and not a guarantee of compensation or salary. Additional factors considered in extending an offer include (but are not limited to) responsibilities of the job, education, experience, knowledge, skills, and abilities, as well as internal equity, alignment with market data, applicable bargaining agreement (if any), or other law.

  

Equal Opportunity Employer/Protected Veterans/Individuals with Disabilities


The contractor will not discharge or in any other manner discriminate against employees or applicants because they have inquired about, discussed, or disclosed their own pay or the pay of another employee or applicant. However, employees who have access to the compensation information of other employees or applicants as a part of their essential job functions cannot disclose the pay of other employees or applicants to individuals who do not otherwise have access to compensation information, unless the disclosure is (a) in response to a formal complaint or charge, (b) in furtherance of an investigation, proceeding, hearing, or action, including an investigation conducted by the employer, or (c) consistent with the contractor’s legal duty to furnish information. 41 CFR 60-1.35(c)

title: Clinical Psychologist (Remote)
description:
**About Us:**

At GI Psychology, we are a passionate team of telehealth clinicians dedicated to improving the lives of individuals with gastrointestinal disorders and other complex medical conditions. We provide data-driven interventions and treatments, collaborating closely with interdisciplinary teams to make a meaningful impact for our patients and communities. Our mission is to increase nation-wide access to quality gastro psychology services.

**The Opportunity:** 

Join us in a journey where you can further cultivate your professional and clinical abilities and make a significant impact in advancing the field of health psychology. In this role, you will have the unique opportunity to be at the forefront of delivering highly effective gut-brain psychotherapy while collaborating with expert GI providers throughout the nation. We thrive on continuous learning and consultation, making it an environment where you can truly excel while embodying our core values of integrity, innovation, and interpersonal generosity. Join us in making a meaningful impact on the lives of those in need while advancing your career in a supportive and growth-focused organization.

Our opening for a Clinical Psychologist entails a 35-hour work week, inclusive of 24-26 clinical hours as well as internal and external collaboration, program development, community and provider outreach, and ongoing professional development. With a ‘pick your own schedule’ approach, the sole requirement for the schedule is 8 hours after 4pm EST and/or on the weekends. This clinical psychologist position offers an annual salary starting at $101,000 with opportunity for performance based bonuses. We provide robust clinical support so you can focus on the activities that excite you and have various pathways for advancement and leadership. Virginia licensure and completion of external hypnosis training is required prior to start.

**Who You Are:** 

You are a Licensed Clinical Psychologist who identifies as a life-long learner and is energized by providing outcomes-driven psychotherapy to various age groups. You’re not looking for a transition job; you’re seeking a career where your sophisticated clinical skills and passion for increasing access to specialized behavioral health will be nurtured and valued.

Join us in our mission to increase awareness and utilization of effective treatments for Disorders of the Gut-Brain Interaction. If you're a Clinical Psychologist who is driven by the desire to excel, collaborate, and contribute to meaningful change, we want to hear from you.

**How to Apply:**

Please submit your resume and a letter detailing your motivation to join GI Psychology and how you align with our values. Please note clinical experience

title: Psychologist
description:
**Description**


Decypher is seeking Psychologist candidates to support the ADCMS V contract at Landstuhl Regional Medical Center. The successful candidate will possess the required education, skills, and experience called for in the contract as described below. US Citizenship and active NACI clearance required.


**About Decypher**


Decypher is a leading integrator of professional, technology, and management solutions and services. We provide our services globally to Federal, Commercial, Local and State clients. Our employees are our most valuable assets and play an integral role in the success of Decypher and our clients. Working at Decypher is not a job, but a career where your talent and energy is respected and you can personally make a difference. Decypher invites you to join our professional team. Decypher is an equal opportunity/affirmative action employer committed to diversifying its workforce (M/F/D/V).


**Responsibilities**


* Practice within the guidelines of their state licensing board, American Psychological Association Ethical Principles and Code of Conduct, and MTF privileges.


* Conduct psychological evaluations utilizing information from clinical interviews, psychological testing, and collateral sources, as appropriate.


* Establish psychiatric diagnoses according to the American Psychiatric Association Diagnostic and Statistical Manual of Disorders.


* Provide psychological treatment for individuals and groups; help medical and surgical patients deal with illnesses or injuries.


* Assist in rehabilitation of patients.


**Required Education, Experience and Skills**


* Degree: Doctor of Philosophy (PhD) or Doctor of Psychology (PsyD).


* Education: Graduate from an American Psychology Association accredited college or university with a doctoral degree in clinical or counseling psychology.


* Internship/Residency: Successful completion from an internship in psychology accredited by the American Psychological Association.


* Experience: As required to meet clinical competency requirements specified in the Service-specific credentialing instruction

title: Psychotherapist - Remote
description:
Waves Holistic Healing is expanding!

We are seeking new team members to fill the role of Psychotherapist - Full Time (15+ clients per week, on average).

You must have at least three years of relevant experience working one-on-one with clients.

In order to be successful in this role, the following qualities are essential:

* You have a strong sense of self. You know who you are!
* You have a sense of humor.
* You enjoy improvising.
* You are creative.
* You’re grounded.
* Other people would describe you as having strong boundaries, including your clients.
* You have a consistent practice of going to therapy. Or if it’s not therapy, maybe it’s bodywork, energy healing, breathwork sessions, hypnotherapy, yoga, etc. Whatever it is, you are receiving support and are committed to your own personal healing journey. That commitment is represented by a tangible and consistent practice.
* You have a supportive community and supportive relationships.
* You are kind and warm-hearted.
* Your written and spoken communication is clear, organized and easy to understand.
* You see your clients as sovereign beings and respect them authentically.
* You are able to quickly perceive what the root issues are when meeting with clients.
* You have a good relationship with money, and are able to communicate clearly and professionally about financial matters with clients as needed.
* You are receptive to feedback.
* You have your own signature style when it comes to therapy. No one else does it quite like you.
* You know something others don’t. This might be an unpopular or controversial opinion, and it’s evidence that you’re a free-thinker.
* You’re not just in favor of the latest trendy thing. Your heart is genuinely connected to your work and it’s not based on external pressure, guilt, or a need to perform.
* You ask questions.
* You don’t find the typical ‘difficult’ client to be difficult.
* You find yourself energized and not drained by doing therapy. You know how to maintain good energetic boundaries and shake off the heavy stuff in between and after sessions.
* You are independent.
* You’re an avid learner.

Professional growth:

We currently offer clinical supervision, training and professional mentoring to staff therapists. Training may draw from the following practices and theoretical orientations:

* EMDR (Eye Movement Desensitization and Reprocessing)
* Brainspotting
* Hypnotherapy
* Somatic experiencing
* Emotion release practices
* Ritual practices for trauma, personal and family healing
* Meditation
* Energy healing techniques including Reiki
* Internal Family Systems
* Ayurveda
* Gestalt Therapy

Licensing requirements include:

* If you are an independently licensed clinician (professional counselor, clinical social worker, clinical psychologist, marriage and family therapist), your license could be active in any state in the US. You can work remotely from anywhere, as long as you’re in compliance with board requirements.
* If you are a provisionally licensed clinician (professional counselor, clinical social worker, clinical psychologist, marriage and family therapist), your license may be active in Illinois, Arizona or Florida. These are the states for which we are currently offering clinical supervision. You can still work remotely from anywhere, as long as you’re in compliance with board requirements.

Bonus:

You have a unique specialization to offer that you could integrate into your work as a therapist. Examples include:

* Breathwork, herbalism, Yoga Teacher Training, fluency in languages other than English, meditation training, facilitation and/or organization of retreats, Ayurveda training, tantra training

* Telehealth

title: Mental Health Therapist for Telehealth | Work From Home!
description:
**Job description**

Hello + Welcome. Thanks for reviewing our job description :)

**Why work for us:**

**You are Top Priority:** Your happiness is our top priority! We want our team of therapists to feel good about working here. Being heard and feeling valued is extremely important! We pride ourselves in being able to accomplish this.

**Only See Clients You Want:** Choosing who you want to take on and work with is completely up to you! We *NEVER* expect you to work with a client outside of your preference. Ever.

**Choose Your Own Hours:** Choose your own hours...you tell us when you want to work and we'll fill up your schedule! Build up your caseload at a pace you are comfortable with.

**All day Support:** We are only a phone call or a text away if you have any questions, comments, or concerns. We pride ourselves in being readily available to help our clinicians! You won't have to wait long to get a response from us. We are EXTREMELY responsive. The practice owner loves being here for her team of therapists and is described as being very supportive.

**Practice Feel:** We strive to create a warm, helpful, and respectful environment for our therapists. Our goal is for you to have a positive & pleasant experience working here. This is a boutique practice with a small practice feel where the owner is a licensed clinical psychologist who is available to consult or bounce ideas off of.

**Intake & Scheduling:** We will help check all insurance benefits in advance, take care of intake paperwork, help with initial appointment scheduling, and follow up on all the insurance claims.

**Telehealth:** You can choose between Telehealth or in-person! It's completely up to you.

**Credentialing:** If you are *not* in network with any insurance companies,we can help guide you on how to get paneled so the process becomes less stressful. We will be there to help you the best way we can!If you are passionate about helping others improve their mental health, we’d love to hear from you! We are a team of warm + skilled therapists. You focus on the clinical work, and we'll take care of the rest!

-------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------

If you are passionate about helping others improve their mental health, we’d love to hear from you! We are a team of warm + skilled therapists. You focus on the clinical work, and we will take care of the rest!

title: Remote Trauma Therapist
description:
**Aloha! We are a Hawaii-based Holistic and Integrative Psychotherapy & Psychiatry Center looking for Psychologists/LMHC/LCSW/LMFTs who are trained in specific trauma healing modalities to serve the community of Hawaii. You must have or be willing to apply for a Hawaiian License for this job.**

**Our mission** is to support people to become who they truly are, heal their deepest wounds at the root causes, and to live a fulfilling and meaningful life.

We would be honored to have you join us in fulfilling this mission together and supporting the community of the Hawaiian islands. Come work with your ideal clients and create your own schedule supported by a team of open-hearted and highly-skilled Therapists. We are hiring full-time and part-time (**at least 15 client sessions per week**) licensed therapists to treat clients in a private practice setting in Kailua, Hawaii on Oahu. This job can be performed remotely through HIPAA-secure Telehealth.

This is a **flexible position** where therapists can create their own ideal schedule. You will need to have one of these **Hawaii Licenses** for this position: Licensed Psychologist, Licensed Clinical Social Worker LCSW, Licensed Marriage & Family Therapist LMFT, or Licensed Mental Health Counselor LMHC.

We are a husband and wife team who are both psychotherapists and looking to hire compassionate, caring, highly-skilled Psychologists or Psychotherapists to join our practice as Independent Contractors.

**We will provide as many Hawaii-based clients as you would like to work with**, **Intake Team** that takes care of paperwork and up front dealings with clients, **Remote Group Clinical Supervision**, a **loving and supportive community** to be a part of, and **easy insurance billing** with our practice management software.

**Remote Group Supervision** starts with a meditation that we lead. Then, everyone gets to check in and share how they are doing in their lives and be supported by all of us. Then, we celebrate successes with clients and then bring up any cases or support needed around clients. We all share our wisdom and offerings. We are truly a little Ohana (family) and create lots of connection during this time where we all laugh together and cry together.

**We believe our job is to support our Providers to give their soul gifts to the world. We believe therapy is an art and we are here to empower our Therapists to evolve and grow in their art form. We hire rockstar Therapists that we trust and let them do their thing!** 

**Great centrally located Kailua Location (if you are ever in Hawaii)**: We have 5 newly renovated office suites on the 2nd level of the Davis Building across from Kalapawai Cafe.

The position is for a minimum of 1 year. You must be an American citizen to be considered for this job position.

**Job Responsibilities**:

* Providing psychotherapy services
* Scheduling with clients
* Conducting new client intake and assessment
* Taking progress notes on each session
* Collecting and recording payments

**Job Requirements**:

1. Licensed in the State of Hawaii

2. Trained in either:

* Specific trauma healing modality, such as EMDR, Internal Family Systems (IFS) Therapy, Somatic Experiencing (SE), Sensorimotor, Brainspotting, Dialectical Behavior Therapy (DBT), Comprehensive Resource Model (CRM), Integrative Body Psychotherapy (IBP), etc.
* OR a specific Couples Therapy modality such as PACT, EFT, Gottman, Imago, etc.

**Qualities Required from Applicants**:

* Loving & Open-Hearted
* Compassionate
* Dedicated to each client’s growth
* Confident in clinical abilities
* Responsible
* Trustworthy
* Pro-Active and Motivated
* Able to stay on top of notes and billing
* Authentic
* Open-minded
* Clear communicator
* Willing to ask for support when needed
* Able to quickly build rapport and connection with new clients

**To apply, please** ***submit your resume and cover letter and answer all the following questions including the Phone Interview Questions (Indeed will send that request to you separately):***

**What specific trauma healing modalities are you trained in?**

**What therapeutic modalities do you utilize with clients?**

**What client populations do you work with (age range, couples, families, kids etc)?** 

**How many hours per week are you looking to see clients?** 

**Why are you interested in this position and how can you contribute to our community of therapists?**

Mahalo and we greatly look forward to hearing from you!

title: Licensed Mental Health Clinician- ADHD Diagnosis and Treatment
description:
**Job Details:**

**Hourly Pay: $100**

**Location: Remote**

**Practising States: Licensed within KS, DE, WY, MO, MI or CA** 

**Benefits: Subsidy to increase licensure**

**Company Description**

Are you a Licensed Mental Health Professional looking for a unique opportunity to make a positive impact in the mental health space?

Our fast-growing, remote-first startup is revolutionizing mental health care with the support of significant seed funding. We're not only dedicated to providing accessible and effective services, but we're also committed to healthcare compliance - so you can feel good about what you're working on. With a relentless focus on patient wellness, we're on track to become a leading provider of mental health care through our cutting-edge digital product.

We're seeking top-tier talent to join our passionate team and help us achieve this ambitious goal. If you're up for the challenge, we want to hear from you!

**Our Clinic Philosophy**

At our ADHD clinic, we believe in creating an environment that allows our clinicians to flourish and utilize evidence based practices. We prioritize respect and collaboration, allowing our team to focus on what they do best: helping patients succeed.

The clinic is based on two pillars, creating the best workplace for our clinicians and focusing our efforts on patient success.

**Position Description**

We're hiring a licensed mental health professional to join our growing team of mental health professionals.

In this role, you'll be responsible for providing evidence-based mental health care to our patients, developing and implementing treatment plans, and collaborating with our team to ensure that our patients receive the best possible care.

**What You'll Do**

* Provide evidence-based mental health care to our patients, including individual and group therapy, crisis intervention, and case management.
* Develop and implement treatment plans that are tailored to the individual needs of our patients and are in line with best practices and clinical guidelines.
* Collaborate with our team of mental health professionals to ensure that our patients receive comprehensive, coordinated care.
* Maintain accurate and up-to-date patient records in accordance with legal and ethical standards.
* Help to shape our treatment philosophy and contribute to the development of clinical policies and procedures.
* Participate in quality assurance activities, including clinical audits, peer review, and outcome monitoring.

If you're ready to join a team that's making a real difference in mental health care, we want to hear from you!

**Who You Are**

* Licensed in at least one of these states: **KS, DE, WY, MO, MI or CA**
* PMHNP
* Licensed Clinical Psychologist
* Licensed Professional Counselor
* Licensed Marriage and Family Therapist
* Licensed clinical social worker
* A genuine passion for helping others.
* Excellent communication and interpersonal skills.
* Strong organizational skills.
* Detail-oriented.
* Practical.
* Keen to be part of a growing company.

**Time Commitment**

* This is a flexible part-time role, and we ask for a minimum of **6–10 hours** of availability per week.

**Location**

* We are fully remote – you can work wherever you’re most productive.

**Compensation**

* This is a 1099 role which will be paid at a fixed, industry-standard hourly rate per appointment
* Should you wish to expand your licensure to new states, we will subsidize the costs.

Job Type: Part-time

Pay: $100.00 per hour

Expected hours: 5 – 10 per week

Medical specialties:

* Psychiatry

* Remote
* Telehealth

title: DSHS BHA Behavioral Health Psychologist
company: State of Washington Dept. of Social and Health Services
description:
**Description**
---------------


**DSHS BHA Behavioral Health Psychologist**  

  

**SEEKING COMPASSIONATE VISIONARIES**  

 Tired of feeling like your efforts do not matter? Frustrated with not being able to try out new ideas and creative solutions? Join our team and make a real impact on real lives while helping to grow a new program! We are seeking someone who wants to put their psychological acumen to good use and change lives for the better while also earning a fair wage and excellent benefits.  

  

 Maple Lane Columbia Unit for NGRI is a Not Guilty by Reason of Insanity (NGRI) Residential Treatment Facility (RTF) located 20 minutes south of Olympia, WA, on the outskirts of the town of Centralia. The program provides behavioral health care for up to 30 residents who have been adjudicated as *not guilty by reason of insanity* and have been courted ordered to inpatient treatment. Columbia’s mission is to promote recovery, resilience, and rehabilitation for those residents leading to successful community transition.  

  

 We are seeking a Psychologist 4 with strong clinical and leadership skills. This important position will offer many opportunities for clinical practice with complex and diverse cases. You will have an opportunity to help institute a new trauma-informed treatment program that focuses on comprehensive, individualized care using evidence-based treatment. If you are interested in the intersection between law and psychology, this position will also work closely with legal counsel to coordinate residents’ journey to reintegrating back into the community.  

  

 If you want to lead and collaborate with a dedicated team to make a real difference in the lives of residents on their road to recovery, we invite you to explore this unique opportunity. The Psychologist 4 supervises a handful of psychology associates, recreation therapists, and peer supports.  

  

You will also enjoy an excellent benefits package that rivals any employer in the State of Washington. We are committed to creating a diverse workforce in a modern work environment that includes the potential for telework options.  

  

**Location:** A 20-minute commute from Olympia, a culture-filled “university town” that is also the capitol of Washington and within easy driving distance of a variety of outdoor activities such as hiking, skiing, beaches, fishing, sailing, etc.  

  

**Student Loan Repayment:** We will apply to become a qualifying facility within the first year of operation for the Washington Health Corps so that licensed providers are eligible to apply for loan repayment. https://wsac.wa.gov/washington-health-corps  

  

**Premium Pay Bonus:** Opportunities performed on-site at this work location at least three days a week may be eligible for an additional 5% premium pay in addition to the advertised salary.  

  

**Some of what you will do**

  

* Perform evaluations related to NGRI processes and privileges; establish diagnoses; provide the court with petitions, affidavits, letters, or other required documentation. Provides expert testimony in support of psycho-legal opinions regarding diagnoses, and placement-readiness under direct and cross examination while relying on established psychological principles, facts, and functional data.
* Lead our *Clinical Interdisciplinary Treatment Team* and provide clinical guidance.
* Provide clinical supervision for group facilitators in the provision of group therapy and classes.
* Assist with treatment plan and goal formulation.
* Provide in-service training and expert clinical consultation on psychological principles regarding behavior and recovery to treatment team members in the application of proposed treatments for residents in the facility. This may include case conceptualization, and education on specific strategies to shape behavior and mood, or to address symptoms of psychosis.
* Participate in interdisciplinary evaluation and treatment conferences, morning reports, and other treatment team meetings as necessary.


**We are looking for**  

* A Licensed Psychologist in the State of Washington or able to be licensed prior to start date.
* Strong clinical and, preferably forensic, skills
* Experience with psychometric testing, including instruments used to assess feigning and response to psychosocial treatment.
* Demonstrated ability to form therapeutic relationships with people.
* Provide evidence-based psychosocial programming, conduct evidence-based group and individual therapies.
* Knowledge of and experience with delivering third-wave behavioral therapies such as Acceptance and Commitment Therapy, Compassion Focused Therapy, and/or Dialectical Behavioral Therapy.
* Knowledge of mental illness, Trauma Informed Care, and recovery principles. A strong understanding of and experience treating complex PTSD is preferred.

**To Apply**  

* Completed Application
* Resume
* Cover Letter


Our Department of Social and Health Services (DSHS) mission to *Transform Lives* requires that we come together with a sense of belonging, common purpose, shared values and meaningful work. It is crucial to our agency’s mission that you bring an equity, anti-racism and social justice commitment to your work with DSHS. We strive to create greater access and affirming representation of the communities we serve, including Black, Indigenous and People of Color, people with physical, behavioral health, and intellectual disabilities, elders, LGBTQIA+ individuals, immigrants and refugees, and families building financial security.  

Questions about 00036? Contact Joshua.Shawhan@dshs.wa.gov.
**Supplemental Information**
----------------------------


Prior to a new hire, a background check including criminal record history may be conducted. Information from the background check will not necessarily preclude employment but will be considered in determining the applicant’s suitability and competence to perform in the job. This announcement may be used to fill multiple vacancies. Employees driving on state business must have a valid driver's license. Employees driving a privately owned vehicle on state business must have liability insurance on the privately owned vehicle.  

  

Washington State Department of Social and Health Services is an equal opportunity employer and does not discriminate in any area of employment, its programs or services on the basis of age, sex, sexual orientation, gender, gender identity/expression, marital status, race, creed, color, national origin, religion or beliefs, political affiliation, military status, honorably discharged veteran, Vietnam Era, recently separated or other protected veteran status, the presence of any sensory, mental, physical disability or the use of a trained dog guide or service animal by a person with a disability, equal pay or genetic information. Persons requiring accommodation in the application process or this job announcement in an alternative format may contact the Recruiter at (360) 725-5810. Applicants who are deaf or hard of hearing may call through Washington Relay Service by dialing 7-1-1 or 1-800-833-6384.

title: Remote Therapist - Doctorate level Psychologist
description:
JOB DESCRIPTION


Park Nicollet Clinic is looking for a Virtualist to join our Behavioral Health team. Being a part of our team means you will have an impact on the care that our patients receive every day.

The Park Nicollet Behavioral Health department is a large, multi-disciplinary group based out of the Twin Cities which provides comprehensive outpatient mental health services in Minnesota and Wisconsin. We are seeking an adult generalist therapist to work fully remote, exclusively providing telemedicine therapy through our comprehensive, integrated video platform. We value a commitment to, and training in, evidence-based care. This position can be full- or part-time .8 - 1.0 FTE



We are seeking a doctoral level (PhD, PsyD, or EdD) psychologist current MN and WI licenses (or MN and WI license eligible). Previous experience providing care via telemedicine is required. Must reside in: MN, WI, IA, ND or SD.



**$5K SIGN ON BONUS, competitive salary, excellent benefits (including continuing education and paid licensure**) and much more!  

* **Qualifying employer for Public Service Loan Forgiveness Program (as applicable)**


You will be joining a team that is supportive and respectful of one another and deeply committed to the mission of HealthPartners. Here, you’ll become a partner for good, helping to improve the health and well-being of our patients, members and community. Our commitment to excellence, compassion, partnership and integrity is behind everything we do. It’s the type of work that makes a difference, the kind of work you can be proud of. We hope you’ll join us.

  


**BENEFITS:**



Park Nicollet offers a competitive benefit package including medical insurance, dental insurance, 401k with company contribution and match, 457(b), life insurance, malpractice coverage as well as CME reimbursement. Our clinician well-being program provides a wealth of information, tools, and resources tailored to meet the unique needs of our health care professionals, including physicians and advanced practice clinicians (APCs). Park Nicollet is a qualified non-profit employer under the federal Public Service Loan Forgiveness program.



For further information, please contact Jennifer Bredeson, Sr. Clinician Recruiter, jennifer.bredeson@parknicollet.com.


  
ABOUT US


At HealthPartners we believe in the power of good – good deeds and good people working together. As part of our team, you’ll find an inclusive environment that encourages new ways of thinking, celebrates differences, and recognizes hard work.  


  



We’re a nonprofit, integrated health care organization, providing health insurance in six states and high-quality care at more than 90 locations, including hospitals and clinics in Minnesota and Wisconsin. We bring together research and education through HealthPartners Institute, training medical professionals across the region and conducting innovative research that improve lives around the world.

  


  



At HealthPartners, everyone is welcome, included and valued. We’re working together to increase diversity and inclusion in our workplace, advance health equity in care and coverage, and partner with the community as advocates for change.

  


  



Join us and become a partner for good, helping to improve the health and well-being of our patients, members and the communities we serve.

  


  



We are an Equal Opportunity Employer and do not discriminate against any employee or applicant because of race, color, sex, age, national origin, religion, sexual orientation, gender identify, status as a veteran and basis of disability or any other federal, state or local protected class.

title: REMOTE CONTRACT LPC, LMFT, LCSW, Psychologist
description:
**Elated Counseling is a modern mental health company** providing therapy, education, and business wellness services. Our Therapy Department treats clients at an outpatient level of care in the office or virtual setting. The population of clients varies from **adolescents to the elderly.** Treatment is evidence-based and holistic, including individual, couples, family, group, and experiential therapies.

Well, we are looking for you too! We are seeking a ***Licensed Clinician*** **ONLY** (Psychologist, LCSW, LPC, LMFT) **join** our team which consists of some bad ass therapists!

The successful candidate will be a strong individual and internally motivated leader, dynamic, demonstrate insight, be able to shift between needs of the company and needs of the department in order to meet the and unique needs of each therapist(s), detail-oriented, and possess strong skills for follow-up. Services are also robust, outcomes-focused, and individualized to each client.

**Independent Contractor** - Minimum 10 hours to 28 per week (anytime)

**We are seeking a strong, resilient Clinical therapist to join our team and help change lives!**

**Responsibilities:**

The licensed outpatient therapist will provide quality, culturally competent mental health services to individuals and families experiencing varying difficulties due to life situations or mental health concerns—the licensed outpatient clinician reports to the Team Lead and management team.

Maintain healthy boundaries with Staff and Clients.

Maintain good standing with the appropriate board and insurance entities. Maintain secure client information per HIPAA standards.

Perform duties related to caseload management, including but not limited to completion of Social Security/Disability forms, authorization and billing forms, phone calls, participating in case consultation meetings, Discharge paperwork, treatment plan, letters needed by clients, and overall management. All contact will need to be noted in the chart.

Report and work with team lead and clinical director

Participate in regular individual clinical supervision

**Independent Contractor** - Minimum 10 hours to 28 per week (anytime)

Work with clients' family systems or coordinate care with external providers

Create strong discharge planning to help maintain long term recovery

Assure all legal and regulatory clinical documents are filed and monitor compliance with laws and regulations.

**Minimum Education and Experience:**

Master’s Degree from an accredited mental health program

**Must have an Active Professional Mental Health License (LPC, LCSW, LMFT, or LAC-** ***Louisiana*****)**

Must have a minimum of two years of experience conducting psychotherapy

**Preferred Qualifications:**

Must have an Active Professional Mental Health License (LPC, LCSW, LMFT, *Louisiana*)

Experience with long-term care.

Experience with Managing a 10-30 plus caseload

Previous experience in home-based mental health, office-based counseling, and/or knowledge of EHR are desirable but not required.

**COMPENSATION:**

Independent Contractor- Set rate per CPT code with payment being rendered twice a month based on documentation completed.

**BENEFITS:**

Self-Care a Major Part of Company Culture

Work/Life Balance prioritized

Accountable Culture

Administrative Support

Opportunity for Growth and/or Unique Position

title: LCSW Telehealth Therapist, Remote with Superb Benefits!
company: New Vista of the Bluegrass Inc
description:
The Outpatient Clinician – Telehealth is part of a Virtual Hub team that provides clinical services for individuals and families that present for telehealth treatment. The Virtual Hub is part of an integrated model of care and is complemented by physical office locations with services that can be offered in-person, in the community and/or via telehealth to provide a holistic healthcare experience. In collaboration with a treatment team, the Outpatient Clinician – Telehealth provides services including but not limited to treatment planning and on-going assessment; client education; crisis intervention and risk assessment; individual, family, group and collateral therapy, referral and advocacy. Caseloads include diverse populations with a variety of clinical needs. The Outpatient Clinician – Telehealth is a positive team player that promotes a culture of inclusion and participation.

**Required Education and Experience**

* Master’s degree in Marriage and Family Therapy, Professional Counseling, Psychology, or Social Work
* Licensed Independent Practitioner by Kentucky professional boards and billing sources (e.g. LCSW, LPCC, LPP, LMFT, PhD clinical psychologist, etc.)
* Meet the requirements of applicable Kentucky licensure boards to provide services to individuals and families residing in the state of Kentucky

 **Preferred Education and Experience**

* Experience working in a behavioral health field

**Essential Functions**


Reasonable accommodations may be made to enable individuals with disabilities to perform the essential functions.


**Clinical Services**

* Work as part of a team to deliver high quality therapeutic care from a whole health perspective
* Deliver evidenced based counseling that provides effective medically necessary treatment of mental and behavioral conditions in individuals and families
* Assess and integrate historical, psychosocial and medical information into a client’s individualized treatment
* Monitor the need for continuation of services and/or change in level of intensity of services
* Utilize PCOMS (Partners for Change Outcome Management System) in assessments and clinical treatment episodes
* Deliver services primarily in outpatient home-office setting
* Deliver services via telehealth and coordinate with the treatment team to ensure client needs are met in person or via telehealth
* Manage situations involving client risk and provide clinical crisis services to de-escalate crisis situations and promote stability
* Manage a caseload that may include diverse populations with a variety of clinical needs
* Maintain a professional and secure home-office environment
* Engage treatment team, New Vista specialty programs and community partners to advance relationships to provide whole health care to address behavioral health, physical health and social determinant needs

  

While we welcome all to apply, there are some position specific background stipulations that must be met to comply with various regulatory and contractual requirements.

  

New Vista prohibits discrimination and harassment against any applicant, employee or contractor based on sex, race, color, age, national or ethnic origin, religion, physical disability, mental disability, genetic information, marital status, sexual orientation, gender identity or expression, citizenship, pregnancy or maternity, protected veteran status, or any other basis prohibited by applicable federal, state or local law. This policy applies to all terms and conditions of employment, including recruiting, hiring, placement, working conditions, promotion, termination, layoff, recall, transfer, leaves of absence, wage and salary administration, employee benefits and training. It is also the company’s policy to prohibit all forms of retaliation against any individual who has complained of harassing or discriminatory conduct, encouraged another to complain, participated in an investigation into such complaints, or opposed unlawful discrimination.

title: Licensed Mental Health Clinician- ADHD Diagnosis and Treatment
description:
### **Description**

  

Job Details:  

Hourly Pay: $100
Location: Remote
Practising States: Licensed within **KS, DE, WY, MO, MI or CA**
Benefits: Subsidy to increase licensure
This is a flexible part-time role, and we ask for a minimum of 6–10 hours of availability per week. **Company Description**  

Are you a Licensed Mental Health Professional looking for a unique opportunity to make a positive impact in the mental health space?  

Our fast-growing, remote-first startup is revolutionizing mental health care with the support of significant seed funding. We're not only dedicated to providing accessible and effective services, but we're also committed to healthcare compliance - so you can feel good about what you're working on. With a relentless focus on patient wellness, we're on track to become a leading provider of mental health care through our cutting-edge digital product.  

We're seeking top-tier talent to join our passionate team and help us achieve this ambitious goal. If you're up for the challenge, we want to hear from you! **Our Clinic Philosophy**  

At our ADHD clinic, we believe in creating an environment that allows our clinicians to flourish and utilize evidence-based practices. We prioritize respect and collaboration, allowing our team to focus on what they do best: helping patients succeed.  

The clinic is based on two pillars, creating the best workplace for our clinicians and focusing our efforts on patient success. **Position Description**  

We're hiring a licensed mental health professional to join our growing team of mental health professionals.  

In this role, you'll be responsible for providing evidence-based mental health care to our patients, developing and implementing treatment plans, and collaborating with our team to ensure that our patients receive the best possible care.### **What You'll Do**

  

* Provide evidence-based mental health care to our patients, including individual and group therapy, crisis intervention, and case management.
* Develop and implement treatment plans that are tailored to the individual needs of our patients and are in line with best practices and clinical guidelines.
* Collaborate with our team of mental health professionals to ensure that our patients receive comprehensive, coordinated care.
* Maintain accurate and up-to-date patient records in accordance with legal and ethical standards.
* Help to shape our treatment philosophy and contribute to the development of clinical policies and procedures.
* Participate in quality assurance activities, including clinical audits, peer review, and outcome monitoring.
* If you're ready to join a team that's making a real difference in mental health care, we want to hear from you!

### **Who You Are**

  

* Licensed in at least one of these states: **KS, DE, WY, MO, MI or CA**
+ Psychiatric Nurse Practitioner
+ Licensed Clinical Psychologist
+ Licensed Professional Counselor
+ Licensed Marriage and Family Therapist
+ Licensed Clinical Social Worker

* A genuine passion for helping others.
* Excellent communication and interpersonal skills.
* Strong organizational skills.
* Detail-oriented.
* Practical.
* Keen to be part of a growing company.

### **Logistics**

 **Time Commitment**
This is a flexible part-time role, and we ask for a minimum of **6–10 hours** of availability per week. **Location**
We are fully remote – you can work wherever you’re most productive. **Compensation**
This is a 1099 role that will be paid at a fixed, industry-standard hourly rate per appointment.
Should you wish to expand your licensure to new states, we will subsidize the costs.  


### **About Receptive**


Our fast-growing, remote-first startup is revolutionizing mental health care with the support of significant seed funding. We're not only dedicated to providing accessible and effective services, but we're also committed to healthcare compliance - so you can feel good about what you're working on. With a relentless focus on patient wellness, we're on track to become a leading provider of mental health care through our cutting-edge digital product.

title: Licensed Mental Health Professional (Emotional Support Animal Assessor)
description:
### **Description**

  

Company Description  

Pettable was founded by pet lovers just like you - people who know our pets are family and who value the peace of mind of being able to take them anywhere.  

That’s where Pettable comes in. We believe that staying connected to your pets is key to both their well-being and your own.  

Position Description  

We are looking for a Licensed Mental Health Professional to join our team and help make our vision a reality. In this role, you will be one of the first hires on the team, you will work directly with the CEO & founders, and you will play a key role in establishing the direction and trajectory of the company. We are seeking an ethical, competent, and empathetic mental health professional who can connect with clients and assess their need for an emotional support animal. You must be able to operate in an environment that is fast-paced and ambitious, while maintaining the spirit of mutual respect and collaboration that helps us succeed as a team. Above all, you must share our passion for mental wellness, pets, and embody our mission to improve their health and happiness on a large scale.  


### **What You’ll Do**

  

* **Mental Health Assessments**
* Use your experience to evaluate clients' mental health.
* Determine based on your assessment whether or not clients will benefit from an emotional support animal.
* Prescribe an emotional support animal if you believe the client’s condition warrants a prescription.

  

* **Coordinate Consultations**
* Respond to inbound client emails in a timely manner (within 24 hours).
* Schedule consultations with clients within a timely manner (within three business days).
* Prescribe and write emotional support animal letters for approved clients in a timely manner (within 48 hours).

  

* **Follow Up Support**
* Collaborate with the company on any follow on support or documentation the client may need.

### **Who You Are**

  

* Experience with prescribing emotional support animal letters and associated regulations
* Experience with phone and/or virtual consultations
* Effective verbal and written communication skills
* Positive attitude Enjoy technology and capable of troubleshooting computer or connectivity issues

### **What You'll Bring**

  

* One of the following licenses is required :
* Licensed Marriage and Family Therapist (LMFT)
* Licensed Professional Clinical Counselor (LPCC)
* Licensed Clinical Psychologist (Ph.D. or PsyD)
* Licensed Clinical Social Worker (LCSW)
* Doctor of Medicine (MD)
* Doctor of Osteopathic Medicine (DO)
* Nurse Practitioner (NP)


  

Time Commitment
This is a flexible part-time role and we’re open to a wide variety of time commitments and schedules  

  

Compensation  

The payment is $30 per consultation (consults take between 15-25 min)  

Location
We believe that talent can come from anywhere and we operate as a remote-first organization. As such, this is a remote position that can be done from anywhere in the US.### **About Pettable**


At Pettable we know our pets are family and who value the peace of mind of being able to take them anywhere.  

  

At Pettable we connect individuals with qualified mental health professionals in their state who are qualified to prescribe ESA Letters for housing and travel.  

  

Our service is compliant with federal and state laws. You get peace of mind knowing we've done our due diligence to be able to offer you this service today.

title: Behavioral Health Provider (Licensed Clinical Psychologist or LCSW), Remote
company: Marin City Health and Wellness Center
description:
**Summary:**

  



The Behavioral Health Provider (BHP) will provide direct services to MCHWC patients and community members in the integrated care model, closely working with PCPs and other medical and non-medical staff involved in patients’ care. The BHP understands and practices techniques in the integrated model, including time-limited and evidence-based intervention and therapy appropriate for the primary care setting. The BHP may work at multiple MCHWC sites.

  


**Essential Duties and Responsibilities:**


* Provides direct patient services for both MCHWC patients and individuals referred from the community seeking to establish care with MCHWC.
* The BHP has experience and knowledge in treating a variety of DSM 5 conditions (generalist) and patients of all ages.
* Conducts brief interventions with a high volume of patients via several different visit types (e.g., individual, group, co-visits, etc.) as well as provide consultation/ recommendations back to the primary care provider or team.
* Provides brief (30 minute) and time-limited (4-8 visits) behavioral, psychoeducational, or cognitive behavioral interventions for patients.
* Maintains a visible presence and is available for same day and scheduled initial consultations with patients referred by PCPs.
* Effective and rapid triage as it relates to BH services, and referral to other mental health providers or higher levels of care when necessary.
* Assists primary care providers in recognizing and treating behavioral health and psychosocial problems through the integrated model.
* Provides PCPs or team members with verbal or written feedback documented in the EHR on patient encounters.
* Provides expertise on behavioral health problems and issues for MCHWC staff through in-service trainings, consultations, and other informal means.
* Demonstrates effective collaboration and problem-solving skills.
* Consistently attend and actively participate in all BH department and clinic meetings
* Other duties and/or special projects as assigned by Director which are consistent with the position and in compliance with BH program and agency policies and procedures.
* Assists in the development of patient education materials, clinical pathway programs, group shared medical appointments, classes, and behavior focused practice protocols as requested.
* Completes timely documentation and other necessary paperwork complying with all regulations.
* Provides patient care utilizing critical thinking skills to analyze social, safety, environmental, psychological and spiritual issues for the patient.
* Assists in the setting and attaining program goals and objectives
* Assesses, reports, and provides intervention in cases of domestic violence, child, dependent adult, or elder abuse, and other reportable situations in accordance with ethical practice, legal mandates, and the health center’s policies
* Receives feedback in a professional manner and implements feedback received
* Participates in program development and quality improvement and assurance activities as needed
* Performs other duties as directed, developed, or assigned.

  


**Supervisory Responsibilit**y: N/A

  

Qualification Requirements:

  

Education and/or Experience:


* Licensed Clinical Psychologist or LCSW

  



Language Skill:


* Must possess excellent organization, writing, and verbal skills
* English proficiency required

  



Reasoning ability:


* Ability to interpret a variety of instructions furnished in written, oral, diagram, or schedule form.

  



Equipment/Machinery: Fax machine, copier, personal computer, telephone, calculator, Microsoft Word/Excel, EHR system, and other software as required.

  

Physical Demands: The physical demands described here are representative of those that must be met by an individual to successfully perform the essential functions of this job. Reasonable accommodations may be made to enable individuals with disabilities to perform the essential functions.

  



* Stand and walk or sit alternatively depending on specific needs of day. Estimate 20% of time is spent on feet and 80% sitting at desk.


* Have occasional need to perform the following physical activities: bend/stoop/squat, climb stairs, push or pull, reach above shoulders.


* Have occasional need to perform standing and walking activities.


* Constant need to perform the following physical activities: writing/typing, grasping/turning, finger dexterity.


* Lifting/carrying over 10 pounds occasionally. Lifting/carrying less than 10 pounds frequently.


* Vision requirements: constant need to complete forms, read reports, view computer screen. Frequent need to see small detail. Frequent need to see things clearly beyond arm's reach.


* Hearing requirements: constant need to communicate over telephone and in person.
  



Travel Requirements: Occasional need to utilize personal transportation to visit sites, and attend meetings and conferences.

title: Clinical Psychologist

Citizenship
