title: Psychologist
description:
**Key Responsibilities:**

* **Counseling Sessions:** Conduct individual counseling sessions with clients to address a variety of mental health concerns, including anxiety, depression, stress, trauma, and relationship issues.
* **Assessment and Diagnosis:** Conduct psychological assessments, interviews, and evaluations to diagnose mental health disorders and develop personalized treatment plans.
* **Therapeutic Interventions:** Provide evidence-based therapeutic interventions, such as cognitive-behavioral therapy (CBT), dialectical behavior therapy (DBT), mindfulness-based therapy, and solution-focused therapy.
* **Crisis Intervention:** Provide crisis intervention and support to clients experiencing acute mental health crises or emergencies.
* **Client Advocacy:** Advocate for clients' needs and rights, collaborating with other healthcare professionals, social services, and community resources to ensure comprehensive support and care.
* **Psychoeducation:** Educate clients and their families about mental health conditions, coping strategies, self-care techniques, and available resources.
* **Documentation and Record Keeping:** Maintain accurate and confidential client records, documenting assessment findings, treatment plans, progress notes, and discharge summaries in compliance with legal and ethical standards.
* **Professional Development:** Stay updated on the latest research, best practices, and developments in the field of psychology and counseling through ongoing professional development activities, training, and workshops.
* **Ethical Standards:** Adhere to ethical guidelines and professional standards of conduct set forth by relevant licensing boards and professional associations (e.g., APA, ACA).
* **Supervision and Consultation:** Seek supervision and consultation from senior psychologists or supervisors as needed, especially for complex cases or ethical dilemmas.

Job Type: Full-time

Salary: ₹30,000.00 - ₹35,000.00 per month

Application Question(s):

* Only female candidates required
* Minimum 2 year exp as psychology counsellor

Experience:

* total work: 5 years (Preferred)

Ability to Commute:

* Tiruchchirappalli, Tamil Nadu (Required)

Work Location: In person

**Speak with the employer**

description:
**Job Title – Senior Clinical Psychologist**

Job Type – Full-Time

Job Type - 10 am to 7 pm/11am to 8pm

**Job Description :**

* Being responsible for providing diagnostics assessments, therapy, counselling and support services.
* Making assessments and interpretations based on psychometric tests, semi-structured interviews and therapy sessions.
* Collaborating with other healthcare providers to evaluate the medical and physical condition of clients.
* Formulating and creating personalized interventions, treatments, and management plans for clients.
* Assessing clients' risk, considering their mental health and social needs when performing interventions.
* Interacting with clients and other parties regarding performing interventions.
* Employing various treatment methods such as psychotherapy, hypnosis, behaviour modification, stress reduction therapy, and psychodrama.
* Measuring the effectiveness of interventions and implementing changes where required.
* Ensuring the maintenance and safe storage of accurate program and client records, and all other pertinent documents.
* Maintaining confidentiality of clients’ treatment and records in accordance with HIPAA. Participating in clinical training seminars and mentoring assistant psychologists, psychology students, and interns on-site.
* Working towards positioning the agency as a pioneer in psychological intervention.

title: Mental Health Technician
description:
**Vacancy for MANAGER, OPERATIONS, MENTAL HEALTH PROGRAMS, BANGALORE**

We are looking for an experienced, cheerful and confident Female candidate in the 30+ years age group, who has a Master’s Degree in Counseling Psychology or Clinical Psychology. Advanced Diploma / M Phil in Child Psychology will be an asset. She must have at least 3-5 years of experience of working with children and leading a team. The candidate should be comfortable using IT tools, fluent in English and willing to travel within the city. Knowledge of Kannada will be an asset.

SPECIFIC SKILLS & EXPERIENCE REQUIRED

**Key Skills/Attributes:**

**1.** **Should have a background in child psychology and work experience**

**2.** **Should be very good at managing a team of psychologists and coordinating with other teams in the organization.**

**3.** **Should have the ability to plan the micro details of operations.**

**4.** **Should be a very good trouble shooter, with a cool head on his/her shoulders.**

**5.** **Willingness to travel through the city to different schools for meetings and program delivery at times.**

**JOB DESCRIPTION**

You, as Manager, Operations, Mental Health Programs, Bangalore will be the leading AddressHealth’s school mental wellbeing programs in Bangalore. You will work closely with Manager, Operations, Health Education to help deliver AddressHealth’s health education program and have several team members who work across both teams. You will report to the Senior Manager, Operations, Bangalore.

The following are the key duties & responsibilities of the incumbent:

* Make regular visits to schools allocated, to act as visiting school counselor to address concerns and problems of particular children.
* Act as a resource person/facilitator for group therapy / workshops for children identified to be at risk
* Act as a resource person for a capacity building workshops for teachers , school counselors and parents
* Ensure that service schedules are maintained and operations protocols are adhered to by mental health team
* Train AddressHealth Health Education and Mental Wellbeing team resources on handling children and operational protocols.
* Maintain the quality of service delivery and ensuring adherence to service standards;
* Work in close coordination with Health Education team and provide personnel time for health education from mental health resources, including your own time.
* Being the single point of contact for donor funded mental wellbeing programs in school.
* Prompt and diligent reporting

**ABOUT THE COMPANY**

Set up in March 2010, AddressHealth is today, India’s largest school health provider, having partnered with more than 400 schools and serving over 4 lakh children. AddressHealth offers comprehensive health checks, infirmary services, a health education curriculum & mental wellness programs to schools in urban India. In its efforts to make the pediatric primary healthcare continuum possible, AddressHealth is partnered with venture funds in the social impact space like Gray Matters Capital and Unitus Seed Fund. AddressHealth is also a winner of “The Stars in Global Health-7” awarded by the Grand Challenges Canada. Our Head office is in Bangalore. We also serve schools in Delhi NCR, Pune, Hyderabad and several other locations. AddressHealth has been an implementing partner for Live Love Laugh Foundation’s “ You are Not Alone’ Program in Bangalore and Pune and has covered over 17000 children in AY 22-23.Its health education program, which includes mental health will cover more than 75000 children in 23-24

**Remuneration:**The salary for this position will range between 30,000/- to 40,000/- pm. In addition, there will be a fixed food and travel reimbursements. Incentives of Upto 10% of gross salary can be expected ongood performance annually.

**To attend the intervew whatsapp your updated CV with present address details to 9591990945, HR Dept.**

title: Psychotherapist
description:
Job Description: Counselor at Abhasa Rehabilitation and Wellness Home

Position Overview:

Abhasa Rehabilitation and Wellness Home is seeking an experienced Counselor to join our team. As a Counselor, you will play a crucial role in providing mental health support, guidance, and counseling to individuals seeking rehabilitation and wellness services. Your expertise will contribute to the overall well-being of our clients as they work towards overcoming challenges and achieving positive personal growth. The ideal candidate should have a minimum of 2 years of relevant experience in counseling and a strong passion for helping individuals improve their mental health and overall quality of life.

Responsibilities:

1. Individual Counseling:Conduct one-on-one counseling sessions with clients to assess their needs, develop personalized treatment plans, and provide ongoing support and guidance.

2. Group Therapy:Lead and facilitate group therapy sessions, creating a safe and inclusive environment for clients to share experiences, learn from each other, and build a sense of community.

3. Assessment: Perform thorough assessments of clients' mental health conditions, history, and treatment goals to formulate accurate diagnoses and treatment plans.

4. Treatment Planning: Collaborate with interdisciplinary teams to design comprehensive treatment plans that address clients' emotional, psychological, and social needs.

5. Crisis Intervention: Provide immediate support and intervention in crisis situations, ensuring clients' safety and well-being.

6. Progress Monitoring: Regularly track and evaluate clients' progress towards their goals, adjusting treatment plans as necessary to ensure effectiveness.

7. Documentation: Maintain accurate and up-to-date client records, including assessments, treatment plans, session notes, and progress reports.

8. Educational Workshops: Develop and deliver workshops on various topics related to mental health, wellness, coping strategies, and personal development.

9. Continuing Education: Stay updated with the latest developments in counseling techniques, therapeutic modalities, and mental health research through ongoing professional development.

10. Ethical Standards: Adhere to ethical guidelines and maintain confidentiality in all interactions with clients and their sensitive information.

11. Collaboration: Work closely with other counselors, psychologists, medical professionals, and support staff to ensure a holistic and integrated approach to client care.

Qualifications:

1. Master's degree in Counseling, Psychology, Social Work, or a related field.

2. Professional certification or licensure as a counselor (e.g., LPC, LCSW, LMFT) preferred.

3. Minimum of 2 years of experience in individual and group counseling, preferably within a rehabilitation or wellness setting.

4. Strong understanding of various therapeutic approaches and interventions.

5. Excellent communication, active listening, and interpersonal skills.

6. Empathy, compassion, and a non-judgmental attitude towards clients.

7. Ability to establish rapport with diverse clients and create a supportive therapeutic relationship.

8. Knowledge of mental health assessment tools and techniques.

9. Proficiency in maintaining accurate and organized client records.

10. Willingness to adapt to the dynamic needs of clients and the organization.

If you are a dedicated and compassionate Counselor with a proven track record of helping individuals navigate personal challenges, we encourage you to apply. At Abhasa Rehabilitation and Wellness Home, you'll have the opportunity to make a meaningful impact on the lives of those seeking support and transformation.

As an industrial psychologist, you will apply psychological principles to the workplace environment, focusing on improving employee productivity, satisfaction, and organizational effectiveness. You will work closely with management and HR departments to develop and implement strategies that enhance employee well-being, optimize job performance, and foster a positive work culture.

Please find below the responsibilities that needs to be carried out:

Conduct research to identify trends and best practices in organizational psychology and apply findings to improve workplace processes and procedures.

Collaborate with management to design and implement organizational change initiatives, such as restructuring, mergers, and acquisitions.

description:
**Job Title**: Psychological Counselor

**Company Name**: Toprankers Edtech Solutions Private Limited

**Job Location**: Bhopal M.P.

**Job Type**: Full-time

**About the Company:** Established in 2016, Toprankers has emerged as India's foremost digital counseling and preparation platform, catering to careers beyond the realms of engineering and medicine. Our mission is to foster awareness and amplify the success rates for promising career paths post-12th grade. We are dedicated to providing superior learning methodologies and comprehensive assistance to each student preparing for management, humanities, law, judiciary, and design entrance examinations.

**Job Description:** 

· We are looking for a compassionate and experienced Psychological Counsellor to support students' mental health and well-being within our EdTech platform. The ideal candidate will have a strong background in psychology, and counseling, and experience working with individuals in educational settings. The Psychological Counselor will play a crucial role in providing virtual counseling services to students, fostering a supportive environment, and promoting mental wellness initiatives.

**Responsibilities:**

· Provide virtual counselling sessions to students enrolled in our EdTech platform, addressing a range of mental health concerns including stress, anxiety, depression, academic pressure, and interpersonal relationships.

· Conduct initial assessments and develop personalized counselling plans tailored to each student's needs and goals.

· Utilize evidence-based therapeutic techniques to facilitate emotional regulation, coping skills, and resilience-building strategies.

· Collaborate with educators and other support staff to identify students in need of psychological support and implement proactive interventions.

· Offer crisis intervention and suicide prevention support as needed, adhering to ethical guidelines and best practices.

· Develop and facilitate psychoeducational workshops, webinars, and resources on topics related to mental health, self-care, and academic success.

· Maintain accurate and confidential records of counselling sessions, assessments, and progress notes in compliance with privacy regulations.

· Stay abreast of current research, trends, and developments in the field of mental health and education, integrating findings into counselling practices and program development.

· Participate in ongoing professional development activities, including supervision, training, and peer consultation.

· Contribute to the development and enhancement of our EdTech platform by providing insights and feedback on features related to mental health and well-being.

**Qualifications:**

· Master's or doctoral degree in counseling psychology, clinical psychology, social work, or a related field from an accredited institution.

· Licensed or license-eligible as a counselor, therapist, or psychologist (e.g., LPC, LCSW, LMFT, or PsyD).

· Minimum of 2-3 years of experience providing counseling services to adolescents or young adults, preferably in an educational or virtual setting.

· Strong knowledge of psychological assessment, diagnosis, and treatment planning.

· Proficient in delivering virtual counseling sessions via video conferencing platforms and maintaining confidentiality in online environments.

· Excellent communication skills, empathy, and cultural competence in working with diverse student populations.

· Ability to work independently, manage time effectively, and prioritize competing demands in a fast-paced environment.

· Commitment to ethical standards, confidentiality, and professional boundaries in counseling practice.

**Preferred Qualifications:**

· Experience using teletherapy platforms and digital tools for mental health support.

· Specialization or training in areas such as mindfulness-based interventions, cognitive-behavioral therapy (CBT), trauma-informed care, or dialectical behavior therapy (DBT).

· Familiarity with educational technology, learning management systems (LMS), and digital interventions for mental health promotion.

description:
Job Title: Clinical Psychologist

Job Description:

Position Overview:

We are seeking a highly skilled and compassionate Clinical Psychologist with a Master's degree in Clinical Psychology to join our team at a Neuro Rehabilitation Centre specializing in the care of neurologically disabled patients. As a Clinical Psychologist, you will play a crucial role in assessing, diagnosing, and treating the psychological and emotional needs of our patients to enhance their overall well-being and quality of life.

Responsibilities:

1. \\*\\*Patient Assessment and Diagnosis:\\*\\*

- Conduct comprehensive psychological assessments to understand the emotional, cognitive, and behavioral aspects of neurologically disabled patients.

- Collaborate with interdisciplinary teams to contribute to a holistic understanding of patients' needs.

2. \\*\\*Treatment Planning and Implementation:\\*\\*

- Develop individualized treatment plans based on assessment findings, taking into consideration the unique challenges presented by neurological disabilities.

- Implement evidence-based therapeutic interventions to address emotional and behavioral issues.

- Collaborate with other healthcare professionals to integrate psychological interventions into the overall rehabilitation plan.

3. \\*\\*Counseling and Psychotherapy:\\*\\*

- Provide counseling and psychotherapy services to individuals and groups, addressing issues such as anxiety, depression, grief, and adjustment to disability.

- Utilize a variety of therapeutic modalities tailored to the specific needs and abilities of neurologically disabled patients.

4. \\*\\*Behavioral Intervention:\\*\\*

- Design and implement behavior management strategies to address challenging behaviors associated with neurological conditions.

- Collaborate with caregivers and families to provide support and education on managing behavioral issues at home.

5. \\*\\*Patient and Family Education:\\*\\*

- Conduct psychoeducational sessions to educate patients and their families about the psychological and emotional aspects of neurological disabilities.

- Offer coping strategies and resources to enhance overall family functioning.

6. \\*\\*Documentation and Reporting:\\*\\*

- Maintain accurate and up-to-date clinical records in accordance with professional and organizational standards.

- Provide regular progress reports to the interdisciplinary team and participate in case conferences.

7. \\*\\*Research and Continuous Professional Development:\\*\\*

- Stay abreast of the latest research and developments in the field of clinical psychology and neurorehabilitation.

- Engage in continuous professional development activities to enhance and update clinical skills.

Qualifications:

- Master's degree in Clinical Psychology from an accredited institution.

- Licensure or certification as a Clinical Psychologist.

- Experience in working with neurologically disabled populations is highly desirable.

- Strong interpersonal and communication skills.

- Ability to work collaboratively within an interdisciplinary team.

- Compassion, empathy, and a commitment to improving the lives of individuals with neurological disabilities.

If you are passionate about making a positive impact on the psychological well-being of neurologically disabled individuals, we invite you to join our dedicated team at the Neuro Rehabilitation Centre.

title: Psychologist
description:
This is a part-time remote role for an assistant psychotherapist at PujaVedika.com. The assistant psychotherapist will be responsible for providing expert mental health services to clients experiencing mental health issues or disorders. The psychotherapist will also conduct initial assessments, develop individual treatment plans, and provide crisis intervention as needed. As a remote position, the assistant psychotherapist will have to carry out the work as per the senior psychotherapist guidance.

**Qualifications**

* A Master's degree or higher in Psychology, Counseling, or Social Work
* State licensure as a Licensed Clinical Social Worker (LCSW), Licensed Professional Counselor (LPC), or Licensed Marriage and Family Therapist (LMFT)
* Experience in crisis intervention, assessment, diagnosis and treatment, including knowledge of DSM-5 diagnosis criteria; experience in substance abuse and addiction treatment is a plus
* Excellent knowledge of therapeutic approaches, interventions, and techniques, such as Cognitive Behavioral Therapy (CBT), Dialectical Behavior Therapy (DBT), and Mindfulness-based Therapy
* Excellent communication skills, both verbal and written, and strong active listening skills; bilingual in languages such as Spanish, Mandarin (or others) is a plus
* Experience working with diverse populations, including but not limited to BIPOC, LGBTQIA+, and individuals with physical disabilities or chronic illnesses
* Ability to manage a caseload of clients and maintain accurate clinical documentation
* Proficient in using clinical management systems and software

Job Type: Full-time

title: Psychologist
description:
**\\*\\*Job Title:\\*\\*** De-Addiction Counselor / Psychologist

**\\*\\*Location:\\*\\*** Rebirth Hospital & Rehabilitation Centre

**\\*\\*Job Type:\\*\\*** Full-time

**\\*\\*How to Apply:\\*\\***

Interested candidates should submit their resume, recent photograph and a cover letter detailing their qualifications and motivation for applying to whatsapp on +91-9551000068.

Rebirth Hospital & Rehabilitation Centre is an equal opportunity employer. We encourage individuals of all backgrounds to apply.

**\\*\\*About Rebirth Hospital & Rehabilitation Centre:\\*\\***

Rebirth Hospital & Rehabilitation Centre is a leading healthcare facility dedicated to providing comprehensive treatment and support to individuals battling addiction and mental health issues. Our mission is to empower patients on their journey to recovery and offer them the highest quality of care in a compassionate and professional environment.

**\\*\\*Job Description:\\*\\***

We are seeking a dedicated and compassionate De-Addiction Counselor / Psychologist with a Master's Degree in Psychology to join our team at Rebirth Hospital & Rehabilitation Centre. In this role, you will play a crucial part in helping individuals overcome addiction and regain control of their lives.

**\\*\\*Responsibilities:\\*\\***

1. \\*\\*Assessment and Evaluation:\\*\\* Conduct thorough assessments to evaluate the psychological and emotional well-being of patients dealing with addiction issues.

2. \\*\\*Individual and Group Counseling:\\*\\* Provide one-on-one and group counseling sessions to address the specific needs and challenges of patients in recovery.

3. \\*\\*Treatment Planning:\\*\\* Collaborate with the interdisciplinary treatment team to develop individualized treatment plans for patients, including setting goals, interventions, and progress monitoring.

4. \\*\\*Crisis Intervention:\\*\\* Respond to crisis situations and provide immediate support and counseling to patients in distress.

5. \\*\\*Education and Prevention:\\*\\* Educate patients and their families about addiction, recovery, coping strategies, and relapse prevention techniques.

6. \\*\\*Documentation:\\*\\* Maintain accurate and confidential records of patient assessments, treatment plans, progress notes, and other relevant documentation in accordance with ethical and legal standards.

7. \\*\\*Therapeutic Techniques:\\*\\* Utilize evidence-based therapeutic techniques, such as Cognitive-Behavioral Therapy (CBT), Motivational Interviewing, and Dialectical Behavior Therapy (DBT), to support patients in their recovery journey.

8. \\*\\*Collaboration:\\*\\* Collaborate with medical professionals, social workers, and other staff members to ensure a holistic approach to patient care.

9. \\*\\*Continuous Learning:\\*\\* Stay updated on the latest research and developments in addiction psychology and incorporate best practices into your counseling approach.

**\\*\\*Qualifications:\\*\\***

- Master's Degree in Psychology with a focus on addiction counseling or clinical psychology.

- State licensure or certification as a psychologist or addiction counselor (if required by the state).

- Strong understanding of addiction, substance abuse disorders, and mental health issues.

- Excellent interpersonal and communication skills.

- Empathy and a non-judgmental approach to patients.

- Ability to work effectively in a multidisciplinary team.

- Knowledge of relevant laws and ethical guidelines related to patient confidentiality and care.

- Prior experience in addiction counseling or a similar role is preferred.

**\\*\\*Benefits:\\*\\***

- Competitive salary and benefits package.

- Opportunities for professional development and continuing education.

- A supportive and collaborative work environment.

- The chance to make a meaningful impact on patients' lives.

If you are a compassionate and dedicated De-Addiction Counselor / Psychologist with a passion for helping individuals on their path to recovery, we invite you to join our team at Rebirth Hospital & Rehabilitation Centre. Together, we can make a difference in the lives of those we serve.

company: dr prerna kohli & associates/MindTribe by Dr. Prerna Kohli
description:
MindTribe by Dr. Prerna Kohli is India's fastest-growing mental health organization. Focused on destigmatization of Mental Health. We offer our clients the following

* Affordable Counseling
* Workshops
* Support Groups
* Communities
* Group Therapy
* eLearning

If recruited you will be involved in all of the activities

We are seeking freshers with a ***minimum*** of **Masters**, MPhil, or Ph.D. in Psychology to join our team.

This role is ideal for those with 0-24 months of work experience (excluding internships)

This is a work-from-home opportunity, you will not be required to come to our offices.

We have a very intense training program during the probationary period, at the successful completion of the probationary period you are confirmed and absorbed as a full-time employee into the company

PLEASE NOTE

* THIS IS ***NOT*** AN INTERNSHIP
* If recruited you can't work anywhere else
* If recruited in the first 12 months you can't join any full-time/part-time degrees, diplomas, or certificates
* At the end of the first 12 months with management approval, you can join part-time educational programs

**About MindTribe:** MindTribe is an initiative of Dr. Prerna Kohli, India’s eminent psychologist. MindTribe provides affordable counseling, support groups, communities, workshops, and eLearning for improving Mental Health.

**About Dr. Prerna Kohli:** Dr. Prerna Kohli ( M.Phil, Ph.D.) is the first Clinical Psychologist to be awarded by the Hon. President of India. She is the founder of MindTribe.in and has been a contributor in the area of mental health for over 27 years. She is a published author, a 4 times gold medalist, an intensive research scholar, and has been an adviser to the National Commission for Protection of Child Rights (NCPCR) and is a member of the Niti Aayog Nutrition Committee.

title: Psychologist
description:
At Global Discovery School (GDS), we innovate K12 space. We help nation prepare for a superpower status by investing in children. Our big new innovation is to launch the next generation school USP called - THE EMPOWERING SPACE BY PERFORMANCE COACH FOR ACADS & LIFE. It will be created by the scientific understanding of the child, the ecosystem of educators, parents, management and also of school processes & policies deeply rooted in psychology.

Introducing our offering, “Life Mein Marks” (LMM)", going beyond academic performance, unique to each child and accessible to every parent in the country, built towards our efforts to put civilization back on track.

We do not work on clinical cases but on mainstream population - students / parents / staff / management.

We are seeking a qualified and compassionate Psychologist to join our Global Discovery Schools, Sevasi. The successful candidate must have the knowledge and skills to provide quality care to our students, teachers, and guidance to parents and management as well.

Introducing our offering, “Life Mein Marks” (LMM)", going beyond academic performance, unique to each child and accessible to every parent in the country, built towards our efforts of nation-building and shaping the youth of India.

LMM is an evidence-based AI-powered technological platform that acts as an exclusive Guide and an Enabler to identify, understand, and build every child’s physical, psychological, emotional, cognitive, and spiritual self. LMM creates a systematic and efficient communication channel to bridge the gap between parents, family, peers, educators, and experts, each drawing from varied facets of the child’s living experience, at home, in school, and the outside world.

**Responsibilities and Duties**

* 80% time on children, 20% time on teachers, parents and school management.
* Openness of mind, willingness and alignement to learn from pre existing success stories in similar space creation efforts including Vipassana, Landmark Forum, Satguru books, and work of famous psychologists who addressed the mainstream population.
* Create power f rom every incidence by helping adults and children distinguish more & more about working of their own mind.
* Comfortable being prominent and visible face of the brand - Empowering Space by Performance Coach
* Willingness to practice the linguistic constructs called ontological "distinctions" on self - creating power out of every incidence, distinguishing what is in existence and practicing putting it in self expression through sharings. Inviting insights from the space. Being an example of looking inside. Maintaining compassion and desire to contribute - all the time.
* Conduct psychological assessments and tests for students
* Educate and recommend engagements and actions to respond to specific behaviour and experiences of the child
* Develop and individualized treatment plan for each child
* Educate family members on what they can do for their child or how to respond to their certain behaviour
* Provide complete documentation and records of assessments
* Guide the development and implement a competitive school counseling program that focuses on and promotes students’ success
* Value and respond to the diversity and individual differences of students
* Ensure equitable access to opportunities and rigorous curriculum for all students
* Provide direct support services through structured conventions
* Provide group or individual responsive services
* Collaborate and consult with parents, teachers, community organizations and other stakeholders
* Perform assessments, interpret tests and study student records
* Gather and analyze data to measure results

**Psychologist Requirements:**

* Masters degree in School Counseling.
* Freshers from top schools and/or with academic edge may be considered.
* Several years practical experience working with children in a clinical setting may be strongly desired
* Must be approachable and emphatic for children to be comfortable working with you
* Excellent communication skills, specifically the ability to communicate with children of different cultural and socio-economic backgrounds
* Proven working experience in school counseling
* Integrity and professionalism
* Advocacy skills
* Ability to respond effectively to the needs of a diverse student pool
* Working knowledge of various counseling models, practices and resources
* Engaging interpersonal skills and excellent communication skills
* Ability to collect and analyze data
* Computer literacy
* Sound judgment and emotional intelligence

**Company Profile**

Global Discovery School, Gotri - Sevasi:

Join an education revolution at Global Discovery School, Gotri - Sevasi - The most promising innovation in education worldwide fundamentally changing how schools are created and operated. GDS promises you a platform to unleash your creativity and rigor, an environment to debate innovation capable of driving a revolution across the sector.

E-mail your resume to jobs@GlobalDiscoveryAcademy.com

We are a research institute that is driving a philosophy called “Life Mein Marks” which is the next generation schooling system of India in line with New Education Policy. It’s coming from deep understanding of Psychology of a child and the changing & strange time we are in.

We provide - Excellent pay, Fun environment, Flex hours, Exposure to renowned Global Management

Join us - A milestone simply too critical to skip. Give shape to your dreams, scale new horizons and drive a revolution in a new era in education. E-mail your resume to jobs@GlobalDiscoveryAcademy.com

title: Psychologist
description:
***All queries regarding are to be sent to hr@mindtribe.in by email only, the HR team will revert to you.***
  
#### **Junior Psychologist**


This opportunity is open to Fresh Psychologists who have completed their Masters or MPhil degrees in Psychology. This job is NOT open to students who only have a bachelor’s degree. This job is only open those who have done an MA or MPhil in Psychology

* Probationary Period (11 months)
* This is a full-time job
* Upon completion of the probationary period you will absorbed in the company
* You cannot be working elsewhere/studying during this job
* This job carries a fixed salay
* This job carries monetary incentives in addition to the stipend
* The employee is a part of the Mental Health eco-system at Dr. Prerna Kohli & Associates / MindTribe.in
* During this probationary period you are mentored extensively, and work closely with an experienced psychologist
* The work assigned is more in the nature of psychological research, and hands on counseling (under supervision).
* Extensive training is provided on social, commercial, soft, and technical skills required to be an exceptional psychologist
* This open to those who have less than 0-12 months of experience (excluding internships). DO NOT count your previous internships as experience while applying for this position

title: Psychologist
description:
**Qualification: MA/MSc Psychology**

**Experience: 0-1 year**

**Roles and Responsibilities**

* Conduct direct/online psychological assessments and intervention.
* Assessing clients’ behaviour and needs via observation, interviews and psychometric tests
* Developing, administering and monitoring appropriate treatment therapies and strategies
* Administers psychological tests and determines results.
* Develop treatment plan for each child.
* Address issues such as ASD, ADHD and learning difficulties in children by providing appropriate psychological intervention.
* Maintain appropriate and daily documentation of assessments and treatment plans.
* Provides counseling by leading group or individual sessions.
* Undertaking and participating research
* Writing and issuing reports for educational / interventional purpose
* Providing support and advice to careers
* Coach/mentor for other professionals who work with children with disabilities

title: Clinical Psychologist
description:
At Heart It Out, we care! We strive to provide accessible mental healthcare for all. This vision comes to life through skilled and compassionate individuals like you.
  

We are committed to making mental healthcare accessible to 1.5 billion people across India. Our therapeutic services, products, and events are carefully curated to cater to the community's mental health care needs.


The role of Clinical Psychologist would require you to meet with our clients and work with them to sort out any emotional or motivational issue that may arise. This role would also require you to work with the clients to identify problems, if any, in emotional, mental and behavioural areas and follow with therapy and adequate support.


Masters Degree in Clinical psychology or Mphil Degree in Clinical psychology or Doctorate in Clinical psychology.
Analytical and Scientific approach coupled with Lateral thinking.
Ability to observe, assess, and record symptoms, reactions, and progress.
Interviewing and psychological/ developmental evaluation skills.
Ability to evaluate the progress of therapeutic programs and to make individual modifications.
Knowledge of psychological test administration, scoring, and interpretation.
We appreciate individuals who can take on initiative and responsibility.
We appreciate individuals who can take on initiative and responsibility.
Apply relevant current special education methodologies and techniques.
Knowledge of crisis intervention techniques.


Ability to effectively communicate medical information, test results, diagnoses and/or proposed treatment in a manner easily understood by the client.
Ability to maintain emotional stability to cope with human suffering, emergencies, and other stresses.
Skill in preparing and maintaining detailed records.
Ability to communicate effectively, both orally and in writing.
Compassion, empathy and cultural sensitivity.


Being non-judgemental and professionalism are much appreciated.
Diagnose and evaluate mental and emotional disorders and provide counseling, psychotherapy and follow-up care.
Formulate plans of treatment, and provide referral to other mental health professionals based on assessments.
Provide crisis intervention in situations requiring immediate psychological treatment.
Participate in educational programs, in-service meetings, clinician meetings, and workshops to enhance professional development.
Instruct and direct students serving psychological internships.
Develop and implement clinical and non clinical research programs.
Develop, manage and implement mental health projects in collaboration with other professionals.
Maintain a social and medical profile on the Internet and different social media platforms.
Attend and participate in peer supervision, and continuous learning.
Evaluate future potential psychologists that enter the ecosystem.
Consults with other therapists and related professional and paraprofessional staff in the performance of therapeutic & managerial roles and casework.
  
Competitive Compensation


Flexible Hours


Home Office Option


Generous Holiday


Feel Invested


Office Parties & Outings


Birthday Gifts


Pet Friendly Office

title: Clinical Psychologist
description:
* Job Description

	+ We are looking for a clinical psychologist (M.Phil, Clinical Psychology) to counsel people, supervise and build quality protocols, develop and help in delivering self-help modules for various developmental programs, workshops etc.
* Responsibilities

	+ Providing Counselling to clients (Chat/Telephonic/F2F)
	+ Becoming the quality gatekeeper (Supervision/Quality Reviews)
	+ Handling red flag cases (suicidal tendencies)
	+ Training Experts and setting protocols for quality counseling on the platform
	+ Creating/ Supervising various self-help modules
* Requirement

	+ MPhil in Clinical Psychology (RCI license)
	+ Belief in the effectiveness of online counselling
	+ Great Communication Skills (written and verbal)
	+ Ability to organise and design programs
	+ A good network of psychologists is a major plus

title: Senior Psychologist
description:
* Job Description

	+ We are looking for smart people who believe in the power of transforming someone's life by listening to their problems and providing them with a helping hand. Not only they are wonderful counselors but also willing to go an extra mile and build a community of experts.
* Responsibilities

	+ Spearheading the counseling quality (through supervision/quality reviews etc)
	+ Building training modules and therapy programs
	+ Taking workshops and seminars
	+ Providing counseling to clients (Chat/Telephonic/F2F)
* Requirement

	+ Minimum Masters in Psychology (MPhil in Clinical Psychology Preferred)
	+ More than 5 years of counseling experience
	+ Belief in the effectiveness of online counselling
	+ Great Communication Skills (written and verbal)
	+ Ability to manage people and teams
	+ Ability to organise and design programs

title: Psychologist
description:
* Job Description

	+ We are looking for a psychologist proficient in speaking Telugu. The role would involve online counselling (chat, audio, video), telephonic counseling. Remote work is allowed but being based in Bangalore and working from office would be a great plus.
* + We are providing counseling support to our clients 24x7. Interested people should be willing to work in rotational shifts and working in the night shifts.
* Role

	+ Providing Counselling to clients (chat/Audio/Video)
	+ Providing telephonic counseling to clients
	+ Becoming the quality gatekeeper (Supervision/Quality Reviews)
	+ Creating various self-help modules
* Requirement

	+ Minimum Masters in Psychology completed
	+ Fresher / less than 2 years of experience
	+ Belief in the effectiveness of online counselling
	+ Must have proficient Telugu speaking skills
	+ Experience with Addiction related clients is a plus
	+ Bangalore based (working out of office) would be a plus
	+ Willing to work in the rotational shift with weekday as weekly off
